220	president barack obama commemorated the end of the korean conflict and laid a wreath at the korean war veterans memorial on the national mall, as he highlighted the importance of respecting and caring for u.s. veterans, particularly those involved in the "forgotten war." over 36,000 u.s. troops died and 103,000 were wounded in the three-year conflict, and more than 7,900 u.s. troops remain missing. obama acknowledged the need to reunite veterans with their families as the nation draws down from over a decade of war in afghanistan.
221	a woman named jade jacob-brooks, who never existed in paper records of her birth, has become a born-again citizen after a 4.5-year campaign to obtain a birth certificate. jade, who was born in spain to british parents on holiday, faced challenges as she aged, such as not being able to obtain a job or passport, due to not having proof of her existence. after being given a birth certificate by the spanish government, jade can now live more independently and legally. 
222	the international fund for animal welfare (ifaw) is appealing for cotton pouches to aid in caring for injured and orphaned native animals affected by the recent bushfires in south australia and victoria, such as koalas, kangaroos, wallabies, possums, and wombats. wildlife carers use simple cotton pouches to keep the animals warm and safe.
223	u.s. and south korean troops began a 10-day military exercise around seoul, with u.s. commander calling it "defense-oriented" during a period of heightened tensions with the north. the annual "ulchi freedom guardian" exercise involves approximately 530,000 troops from both nations, and computer-assisted simulations. the u.n. has notified north korean counterparts to the exercise, while no peace treaty has ended the 1950-1953 korean war.
224	trainee pilot and instructor survived a dramatic plane crash-landing at an air base, where their tucano trainer failed to lower its undercarriage during its approach to the runway. both men walked away unhurt, but the aircraft suffered serious damage and came to rest on grass. the incident occurred at royal air force (raf) linton-on-ouse, north yorkshire, affecting the airport's operations, as the runway remained closed. the causes of the crash are still under investigation.
225	alex hales has been named in england's 15-man squad for the royal london series against india, a move that could see him replacing ian bell as the opening partner for alastair cook, who would be leading the team. hales has recently been in excellent form at county limited-overs cricket and twenty20, and this opportunity highlights his potential for success in 50-over international arena. the squad contains key players like captain alastair cook and jason roy, and is set to commence on august 25.
226	a scottish farmer is facing a potential loss of over £300,000 ($430,000 usd) as his daffodil crop arrives a week early due to severe winter weather in february that led to a delayed bloom. the unexpectedly early bloom has caused crops from both england and scotland to arrive at the same time, causing a market flood with low prices.
227	on new year's day, many people are returning unwanted christmas gifts, with a report showing that today could see more gift exchanges than any other day. the number of returns is increasing due to the rise of online shopping and long hours of shopping centres being open throughout britain. according to the firm lcp consulting, 29 million unwanted presents are expected to be returned online alone with an estimated value of £600 million, and many of these returns happen in person because of quicker refunds and sales. this creates extra pressure on shops and retailers to improve their refund process for future success.
228	mcdonald's has opened its first vietnamese outlet in ho chi minh city, attracting thousands of customers. ho chi minh's new addition to its culinary offerings is reflective of vietnam's growing appetite for american fast-food chains, despite average monthly wages being around $150 and the cost of a big mac being $2.82.
229	wisconsin governor scott walker will soon launch a new political organization and has hired a national political strategist, rick wiley, to serve as his potential campaign manager if he decides to run for president in 2016. this is the latest move of big-name republicans considering bids for the white house after the new year. governor walker's moves are being carefully watched by other potential presidential aspirants.
230	over 200 people survived a shipwreck near the congo river, but about 100 people are still missing. the mb mobek carrying merchandise struck an obstacle and sank. the boat's manifest is not available, and the cause of the accident, as well as its exact location, are under investigation.
231	nine lost episodes of the british television series "doctor who" have been discovered in nigeria, following their recovery from a dusty store room. they date back to the 1960s and include a six-episode story. the newly found programs introduce alistair lethbridge-stewart, known as the brigadier, starring patrick troughton as the second doctor. the episodes' recovery is a treasure for the show's fans, as over 200 episodes are still missing.
232	lake mead, america's largest reservoir and las vegas' main water source, is projected to reach its lowest level since it was filled nearly 80 years ago due to crippling drought and has currently fallen to about 40% capacity. the reservoir's water level is expected to reach a record low of approximately 1,080 feet above sea level this week and continue to drop in the next two years. while us bureau of reclamation regional chief terry fulp assured that lake water restrictions would not be necessary for the 40 million people across america's southwest, the low water levels in lake mead would continue to impact local tourism and recreation.
233	a 3-year-old police dog, a belgian malinois named spartacus, died of heat stroke after being left inside his handler's parked patrol car in woodstock, georgia. the police department conducted a necropsy, but the investigation is ongoing. the cause of death was determined to be due to heat stroke. the k9 handler will face administrative leave, and a memorial service for spartacus is planned.
234	the 2019 riba stirling prize shortlist features a range of cutting-edge architectural projects, including london's shard and the library of birmingham with its "harry potter-style rotunda" and willy wonka glass lift. among other entrants are liverpool's everyman theatre, the london aquatic centre, the london school of economics saw swee hock student centre, and manchester school of art. the prize will be awarded to the best new building.
235	in 2012, a blind asian elephant named duchess received the world's largest-ever cataract operation at paignton zoo in devon, restoring her sight in one eye. she received anesthesia from anesthetists david burton and jo jago, and operation was led by vet jim carter. although she was groggy after the operation, it helped her see clearly again and her welfare and quality of life are a priority. she could have ten more years of life if it remains successful.
236	baghdad, iraq (cnn) - iraq will file a lawsuit against five blackwater security guards who were cleared of manslaughter charges in the 2007 killing of 17 iraqi civilians. an iraqi government official called it murder. iraq will also ask the us justice department to appeal a federal judge's dismissal of the charges.
237	a £200,000 ferrari was spotted stuck on a beach in cornwall after being used during a fashion shoot for official ferrari magazine. the car, a 458 spider valued at £198,936, was being driven by the carrs dealership in exeter onto the private watergate bay beach, owned by the watergate bay hotel, for the photo shoot. the lime green vehicle has a top speed of 200 miles per hour and is capable of going from 0-60 miles per hour in less than three seconds, and was later extracted from the sand by a tractor and trailer.
238	golf champion rory mcilroy ended a frustrating 2013 with a triumph in the australian open, defeating adam scott by one shot. mcilroy had to overcome some late mistakes made by scott, who had previously led the tournament. mcilroy will now aim to recover from a disappointing season with the new additions to his management team and his father, gerry, joining the ranks. overall, mcilroy was pleased with the outcome and demonstrated improvement in his performance.
239	the navy is temporarily putting a halt on forcing female recruits to cut their hair short before entering a boot-camp pilot program. instead, starting this year, recruits can keep their hair long, as long as it meets overall grooming policies such as maintaining in a bun. the trial aims to standardize training and education across the military services.
240	the new stonehenge visitor center and remodeled landscape allow for a more immersive experience for visitors to appreciate the ancient site's history and mysterious presence. the center, a $44 million investment by english heritage, features an elegant modern pavilion, which acts as the gateway to the historic monument and offers a sense of anticipation and drama. the focus is not only on preserving the area’s landscape but also providing a virtual display, simulation experiences, and exposure to archaeological finds to help visitors better understand the site's evolution and significance.
241	ryanair ranked as the second-worst global brand for simplicity of use and was criticized for its badly-designed website, poor customer service, and complicated pricing. despite improving its reputation, ceo michael o'leary said customer satisfaction ratings disproven the survey, as the airline was profitable and growing steadily.
242	a new study found that men who beat cancer and burned over 12,600 kilojoules (or 3,011 calories) a week through exercise nearly halved their risk of death. regular exercise is known to improve life expectancy for healthy individuals, but this study highlighted its beneficial impact on cancer survivors as well. the research suggests that physical activities should be actively promoted to cancer survivors to enhance longevity.
243	a recovery worker, mark wootton, miraculously survived a hit-and-run incident involving a lorry. he suffered a broken back and two fractured vertebrae as a result. the driver, terence poolman, admitted causing serious injury by dangerous driving and was subsequently sentenced to eight months in jail and banned from driving for two years. mark wootton continues to experience pain and still hasn't yet returned to work, leaving uncertainty regarding his job prospects.
244	china's experimental spacecraft, currently studying the moon and set to re-enter earth's atmosphere this weekend, has captured incredible images as a precursor to a mission to the lunar surface in 2017. the mission intends to study lunar re-entry and validate the spacecraft's guidance and control systems.
245	a pair of criminals who planned to break into a museum and steal chinese artwork worth £1.8m deny smashing a wall and taking the precious artifacts during a high-stakes raid at durham university's oriental museum. the 18th century jade bowl and dehua porcelain piece were taken during a night-time break-in in april 2012.
246	two anti-violence activists, nikole ardeno and emanuel velez, were charged with severely beating their former roommate and fellow campaigner, joshua magraff, after accusing him of burglary upon entering their residence. both were wearing anti-violence t-shirts at the time of the incident, which occurred in washington, pennsylvania. police believe they attacked magraff as he collected his belongings, having already moved out. the group the defendants are associated with, 'stop the violence,' released a statement indicating that they do not tolerate violence and will investigate the allegations.
247	on monday, the u.s. deported honduran children as young as 1-1/2 years old, marking the first flight since president obama pledged to expedite the deportation process for illegal immigrant minors from central america. fleeing violence and poverty, record numbers of children from honduras, el salvador, and guatemala have crossed into the united states over the past year, raising intense debate about how to solve the problem. monday's flight from new mexico to san pedro sula returned 17 honduran women, as well as 12 girls and 9 boys, aged between 18 months and 15 years.
248	more than a third of americans believe aliens exist, and over 10% have seen a ufo in the sky. the national geographic channel survey found that 80 million americans or 36% are certain alien spaceships exist, with 79% believing the white house has kept information about other lifeforms a secret. nearly one in four americans would befriend an alien if it came to their door, and only 2% would try to inflict harm.
249	the cuban government announced a shift in policy allowing its athletes to play professionally abroad, potentially benefiting the nation through taxation revenue. previously, cuban athletes seeking professional opportunities had to defect to international leagues; however, the new policy could allow them to make more financially without leaving the island. the policy includes restrictions on the freedom athlete's independence, such as still requiring approvals to travel. the united states has imposed an economic embargo on cuba, which would complicate athletes potentially earning money in the us. the cuban government plans to allow its athletes to pay taxes in the us but will be challenged with enforcing this given the ongoing us embargo.
250	two missouri farmers contracted a new virus, the 'heartland virus', after being bitten by ticks. belonging to the phlebovirus family, many insect-borne, it had not been detected before. although their blood count was low, both patients were treated with antibiotics, which initially appeared to help, but their conditions continued to worsen. eventually, genetic material identified the 'heartland virus', causing general symptoms, as a new species. the cdc believes amblyomma americanum, or lone star tick, may be one of the hosts for the virus. researchers are now working to identify any risk factors and hosts for the virus.
251	one of britain's largest frozen food manufacturers, mccain's, may be partially responsible for a massive landslip at knipe point, north yorkshire. the incident has led 55 to 60 homes to be at risk of collapse, causing fear among the coastal community. this potential blame is due to leaked oil and grease from a burst pipe into the land, according to leaked papers. the manufacturing firm has been active in the area for four decades and is known for its environmental policies, but residents claim the firm has not done enough to prevent geological issues in the area.
252	three men wanted in connection with a reported racist incident involving chelsea football fans on a paris metro train have been identified, with the metropolitan police now working alongside the french authorities.
253	tropical storm fay soaked parts of east-central florida, dumping more than 30 inches of rain in some areas. nasa reported receiving 21 inches of rain from the storm, and the national hurricane center expects the storm to continue producing copious amounts of rain across the region. the storm has caused historic flooding and may hit florida's northern coast as a landfall again; however, it remains still a significant threat. it has caused one storm-related death due to carbon monoxide fumes from a gas-powered generator during emergencies. coastal areas remained evacuated and alert.
254	locals in praia da luz have expressed their anger towards scotland yard's re-investigation into the disappearance of madeleine mccann by spraying road signs with graffiti, stating "stop mccann circus" as part of their frustration. four "persons of interest" were quizzed in portugal as part of the metropolitan police's multi-million-pound probe, leading to concerns regarding potential damage to the local tourist industry. despite portugal and uk police searching three sites in praia da luz for clues in june, no evidence relating to the case was found. a former scotland yard commander, roy ramm, has suggested searching an abandoned well near the apartment where madeleine disappeared due to its potential connection to the case. 
255	scottish football fans took over london's trafalgar square on august 14, 2013, ahead of scotland's international friendly match with england at wembley stadium. up to 4,000 supporters took over the square and transformed the area, with fans wearing kilts and football shirts, and displaying inflatable swords, ginger wigs, and saltire flags. although there was some minor damage to public property, the match was celebrated as an opportunity for scottish pride.
256	a 42-year-old rwandan citizen, jean léonard teganya, was arrested on the maine/canada border for war crimes related to the rwandan genocide in the 1990s. he was wanted for deportation and in violation of human rights under the crimes against humanity and war crimes act. teganya was discovered in the houlton, maine, area near the canadian border on august 3rd and was turned over to u.s. immigration and customs enforcement's office of enforcement and removal operations.
257	tens of thousands of people in the philippines have fled their homes as scientists warn that the mayon volcano is about to erupt. the government has raised the alert status of the country's most active volcano and instructed the military and police to enforce a "no man's land" rule around the danger zone. authorities have found it difficult to enforce the warnings, as villagers continue to venture into the restricted areas to check on their homes and farms. the volcano has erupted 49 times since its first documented eruption in 1616, with its most violent event occurring in 1814, killing over 1,200 people.
258	a businessman named carl weininger bought the world's most expensive dessert worth £22,000 as a 'pick-me-up' to cheer himself up after being dumped by his girlfriend. the dessert, styled like a faberge egg, contained gold, champagne caviar, and a diamond, and mr weininger took it to an event at the sofitel hotel, where lucky guests sampled it. he expressed that it was a great morale booster and the response has been overwhelmingly positive.
259	ariel castro's daughter who was in prison for slashing her baby's throat revealed that she went to school with amanda berry. both were in the same elementary school, and this means that castro allegedly used his daughters to meet the three women he held captive in his house for ten years. emily castro, along with her sisters, condemned their father for his actions. castro plans to plead not guilty to charges of kidnapping and rape of the three women.
260	negative attacks in american politics have a long history, dating back to the early days of the republic. candidates have continuously attacked each other with vigor, reaching an all-time low in the 2008 campaign, with the use of misleading and inaccurate political appeals. this has become a concern for voters who must remain vigilant regarding candidate, party, and group claims. critics hope that debates and non-partisan websites, such as factcheck.org, will help voters decipher the competing charges and counter-charges amid considerable noises from all sides.
261	a new arrival to the doughnut-croissant craze is the yumdough, a hybrid doughnut-croissant pastry introduced by waitrose. made with a 144-layer dough, the yumdough comes in four flavors with sugar icing, filling, and fondant. initially sold at 40 waitrose branches for £1.49, the yumdough comes in a limited-time offer with a generous 25% off introductory offer.
262	on february 8, 22-year-old ashleigh cox, a brigham young university student from colorado springs, was snowshoeing and tubing with friends at tibble fork reservoir, utah, when an avalanche caused by the group disrupting snow carried cox into a stream. the group took 20 minutes to dig the student out from the snow, and bystanders eventually called emergency services. emergency responders were not sent to the scene, delaying cox's rescue and potentially causing more damage to her body in the process. cox was later rushed to the hospital but was ultimately taken off life support the following day. this incident led to an investigation by the fire chief and utah valley dispatch, who concluded that proper response mechanisms were not in place at that time.
263	cardiff city council is considering once-a-month bin and black bag collections as part of their efforts to increase waste recycling by 70% by 2025. however, this move is faced with public outrage and has been rejected by communities and local government secretary eric pickles. households that recycle more will face lower charges, and the council is considering a 'pay as you throw' charge based on the quantity of waste collected and the introduction of smaller bins to minimize waste.
264	latin american countries, including brazil, colombia, guatemala, and mexico, will hold a summit to discuss the escalating violence and drug trafficking problems in the region, as well as ways to address them collectively. the presidents of these countries will come together to ensure that their shared problems with cartels and drug trafficking are dealt with, as it could threaten regional security and spill over into the united states.
265	the iconic movie dance moment from the film "dirty dancing" has been voted the top dance scene of all time. the scene, which features patrick swayze and jennifer grey dancing, received over a quarter of the votes in a survey, beating "singin' in the rain" and others. more than half of brits surveyed attempted to copy the dance moves, with "dirty dancing" voted the favourite for weight loss methods and being ranked as a more preferred exercise than playing sports.
266	singer christina aguilera joined fellow grammy award winners alicia keys and john legend for "cnn heroes: an all-star tribute" aired on thanksgiving night. the event, held at the kodak theatre in hollywood, featured the top 10 cnn heroes of 2008, who were honored with a documentary and a $25,000 prize. among the top 10 winners were tad aguoglia, yohannes gebregeorgis, carolyn lecroy, anne mahlum, phymean noun, david puckett, maria ruiz, marie da silva, and viola vaughn, all chosen by a blue-ribbon panel.
267	manchester united won 4-0 against wigan to stay top of the english premier league with a seven-point lead. robin van persie and javier hernandez scored two goals apiece, with van persie becoming the team's leading scorer. manchester city maintained its second place with a 3-0 victory over stoke city, with sergio aguero scoring his first goal. meanwhile, tottenham hotspur won 3-1 against reading, while aston villa secured a draw against swansea after danny graham's injury-time equalizer.
268	the rivers nursery orchard near sawbridgeworth, hertfordshire, is a historic fruit tree nursery established in 1725 which is home to numerous rare apple, peach, nectarine, plum, cherry, apricot, and pear varieties. once accounting for 300 acres of orchards, it has now reduced to under five acres due to development but continues to be cultivated by enthusiastic local volunteers. the orchard is a symbol of the decline of britain's orchards, with two-thirds of them disappearing since world war ii. as foreign varieties such as gala and cox's orange pippin continue to thrive, traditional british-bred apple varieties face a difficult future.
269	self-help author james arthur ray faces prison time after being charged with three counts of reckless manslaughter in connection with the deaths of two people during a sweat lodge ceremony at a retreat center in sedona, arizona in 2009.
270	on monday, tourists witnessed a rare and deadly attack between pods of killer whales and dolphins in canada's nanaimo departure bay. the whales lured the dolphins into the bay and proceeded to savagely attack them, with onlookers helpless to intervene. the battle was intense, with the whales ultimately eating two dolphins before darting away, leaving the others to flounder. experts warn that such attacks could become more frequent as both dolphin and whale populations in the area continue to increase.
271	the oregon supreme court ruled that a 12-year-old boy named "m" should have a say in whether he gets circumcised, sending a parental custody dispute back to the trial court. both sides cannot reach an agreement, sparking disagreements over the boy's religious upbringing, with james boldt arguing that as the primary caregiver and a converted jew, he has the right to practice his faith for his child. meanwhile, lia boldt countered that her son does not want to go through with the procedure, citing its invasiveness, irreversibility, and potential dangers.
272	a memphis woman, rose fayne, has been charged with elder abuse and neglect, resulting in the death of 77-year-old betty cleveland, who was initially taken in by fayne. betty's horrifyingly neglected legs rotted from the inside out when hospice care workers found her in her home on the 3700 block of joslyn, tennessee. betty had her daughter and son, rodney cleveland, arrested and charged alongside rose fayne. surprisingly, neighbors nearby did not know any of the family members living at the home despite waving and speaking to them, as reported by local media outlets.
273	uk prime minister david cameron is preparing to propose eu reform reforms ahead of a referendum, focusing on regulations that cost more than £27 billion a year and outweigh benefits. eu leaders gather to discuss growth and competitiveness, while open europe reports estimated costs outweigh benefits in 24 of 100 most costly eu regulations. 
274	gelada baboons, who are sociable monkeys in ethiopia's simien mountain range, wake up before dawn and climb to the highest vantage point to enjoy the spectacular sunrise. photographer simone sbaraglia captured stunning images of the baboons as they played, groomed and interacted with each other while watching the sun rise over the mountains. the geladas live in large groups and primarily eat grass, making the heights of the mountains perfect for their lifestyle. the photographer spent three weeks observing and photographing the baboons, which allowed him to capture intimate and beautiful images of both the sunrise and gelada species.
275	bones found on the roof of a closed funeral home in chicago, illinois, have led to investigation by authorities, who discovered unpreserved remains upon searching the facility. grieving relatives demand answers regarding the treatment of their loved ones' remains. the owner of carter funeral chapels, henry carter, denies any wrongdoing, claiming the violation notice issued for providing inadequate care was a misunderstanding. the medical examiner's office is determining whether the discovered bones are human in nature, while authorities continue their investigation.
276	actor and iraq war veteran j.r. martinez serves as the spokesperson for operation finally home, a nonprofit that provides custom-built homes for injured veterans. the organization was started by cnn's top 10 hero for 2012, dan wallrath. martinez recently discussed his involvement with cnn heroes, his recent success on dancing with the stars, and the efforts of operation finally home.
277	recent events showcase the iphone's app store experiencing issues with potentially objectionable content, as nude photos, and other potentially questionable photos, have been discovered and pulled from apps. this has raised questions about apple's ability to control content and potentially objectionable apps within its app store. apple has since removed these apps and implemented a parental-control system, providing age-appropriate labels within apps, allowing families to choose which types of content they would like to block.
278	raul gonzalez scored his 71st champions league goal to help schalke beat inter milan 2-1 and reach the semifinals, where they will face manchester united. schalke never looked likely to relinquish their first-leg advantage and secured their place in the last four with a 7-3 aggregate win.
279	donald trump has compared his decision to build an offshore wind farm near his £750 million scottish golf course issue to the release of the lockerbie bomber, alleging that the announcement by the scottish government to approve the controversial scheme was solely based on political interests.
280	charlotte mayor patrick cannon, a 47-year-old democrat, was arrested and accused of accepting more than $48,000 in bribes from undercover fbi agents posing as businessmen who wanted to do business with north carolina's largest city. cannon faces federal theft, bribery, and other charges. the investigation allegedly started in august 2010 after a tip from a local undercover officer regarding public corruption. 
281	a 28-year-old experienced jetskier was stranded on his jet ski in the middle of lake hume after his engine broke down during a 4.5-kilometer ride. he spent the night shivering in the cold and was miraculously rescued after being located 12 hours later by lake hume coast guard members. the man is now in good spirits and police advised people to be aware of water safety during the summer season.
282	thousands of people have been evacuated from their homes in munich as experts attempt to defuse a 550lb allied bomb dropped on the city during world war 2. the undetonated explosive was found beneath ground at the site of the former schwabinger 7 nightclub. bomb disposal teams fear its complex chemical fuse could trigger a repeat of the 2010 tragedy when three experts were killed in a blast in another german city.
283	this article discusses a cold snap affecting portions of the eastern united states, stating that extreme weather events like this are normal for this region, and that their severity is impacted by the atmosphere's inherent chaos. the occurrence of this cold snap is not disproved by global warming, as other scientists argue that global warming could actually cause these deliveries of cold air to arrive more frequently. however, further research is required to definitively establish these connections, and the relationship between global climate changes and short-term extreme weather remains a critical area of study.
284	egyptologists in the past have often undressed ancient mummies in their studies. today, researchers at the british museum are using a dual-energy ct scanner to study mummies without damaging their contents. this technology allows them to view and analyze the 3d models of internal organs, amulets, and bandages, providing fascinating insights into the lives of the ancient egyptians.
285	japanese researchers found high rice consumption, which includes eating lots of high gi foods, led to good quality sleep. scientists discovered that eating lots of rice can trigger a deep slumber while pasta and noodles can actually hinder sleep. eating food high on the gi (such as rice) was found to be associated with good quality sleep, as they release sugar in the blood more quickly, leading to spikes in blood sugar levels that last. a high gi diet may affect the quality of sleep because of the effects of tryptophan, an amino acid known for its tranquilizing effects and link to the sleep-inducing hormone melatonin.
286	in april 2009, vice visited iran to explore its renowned film culture. at that time, there were no signs of national discontent yet, as the country was preparing for elections and looking forward to a possible change with the soon-to-be-former president mahmoud ahmadinejad. the documentary highlights the challenges iranian filmmakers face in creating under extremely strict laws and religious norms, yet they continue to thrive and excel in the industry.
287	a study found that liverpool's bus lanes were not effectively improving traffic flow, and as a result, the city plans to remove nearly all of these lanes. only four bus lanes will be saved if the city council approves, and they could potentially operate at different times. the move is intended to improve travel speed for all road users, address opposition from motorists, and improve overall traffic flow in the city.
288	transgender former italian mp vladimir luxuria was arrested in sochi during the winter olympics for carrying a banner that read "it's ok to be gay." the arrest occurred within hours of luxuria posting a picture on twitter showing a rainbow umbrella and fan, with a message directed to russian president vladimir putin. luxuria returned to the olympic site after the italian government negotiated her release.
289	deviantart user oceanstarlet created the "disney girls tutorial," designed to help artists create a disney princess character. in the tutorial, she explains the differences between the disney princesses and eurocentric 'sugar cookie style' princesses, as well as the 'exotic style' princesses, including tips on drawing their bodies, eyes, and facial features. the tutorial is designed to educate its audience about disney's unrealistic beauty standards while being a helpful guide for creating a similar character.
290	a carer for holocaust survivor gertrude stanley has won her inheritance rights in court after a battle against a so-called 'heir hunter.' tanya vasileva looked after the elderly woman in her final years before her death in 2009, and had believed she had no living relatives. mrs stanley had made london her home after escaping vienna before ww2 began. vasileva, who had no other connection to the woman's estate, won the right to her belongings and will receive £20,000 from the inheritance. her friend and landlady's estate will also pay her a further £70,000 to cover the legal costs.
291	india is facing a massive obesity epidemic among its middle classes, particularly among its young wealthy population who prefer western fast food due to the western lifestyle associated with it. this trend is causing health problems further down the line as millions of indians struggle to cope with increasing obesity rates and an expected doubling of the fast food market by 2016. wealthy indians are particularly susceptible to the lure of plentiful advertising and the promise of a western lifestyle, causing the obesity crisis to swell in every major indian city. additionally, obese indians are turning towards western junk food to emulate affluent lifestyles while cutting back on physical activity, which is driving the demand for fast-food chains and putting other indian businesses at risk, such as street stalls. the obesity crisis is leading to a boom in plus-size clothing stores inspired by those in america, and causing health problems for an increasing number of children, leading to a rise in the number of obese adults.
292	nicholas overton, an escaped convict, carried out a series of robberies after being released on day leave from prison for work experience. he was only seven years into his 18-year sentence for a string of raids in 2006 when he was given this opportunity. overton worked at the chester branch of photo printing firm max spielman as part of a back-to-work scheme, before absconding with £1,500 from a closed business and embarking on a robbery spree across multiple shops. the escaped convict was eventually recaptured after 28 days on the run.
293	everton fans at a premier league match against west brom on monday night, including boxer tony bellew, will feature in the new rocky movie, creed. a camera crew filmed scenes near the 50-minute mark, and a message asking supporters to stay in their seats appeared on the big screen. stallone played a prominent role in the film creed and will reprise his character, rocky balboa, in the movie. a frustrating 0-0 draw against west brom did little to help the team's spirits.
294	a climate change action group, the australian youth climate coalition (aycc), faced backlash for a submitted billboard image that received criticism for allegedly equating coal mining to paedophilia. the aycc canceled the billboard's competition entry after social media comments about the content; it has since planned to display other climate change–focused signs in brisbane airport when g20 leaders arrive next month, urging the summiteers to address climate change as a topic during the meeting.
295	a self-proclaimed street preacher has been sentenced to death by a jury, despite his mother's plea for leniency. the ohio jury found that richard beasley had killed three down-and-out men who were lured by bogus craigslist job offers. victims' relatives hugged as they heard the jury's recommendation of death, with beasley's sentencing set for tuesday.
296	a new exhibition will combine rarely seen photos and artworks from world war 1, revealing a human tragedy through personal stories, experiences, and the medical effects on soldiers. the display features images from the russian, british, and nepalese perspectives, with a focus on brave, resilient, and courageous individuals such as mata hari, maria bochkareva, edith cavell, and kulbir thapa, among many others. the exhibition at the national portrait gallery in february delves into the emotional and physical impacts of the horrifying circumstances of one of the first documented wars. 
297	us media giant viacom has acquired channel 5 from richard desmond's northern & shell for £450 million, marking the first time an american broadcaster will control one of the uk's five free-to-air channels. channel 5, which primarily broadcasts british reality shows like 'big brother,' has gained popularity since desmond's acquisition in 2010, and viacom believes that its strategic move in the uk market will create a strong competitor in the commercial public service broadcasting industry. 
298	a bag containing ammunition matching the type used in the recent shooting in tucson, arizona, has been found and is believed to belong to arizona shooting suspect jared lee loughner. the bag has been transferred to fbi custody for further analysis. the ammunition found inside the bag includes a match for the type used on the date of the massacre. further investigation into the bag has revealed other items that may link the contents to loughner, indicating his actions, location, and movements leading up to the shooting.
299	a sick fan of howard stern, known for disrupting live tv broadcasts with pranks, called in to nbc news network during mh17 coverage and claimed the plane was shot down by a fart from the shock jock. anchor krystal ball, not realizing she was being pranked, asked the "witness" for more details.
300	scientists have discovered hidden plates deep within the earth's mantle, which rewrite 40 years of history about the evolution of western north america. it was once thought that the mountainous west was formed by the movement of the farallon plate, a process similar to that of groceries moving across a conveyor belt. with the discovery of these plates, the process appears to have been far more complex. the tectonic plates help explain north america's violent tectonic history and provide a new understanding of the process which formed the continent's western margin. the impact of the collisions can trigger rapid geographic changes, affecting climate, ocean circulation, biological processes, and economically important mineral deposits.
301	a swedish man had his rape conviction overturned because an appeal court heard that the alleged assault could have been the result of 'sexsomnia'. experts testified that the man had no memory of the incident and was asleep at the time. doctors diagnosed sexsomnia, a sleep disorder where people engage in sexual behaviour while asleep and have no recall afterward.
302	the topic of perfect white christmases from the past is frequently discussed around festive dinner tables, yet according to government forecasters, white christmases have become more common in recent years. the map created by us government forecasters shows that while there were generally more white christmases in the past, only in a few specific areas, the ground was snow-covered more frequently in recent years. the data is based on observations by the rutgers snow lab and shows that, compared to the past for the whole country and taking into account regional differences, there have been more white christmases between 1990 to 2013 than between 1966 to 1989 in the u.s. 
303	louise boyle, a wealthy mother-of-five, is suing a gardening company for alleged fraud amounting to $3 million. the claim arose after boyle, who had inherited millions from her late husband, gave up two chinese daughters she had adopted and tried to exclude them from her husband's estate. she is now seeking damages against her ex-husband's landscaping company for overcharging her by $3 million. 
304	a 76-year-old patient, kathleen gummer, was admitted to a busy london hospital with suspected heart failure. she was rushed to the a&e but had to wait 18 hours for a bed because staff couldn't find one for her on a ward, despite her condition. her daughter expressed shock and concern about the situation, as it was just the latest in a series of issues faced by the hospital. the hospital apologized for the wait but defended their decision to keep it open, arguing that they were overwhelmed by cases like kathleen's due to other unforeseen conditions and hospital emergencies.
305	a woman who approached police claiming to have been approached by a man in a nightclub, later identified as mitchell pearce, after he grabbed her and squeezed her breasts and buttocks, said she had been approached by two roosters players. mitchell pearce has since denied all allegations that any inappropriate incident occurred between him and the woman. pearce was later arrested for allegedly not leaving a licensed premises by his own accord, and has been fined and temporarily banned.
306	the flood christian church, attended by michael brown's father and family, was one of the 13 buildings burned down during protests in ferguson in november 2014. pastor carlton lee suspects that white supremacists, not protesters, were responsible for the destruction and believes the church was targeted because he has repeatedly called for the arrest of officer wilson. brown sr. has pledged to help repair the church that was once a car dealership, and pastor lee says they will "rebuild" and not "stop."
307	ambulance services in the uk are struggling due to increased demand, meaning firemen are increasingly being used as makeshift medical help. this is concerning as firemen have only basic medical training and limited equipment like bandages. ambulance staff shortages are causing overstaffing and long waiting times for patients. over a 36-hour period, 13 hospitals across england were forced into a "major incident" due to the number of patients arriving at a&e, causing them to cancel non-urgent operations and divert patients to overflowing departments.
308	luxury fashion house armani plans to open a £100 million luxury hotel in the heart of london, near trafalgar square and buckingham palace. a design overhaul will be required for admiralty arch, a grade i listed building built in memory of queen victoria in 1912, which is estimated to cost around £175 million to restore. the armani hotel is expected to open in december 2015, featuring 80 to 100 guest rooms, royal and presidential suites, and a restaurant and bar, with initial estimates suggesting each room will cost around £600,000 to kit out.
309	qpr defender rio ferdinand revealed his love for reality tv shows like gogglebox and the fried chicken shop, but stated he would never appear on them. in his autobiography #2sides, he stated, "you will never see me on strictly (come dancing) ever, no chance. i know david seaman and robbie savage have, but it's just not me." although he enjoyed his experiences with tv like starring in 2006's rio's world cup wind-ups, he said he would do more comedy when he retired, possibly enjoying more pranks like he did in that show.
310	kit symons is one step closer to securing the permanent fulham manager position as their temporary caretaker manager, with potential competition including chris hughton and steve clarke. since taking over last month, symons has been effective in turning the team's fortunes, leading to four wins from seven matches. on friday, he faces a competitive charlton match with a chance to lift fulham out of the relegation zone.
311	toronto mayor rob ford was allegedly involved in a criminal investigation called project traveller, where he tried to buy a damaging video. police have obtained court documents claiming suspects mentioned receiving an offer of $5,000, a car, selling the tape to toronto star newspaper and an unnamed website for 100 or 150, referring to $100,000 or $150,000. these conversations do not reveal any specifics about the video's content. after media outlets claimed ford last winter using crack cocaine, he admitted to smoking crack cocaine, but did not provide a reason to resign. despite this, he refused to resign and declared a war on the city council.
312	a man in aspen, colorado tried to deliver bombs as christmas presents to two banks, threatening "mass death" if they did not turn over tens of thousands of dollars. the man, identified as james blanning, later died in an apparent suicide after dropping bombs intended for other banks. no one was injured and the bombs were detonated. the situation caused significant disruptions and financial losses in the area, with authorities estimating losses "in the millions".
313	a 23-year-old university student, max witkowski, jumped to his death on the morning of an exam. max's girlfriend informed authorities that he kissed her goodbye and rushed around the house before the exam, seemingly in typical boy behavior. no apparent cause has been found for max's death, which remains a mystery despite his girlfriend and parents' absence of any significant issues in his life. an inquest recorded an open verdict and suggests the possibility of a one-time psychotic episode as the cause.
314	four huge castles in scotland would not be hit by the mansion tax, which is currently planned by labour in the uk, however, high property prices in london would make even modest homeowners liable for the charge. the tax, currently planned to levy an annual charge on properties worth over £2 million, would mostly impact london and its south-east areas, where many ordinary family homes might fall within its boundaries.
315	the tragic death of trayvon martin raises concerns about racial profiling, police injustice, and the need for accountability. despite the numerous examples of police mistreatment, community members struggle to gain faith in law enforcement. the case highlights the flaws of the "duty to retreat" and "stand your ground" laws, and the need for meaningful reform.
316	a film has been released showing the moment isis militants blew up the burial site of biblical character jonah in mosul, north-west iraq. in the past week, almost a dozen shia and sunni religious shrines have been destroyed by isis militants in mosul and the town of tal afar. isis militants believe giving special veneration to tombs and relics is against the teachings of islam.
317	a day after the death penalty case of jodi arias left the jury hung, the foreman william zervakos detailed the decision-making process as intense and emotional, sharing that everyone decided based on their own personal opinions. zervakos said he believed the defendant was mentally and verbally abused but emphasized that it does not excuse the brutal crime she committed. the retrial of the penalty phase of the case is set to begin on july 18th, with the jury having deliberated for 13 hours in the penalty phase before reaching the deadlock.
318	actor-comedian tracy morgan has been moved from a hospital to a rehabilitation facility as he continues to recover from a serious auto accident in new jersey. morgan, best known for his role in 30 rock, suffered broken ribs and legs in the accident. he has been released from the rehab facility and is currently suing walmart, after one of the company's truck drivers struck his limo, leaving morgan seriously injured. meanwhile, comedian ardie fuqua is in critical condition and morgan's assistant, jeffrey millea, has been upgraded from serious to fair condition.
319	on december 7, 2013, the united states navy officially named and christened the most expensive and deadliest aircraft carrier ever built, the uss gerald ford. the $13 billion warship was launched from the newport news, virginia, naval yard. the us navy's newest generation aircraft carrier will be operational in 2016 and is designed to last for five decades. the ship features advanced technology, including an electromagnetic aircraft launch system and catapult, which allows it to launch 220 airstrikes per day from its two runways. this technology makes the ship virtually invisible to enemy radar.
320	millions are traveling for summer holidays, but those who chose to stay in the uk are faced with the end of the heatwave and a gloomy forecast of torrential downpours and potential flooding in certain regions. the met office issued yellow rain warnings for several areas and advised residents to be aware of the risk of localized flooding, especially with the start of storms. the environment agency had 10 flood alerts in place across the uk before downgrading seven earlier warnings.
321	a rare white mother bear, leading her adorable little cub to learn how to catch fish, was captured in stunning photographs by kyle breckenridge in the great bear rainforest, british columbia, canada. the white bears, also known as "kermode" or "spirit" bears, are a subspecies of the black bear, estimated to have a population of less than 1,000. the mother bear, an expert fisher, and the little cub went home empty-handed, with the mother taking home a salmon for their dinner. despite being rare and protected, white bear sightings are becoming more frequent in the area, with experts estimating less than 10,000 white bears worldwide.
322	a man pretending to be a good samaritan helped an intoxicated woman who had lost her friends to get home but instead took her to his house and raped her. the man, identified as rajedmiah miah, has been sentenced to six years in jail and will be registered on the sex offender list for life.

324	two electricians have designed the world's first portable turbine phone charger, the trinity, that uses wind power alone. it has a 15-watt generator and a 15,000mah battery, allowing users to charge any usb-powered item. the turbine folds into a 12-inch (30 cm) cylinder and unfolds into a vertical turbine to capture the wind and generate power. the product is on a crowdfunding campaign, and the creators hope to have it commercially available by the start of next year.
325	an elderly couple, who were on a boat when it caught fire on the river ouse estuary, were rescued by the royal national lifeboat institution crew. the scene was witnessed by mr. nick and linda hitchen, who were near their home in east yorkshire. four fire engines arrived at the scene, but they were unable to help; the boat was destroyed by the intense flames and sank within an hour. both people on board were rescued unhurt. it highlights the importance of ensuring all safety and communication equipment is working before embarking on a journey.

331	north korean officials allowed a cnn team to meet with three american captives in pyongyang, but the interviews were closely managed by the regime, and each man was only given five minutes to speak. the government’s intention behind these interviews is to gather more u.s. attention, which could then lead to high-level dialogue with washington. the interviewed men said they hope the u.s. government will send an envoy to help get them out of their situations, possibly similar to how former president bill clinton helped secure the release of two journalists in 2009. north korea may want the u.s. to accept them as a nuclear weapons state or to lift sanctions against the regime.
332	enig hui, a petroleum engineer from miri, malaysia, has spent the last six years photographing underground stations from around the world. in his series, he aims to visually capture the drama inherent in the extreme symmetry and contrast found in underground architecture. hui has visited around 50 stations in locations such as england, vietnam, thailand, singapore, iceland, norway, denmark, the czech republic, and italy. he has mixed reviews from the public ranging from eerily empty, creepy or artistically beautiful.

334	house prices soared by 11.7% in a year, hitting a new record of £272,000. every region had increased prices, with london leading with a 19.1% increase. these growing costs create difficulty for first-time buyers, with prices far ahead of wages. the average price paid for a first home in july was £209,000. stamp duty is becoming increasingly common, with families forced to pay 3% in tax - £8,100 on the average house price.
335	a 29-year-old man named john eamer walked free from court after admitting that he punched a female cashier in the face at a bookies in a violent outburst. the victim, who was later identified as leanne vallis, was telling eamer that he lost a bet worth £1.30 when he threw the horrifying attack. the incident was caught on cctv, and police subsequently apprehended eamer. eamer received a 12-month community order, 200 hours of unpaid work, and £150 in compensation for vallis's injuries, £50 in court costs. he was previously jailed for 15 months in 2008 for assaulting a pensioner and another person while displaying aggression against more passers-by before being arrested.

339	a truck accident in salem, oregon resulted in the overturning of a truck carrying over 5,000 chickens. many of the chickens died or wandered aimlessly due to the crash. the people for the ethical treatment of animals (peta) proposed a 5-foot-tall, 250-pound statue of a giant bloody chicken on crutches memorializing the accident, but the oregon department of transportation denied the request, citing it as a potential hazard and distraction. this accident, along with a chicken foot found in a package of “chicken breast” from safeway, exemplify the challenging conditions of chickens in the food industry.

349	in 1998, the fda approved viagra as the first oral treatment for erectile dysfunction. this revolutionary drug allowed over 25 million men to reclaim their sexual lives. viagra opened up discussions about sexual dysfunction, enabling patients with medical conditions to seek treatment for their issues and helping physicians identify other health concerns in their patients. while viagra continues to be an important treatment option and source of dialogue in sexual health, it has its limitations, as it does not solve all relationship problems, such as resentment, anger, and communication issues between partners.

354	a massive, 1000x larger-than-average wasp nest containing 'more than a million' yellow jacket wasps was discovered in central florida. entomologist and bee removal expert jonathon simkins was called in and filmed in a tense attempt to exterminate the nest, managing to successfully kill it using his company's technique. the nest, which would have been dangerous for anyone to encounter, was the result of thousands of wasps trying to sting him. simkins considered it one of the most exciting moments of his professional career.

356	kay tate, a 25-year-old from newcastle, has a rare genetic disorder called brittle bones disease, known as osteogenesis imperfecta. the condition affects her bones’ strength and flexibility. as a result, she has suffered countless fractures and broken bones throughout her life. since she is almost the same height as her six-year-old son, lewis, navigating daily life can be challenging for the family. they’ve had to adapt to their circumstances often, like the family member asking them not to pick up lewis as a child or the time a woman asked them what they were looking forward to about santa. kay wants to help others who may have the same condition, so she often speaks publicly to educate others on the condition.

369	u.k. prime minister david cameron has decided not to make britain's commitment to aid spending legally binding, after being unsuccessful in convincing his conservative party to approve the plan. cameron had hoped to impose a law requiring the nation to spend 0.7% of gross domestic product on foreign aid but failed to convince his own mps. instead, the deputy prime minister nick clegg announced that the liberal democrats will include a legally binding commitment to aid spending in the party's manifesto. 
370	the wreckage of the wooden steamship city of chester, carrying 106 passengers which sank in san francisco bay in 1888, has been found by sonar more than a century later. the discovery was made by oceanographers as they charted shipping channels before the america's cup. the ship, which sank in the bay's second-worst maritime disaster, was found 216ft below the surface.
371	san pancrazio, italy: helen and armando rendón visited tuscany for the first time. both residents of northern california, they participated in the june 29th candlelight procession honoring massacre victims at san pancrazio. participating in the event allowed them to have a unique glimpse into the lesser-known real tuscany beyond the storybook version portrayed in movies.
372	a curious raccoon got its head stuck in a metal drain cover, leading to a rescue operation by experts from the wildlife emergency services (wes). after sedating the animal, experts used a grinder to safely remove the raccoon. the creature showed signs of distress but, apart from being sore, appeared in remarkable shape after its rescue.
373	in may 2013, a fatal fire on a san francisco bay bridge limousine, carried by the stretch limo inc., which killed five members of a bachelorette party, including the bride-to-be. the fire was caused by friction between the car's drive shaft and the rear floor board, resulting in an accident but ruled as not criminal. the stretch limo inc.'s owner was fined $7,500, and there were two more passengers than allowed – seven seats were used for nine passengers.
374	former connecticut state police trooper jeffrey laporto (43) has been charged with the rape of an 81-year-old woman after meeting her at a hotel bar in windsor locks. laporto faces two counts of first-degree sexual assault and one count of first-degree unlawful restraint, and his attorney claims the relationship was consensual. the attack took place between midnight and 12:30 am, resulting in extensive internal injuries, for which the victim was hospitalized. laporto served with the us navy and has no prior criminal record, but was fired from his state trooper job three years ago for unspecified reasons. the father of two was released from jail with a $250,000 bond and will appear in court on june 23.
375	freddie hubbard, a grammy-winning jazz trumpeter who made contributions to the advent of modern jazz, passed away at age 70 after suffering a heart attack. he was hospitalized following a heart attack on thanksgiving and passed away in california. hubbard was a significant figure during his jazz career spanning five decades, playing alongside major jazz figures such as herbie hancock and wayne shorter.
376	sierra blair-coyle, a 20-year-old national championship climber from scottsdale, arizona, has faced a debilitating back injury and a difficult road to success in her climbing career. despite these challenges, she continues to push herself, demonstrating strength, grace, and determination as she trains to overcome her back problem and become one of the most successful climbers on the planet.
377	a 12-year-old boy, zachary reyna, is fighting for his life after contracting a rare infection from a brain-eating amoeba caused by an amoeba eating his brain. this single-cell parasite lives in warm freshwater and attacks the brain after entering the body through the nose. only 125 instances of the disease have been recorded in the united states in the past 50 years and only two people have survived in the u.s. swimmers are advised to be careful in still water around florida, especially in the summer months, to prevent further infections.
378	man united merchandise vendors at spurs' white hart lane created a mocking t-shirt inspired by a famous quote from bbc's 'only fools and horses,' saying "this time next year, we'll be champions" just before their premier league rivals' capital one cup match against nottingham forest.
379	new zealand scrum-half aaron smith is aiming to use the pain of his only defeat to england in an all blacks jersey as motivation for the first test against england at eden park. the all blacks lost 38-21 in december 2012, which was a record defeat against england. smith, along with his teammates, will try to retake their advantage during this first match.
380	nevada assemblywoman michele fiore received criticism for her comment on concealed weapon permits, stating that "hot little girls" need concealed weapons to defend themselves from rapists. introducing a bill to allow people with concealed weapons permits to carry firearms on nevada campuses, fiore stated that allowing weapons on campus would decrease sexual assaults once sexual predators receive "bullets" to their heads. opponents denounced her comments as unrepresentative of rape victims and objectifying of women. fiore still stands by the sentiment behind the statement on her website.
381	former england cricketer geraint jones has accepted the offer of playing for papua new guinea's cricket team, taking up their offer to reach the milestone of 50 one-day international (odi) caps eight years after his 49th.
382	a claude monet pastel drawing of london's waterloo bridge created a century ago has been put on display at the savoy hotel in the room where it was painted, giving visitors an opportunity to see the unique view from the artist's suite. intended as a painting, monet had to resort to pastel drawing when his supplies were delayed, and his pictures of the thames river hold an important place in the hotel's historical collection.
383	syria's first lady, asma al-assad, is pregnant, according to a report by the beirut-based al-akhbar newspaper. asma assad, 37, who was once called "a rose in the desert" by vanity fair, has not been seen in public for several months. the report also discusses efforts by syrian president bashar al-assad to maintain confidence in his army's ultimate success in the ongoing conflict, and efforts to confirm her pregnancy with her father and the president.
384	christopher davies, 35, was given a 12-week suspended jail sentence for repeatedly punching and kicking his pet staffordshire bull terrier, max. the attack on april 7 in chelmsford, essex, was caught on cctv. max was removed from davies's home, barred from owning animals again, and ordered to pay £1,000 in legal costs. davies was the first person in chelmsford to be pursued by the city council under the animal welfare act 2006.
385	clint eastwood, a 78-year-old american actor, filmmaker, and composer, has been awarded a lifetime achievement award by the organizers of the cannes film festival. known for playing tough characters like "dirty harry," eastwood has enjoyed a successful 40-year career including winning five academy awards, five golden globes, and countless nominations.
386	alfonso ribeiro revived the "carlton" dance from "the fresh prince of bel air" on "dancing with the stars" during the "most memorable year" theme week, and received a perfect score from the judges. ribeiro stated that he loves the dance and does not hold any grudges, as it has become associated with his character, carlton.
387	the uk's climate predictions (hadcm3) may be unreliable and excessively alarmist, according to a report by the lord lawson's global warming policy foundation. the group claims the model is biased in favor of higher temperatures, with public and private sector money, including funds allocated for wind farms and roads, at risk of being invested in inappropriate measures. the uk met office disagrees with the report, but researchers argue that the model could have glitches in the way it factors in the impact of low-lying cloud, which would result in overestimated temperature changes. the implications of this model could impact government policies worldwide.
388	actor antonio banderas and actress freida pinto filmed a movie in tunisia, one of several areas experiencing protests and turmoil but the production continued with the cast and crew expressing concern but determination to finish the film. banderas, who later flew to france for business reasons, later intended to return to the set to wrap filming. the movie "black gold" is set in arabia during the 1930s when the region's discovery and production of oil changed the region, with a prominent cast that includes banderas, pinto, mark strong, and tahar rahim, and is directed by jean-jaques annaud. tunisian producer tarak ben ammar, whose studios provided the film's location, hoped that the country would remain a popular destination for international movie-makers, despite the current turmoil.
389	in africa, amateur engineers have constructed their own aircraft using scrap metal, book guides, and a lot of improvisation. despite limited resources, lacking training and money, these passionate aviation enthusiasts manage to build their aircraft, some of which even earned them the opportunity to study bigger and better things in the aviation industry. while it is unclear if the planes can actually fly, their ingenuity and sheer dedication to their craft is admirable and is a shining example of resourcefulness.
390	british diver mark ellyatt claims to have discovered lord nelson's sword hidden in the wreckage of hms victoria, a ship that sank off the coast of lebanon in 1893. ellyatt discovered the sword in the personal cabin of lord nelson's admirer, vice admiral george tryon, who died onboard the ship 88 years earlier. the sword is of high sentimental and monetary value, and there are concerns about its ownership and accessibility if it is recovered.
391	apryl brown, a successful hairstylist, almost lost everything due to unimaginable pain caused by silicone filler injections, hoping to improve her appearance. after 27 surgeries, she survived, but she lost her hands, feet, and hips in the process. brown warns others about the dangers of not carefully researching and considering the risks of these procedures, encouraging people to consider their options and consult with medical professionals before taking such extreme measures.
392	former korean airline executive heather cho, daughter of the company's chairman, denied conspiring with airline executives to force flight attendants to cover up her first-class outburst over the way she was served nuts. she appeared in court after her arrest in december 2014, amidst public outrage and ridicule from the 'nut rage' incident. cho's lawyers denied any violation of aviation security laws, stating that she did not change the flight's route or coerce crew members to lie about the incident.
393	matthew macklin lost his wbc world middleweight title eliminator and is considering retirement after multiple career losses without a world title win. he expressed that sometimes in boxing, you're as good as your last fight, even if some fighters lose many times before winning a world title. macklin has had a long and sometimes difficult career, but he also had more highs than lows. his next decision will be whether to continue fighting or retire in the face of the challenging situation he's now in.
394	yongda huang harris, a u.s. citizen of chinese decent, was held in los angeles international airport after authorities discovered hazardous materials in his luggage. items found included a smoke grenade, knives, a hatchet, and body bags among other items. his lawyer declined comment, and the court session was delayed, with his next hearing scheduled for october 29.
395	the defense advanced research projects agency (darpa) is investing £114 million ($180 million) to recycle valuable parts from defunct communication satellites in an effort to lower the cost of building new ones. the aim is to breathe new life into old satellites by testing technologies that can salvage in-orbit-parts and use them for the creation of new satellites. the plan also calls for the launch of mini-satellites to create communication systems at a lower cost. the research is a part of darpa's phoenix program, which it hopes will be a cost-effective method to reduce the expenses of military space missions.
396	in a study presented at the european congress on obesity, researchers found that crash dieting leads to more muscle loss than fat, making it difficult for crash dieters to maintain their weight loss over time. this is due to muscle burning more calories than fat, so as weight loss slows, the body restores weight to its previous level. crash diets may also lead to loss of muscle strength and appetites, causing people to return to previous, unhealthy eating habits.
397	in a cnn/orc poll released tuesday, 47% of likely voters said they would support the democratic candidate, while 45% would support the republican one, indication a slight edge for the democrats but mainly from the northeastern states. the poll also shows that a majority of respondents believe the economy is the most important issue, while most feel congress has not handled the isis threat well. democrats gained ground among men and independent voters, suggesting a potential advantage in competitive races this november.
398	"my friend cayla" is the world's first internet-connected doll that can chat, assist with homework, and encourage role-playing. designed to sync with a smartphone or tablet, cayla uses google software to recognize a child's speech and conduct simple conversations. the doll's internet searches are limited with google safesearch technology to prevent inappropriate content. parents can block unsuitable words or phrases using the smartphone app. cayla encourages learning and engagement and is among a growing army of hi-tech dolls designed to become virtual friends.
399	fast food companies like mcdonald's shift billions of dollars in hidden costs on taxpayers every year due to their low wages, limited worker benefits, and limited work hours. millions of fast-food workers rely on public assistance to afford basic necessities like food and health care. taxpayers lose $3.8 billion annually to these low-wage practices. it's crucial for fast-food workers to unionize and for congress to increase the federal minimum wage to prevent companies from relying on subsidies and public assistance to uphold their business.
400	a california fertility doctor implanted 12 embryos into nadya suleman, resulting in unsafe octuplet delivery. the state's medical board has conducted a hearing, with the possibility of revoking the doctor's medical license, while suleman's lawyer insists that the doctor had acted under pressure from her. the doctor in question was accused of gross negligence and repeated negligent acts in treating suleman.
401	jp morgan chase has reportedly shut down hundreds of bank accounts belonging to people working in the adult entertainment industry, causing outrage and confusion across the industry. pornographic actress teagan presley reported that her chase account was closed because she was public and recognizable in the adult business, despite the account being in her legal name, only used for personal reasons, and having been held for over 18 years. the move by jp morgan chase has come as a surprise, given that the u.s. adult entertainment industry generated close to $5 billion in revenue last year, raising concern that the u.s. department of justice may have triggered the banking shutdown. 
402	a samurai sword-wielding mormon bishop, kent hendrix, helped a female neighbor escape an attack by a man stalking her. hendrix and his neighbors chased the suspect, who then turned himself in to police. the bishop is a fourth-degree black belt who practices the kishindo form of martial arts and says this was the first time in 30 years that he has used his sword in self-defense.
403	a lollipop lady could be employed to protect fans as they try to recreate the iconic abbey road zebra crossing photo, originally taken by the beatles in 1969, in st john's wood, london. westminster council is concerned about the safety of fans and traffic during the photo shoots, with overlapping concerns for pedestrians, traffic, and double-parked buses. the crossing could receive additional safety precautions to manage the significant and ongoing public interest, including engagement of a lollipop lady to help protect and guide fans.
404	an influential uk activist, malcolm blackman, has been cleared of raping a woman during a protest in a tent outside st paul's cathedral. the 46-year-old, an anarchist and former court security guard, was not guilty of two counts of rape following a lengthy trial at the old bailey. he had been accused of attacking the woman, with whom he had a casual sexual relationship, inside her tent during the occupy london protest in january last year. blackman claims his career is now in ruins.
405	a trucking company has been fined the biggest amount in australian transport history for employing a sleep-deprived truck driver, who was also under the influence of methadone, resulting in the deaths of a family of three. zaens pty ltd, trading as lennons transport, was found responsible for more than 200 speeding offenses, and director anthony lennon was charged for failing to make management responsible for speed compliance. the trucking company was ordered to pay the $1.3 million fine in a local court.
406	caroline wozniacki, ranked world no. 5 in tennis, took a break from preparations for the dubai duty free tennis championships to try sandboarding. she shared a video of herself having fun on social media. although looking for her first grand slam victory, wozniacki showed no signs of feeling pressured. she recently posed for sports illustrated swimsuit 2015 edition and appears to continue moving forward without dwelling on past relationships with golfer rory mcilroy, who she was previously involved with. wozniacki has demonstrated the ability to keep a healthy perspective in her pursuit of success, both on and off the court.
407	summary: in advance of this weekend's premier league action, sportsmail provides comprehensive team news, provisional squads, betting odds, and opta stats for every match. leicester city faces sunderland at their home ground, king power stadium, with kick-off at 3pm. odds are subject to change, with leicester favorites to win at 11/10, followed by a draw option of 23/10, and sunderland at 5/2 odds; the referee is robert madley.
408	on friday, a 23-year-old student at a christian college in san antonio, texas, robert cameron redus, was shot and killed by university police officer christopher carter. the incident began when officer carter, with the university of the incarnate word, witnessed redus, driving erratically at high speeds near campus. upon following redus to an apartment complex, the situation escalated into a struggle with officer carter, where redus took the officer's police baton and used it to strike him. officer carter responded by firing his weapon, which resulted in redus' death. though the university has dashboard cameras in its police vehicles, redus' vehicle was a recent addition to the fleet and lacked a camera at the time.
409	apple has successfully acquired the trademark "ipad" in china with a $60 million payment to taiwanese company shenzhen proview technology. proview had trademarked the name in 2001, but chinese authorities refused to recognize apple's 2009 $55,000 payment until last year, when both parties were able to come to an agreement. china is already apple's second-largest market, and the resolution of the ipad dispute will aid in strengthening the market presence.
410	harry derbidge, known for his role on towie, has been dealing with food phobia issues since childhood. doctors advised him to enter rehab in two years if he didn't improve his eating habits. harry, who used to only eat 7st 7lbs, recently decided to alter his diet and eat six meals a day, consisting of plain foods like boiled plain pasta and plain chicken to gain weight and improve his energy. by changing his diet, harry's energy level increased significantly, and he is happy with his body. he hopes to use his platform to help children with eating disorders and inspire them to embrace a healthy lifestyle.
411	president ramzan kadyrov stated chechnya is safer than england even though the british foreign office advises against travel due to risks of terrorist activity and violent crime. kadyrov appealed on twitter for tourists to visit, arguing that chechnya offers a sense of safety and is less risky than western countries. the region has faced challenges in the past, including a bloody separatist insurgency and the birthplace of the boston bombers, but has seen significant improvements in recent years, with the capital grozny now dominated by modern skyscrapers and a heart of a muslim mosque. the foreign office raises concerns about other parts of russia but encourages travelers to be vigilant while visiting the country.
