415	edward snowden said that he won't return to the united states unless there are changes to whistle-blower protection laws, which do not currently cover former government contractors. he argued that there are problems with the laws' effectiveness and protections afforded. snowden expressed his desire to return to the us, but also stated that "my case clearly demonstrates the need for comprehensive whistle-blower protection act reform."
416	in october 2012, two fishermen were forced to abandon their sinking vessel, the snowdonia, and swim to safety in the irish sea. the crew on board the tribute spotted the snowdonia tilting ahead of them during a 12-mile journey east of kilkeel harbor. the two boats witnessed the damaged boat lift vertically and sink within seconds, forcing the fishermen to quickly escape into the freezing waters. the dramatic footage shows the moment the ship submerges completely and the men are seen desperately scrambling out of the water, with belongings sinking below them. the belfast coastguard notified the sinking, and the two fishermen were later rescued, treated, and airlifted to a local hospital. the event reinforced the importance of wearing life jackets and maintaining them in a high standard.
417	a document outlining the risks and potential rewards of investing in a new hong kong nightclub stock offering is gaining attention for its unintentionally humorous descriptions of nightlife. the prospectus defines clubs as establishments with dance floors, high-energy music, dj booths, and glass-prepared alcoholic beverages called cocktails. club-hopping is a trend where customers visit multiple clubs in one night, and vips receive perks like free entry, discounts, and unfinished liquor storage. though the document is intended for shareholders, its humorous descriptions offer insight into the world of hong kong nightclubs.
418	lord charles brocket, an aristocrat with a colourful past, tried to reclaim valuable family heirlooms from his rented family estate amid a financial dispute. brocket hall staff were pulled over by eight police vans while he was driving antiques back to the estate, and removed the artwork and furniture from the car and returned them to the property. the estate has been leased by brocket hall international, part of hong kong-based company cca international, which provides historic house and golf club services.

421	the prime minister, david cameron, was reportedly not a fan of the controversial top gear india special. he appeared in the show, but later disassociated himself from the program due to a negative viewer response, particularly from the indian high commission. the prime minister's representatives claimed that he had only happened to be passing by while the show was being filmed and had no control over its content, despite having been involved. the indian high commission complained about the show's cultural insensitivity, and the bbc has received complaints from people offended by the content of the program.
422	new evidence suggests that elvis presley's premature death, believed to be caused by his lifestyle, may have been a result of an undiagnosed genetic condition. scientists analyzed a sample of elvis' hair and found evidence linking him to migraines, obesity, and heart disease. the channel 4 documentary series, exploring the lifestyles of famous and infamous people, sheds new light on elvis' life and death.
423	on tetris' 30th birthday, or world tetris day, a scientist explored the psychology of the iconic game, revealing that the addictive and compulsive aspect of tetris arises from its 'world of perpetual uncompleted tasks'. people spend time playing the puzzle game because they derive pleasure from tidying up their lives, and tetris takes advantage of this pleasure by presenting continuous unfinished tasks. the game's simplicity and fun also contribute to its enduring appeal.
424	in a survey, it was found that women in the uk throw away around £26 worth of unwanted beauty gifts during christmas. additionally, £676 million is spent annually on these unwanted gifts. women prefer tried and tested brands they know and trust, and they rarely buy products based on recommendations from others. hence, men should be cautious while choosing beauty gifts for their partners and consider their preferences, as women are unlikely to keep unwanted products, regardless of the brand or cost.
425	diamond lawrence, a 25-year-old woman who attempted shoplifting $11 worth of frozen food from a walmart, allegedly threatened to infect an employee with hiv. the employee was reportedly scratched on the neck during the altercation, with lawrence claiming she could infect whomever she wants. no known bodily fluid was exchanged, and the employee checked out by dallas-fire rescue crews. the woman has two outstanding arrest warrants for public intoxication and invalid driver's license and was later charged with felony assault.

427	howard baker was a former tennessee senator known for a key question he asked during the watergate scandal, investigating the involvement of president richard nixon. the scandal revealed attempts by nixon and his administration to obstruct investigations, ultimately leading to the supreme court ruling for the white house to turn over recorded presidential conversations. this event has left a lasting impact on politics in america, where there still exists distrust of government officials. the scandal's lingering effects on politics mean politicians must navigate constant scrutiny and allegations of scandals involving the "gate" suffix. reforms in campaign finance and lobbying are crucial to improving faith in politics and ensuring government can do its job again.
428	twenty-one years after footballer and journalist danny blanchflower's death, we remember him for one observation: "the game is about glory… [sport is] about doing things in style, with a flourish, about going out and beating the other lot, not waiting for them to die of boredom." while sport may often be dismissed as a trivial matter, it brings glory and wonder to life. despite excesses like drug use and excessive wealth, sport’s highest moments remain unparalleled.

434	apprentice stonemason louis kefferty, 20, and his girlfriend lauren white, 18, died in a fatal car crash on christmas eve. a red vauxhall astra left the road and collided with a tree half-a-mile from louis' home in seafield, west lothian. louis and lauren were taken to a edinburgh hospital, where he later died of severe head injuries. heartbroken lauren poured out her feelings on facebook in an emotional tribute to louis.
435	on tuesday, iranian president mahmoud ahmadinejad and his main rival mir hossein moussavi held separate demonstrations in tehran, following last week's disputed presidential election. ahmadinejad supporters gathered in central tehran, while moussavi urged his own supporters to call off their pre-planned rally at vali asr square after the previous day's violent clashes in which seven people were killed. the government banned international journalists from covering election rallies, and iranian authorities have faced criticism over perceived election rigging.
436	a high-court judge has found that a four-month-old baby girl was violently assaulted by her father, a high-court judge, resulting in multiple fractures and severe injury. the father admitted guilt, with the judge describing the case as 'terrible' and the most 'chilling' in his 30-year career. the mother knew about the abuse and chose not to attempt to protect the child, with the judge also finding her guilty of neglect. the father was jailed for 12 years.
437	more than 500 employees of nexen energy in calgary, canada, broke the guinness world record for the largest gathering of people dressed as batman. the staff members all wore a full-body batman costume, cape, mask, and yellow belt and stood together for five minutes. the event aimed to promote charity and unity while supporting nexen's annual united way campaign and raising awareness for the charity.
438	new york restaurateur nino selimaj offers a luxurious delicacy: a $1,000 caviar pizza. featuring two of the world's top caviars, beluga, and the intensely-flavoured black russian royal sevruga, this extravagant pie is topped with thinly sliced lobster, creme fraiche, chives, and wasabi paste. with around 50 pies sold a year, the pizza remains an indulgence for high earners, politicians, and wall street traders.
439	retiring representative michele bachmann, true to her beliefs, credited the united states' economic rise through history to the ten commandments in her final speech on the house floor. she also cited the u.s. motto of "in god we trust" and emphasized the value of the ten commandments for the foundation of american law. bachmann, a tea party advocate, has been under investigation for campaign finance law violations but will no longer be probed once she leaves congress in january.
440	two nurses and an orderly brutally beat a mentally disabled man, causing severe injuries that left him paralyzed. cctv footage captured the horrific event, where the hospital staff kicked, pulled, and stamped on zhao yanli before moving him to the television room. the patient's family, now suing the hospital, alleges the attack wasn't notified, and the family is seeking compensation and criminal prosecution for the staff.
441	the earth is currently farting due to the thawing of frozen methane. methane gas, primarily released as we digest food, is a key ingredient of natural gas, and it is being released from the siberian permafrost at an alarming rate. this phenomenon affects the environment and has the potential to be catastrophic for humanity. the release of methane creates a positive feedback loop that leads to more warming, which only makes the situation more dire. to avoid further consequences, it is essential to recognize and acknowledge the role of fuel and greenhouse gas production in the earth's current issue. we must also cease the development of fracking pipelines and prioritize cleaner and sustainable energy sources like wind and solar power.
442	researchers have discovered that by administering tiny amounts of silver alongside antibiotics, they can enhance the drugs' effectiveness by up to a thousand times. this development could potentially counter the rise of drug-resistant superbugs due to growing antibiotic resistance, which has led to warnings from the uk's chief medical officer of an 'apocalyptic scenario.'
443	after being acquitted of charges, george zimmerman has faced difficulties in finding a job. some experts suggest he should seek a new career path outside of law enforcement to avoid causing further controversy. zimmerman was accused of profiting from this case, and the source of his monetary income remains unclear. his options for future endeavors include a book or movie deal, civil wrongful death lawsuit, and legal expenses for the defamation lawsuit against nbc. zimmerman's next steps will be influenced by the controversial nature of the case and his personal safety concerns.
444	water companies implemented an 11-point measure to prevent 20 million people from exploiting hosepipe ban restrictions. the rules include a ban on using a hose or sprinkler to water plants, wash a car or boat, fill fountains, swimming or paddling pools, or to clean patios, driveways or windows. violators face a £1,000 fine. the temporary use bans, affecting one in three uk homes, were announced after persistent low rainfall led to rivers drying up, reservoirs down to record low levels, and significant drought conditions. water companies hope that the ban will be enforced through goodwill and educating people about the need to save water.
445	on august 20, 1989, a devastating boating accident occurred when the riverboat marchioness collided with another boat, causing the loss of 51 young lives. families who lost loved ones gathered at a cathedral service to remember their lost ones, lighting 51 candles and placing 51 red roses in honor of their deceased relatives. the disaster was investigated and revealed many issues with boats and safety regulations, eventually leading to improved safety features for the river thames.
446	opera-goers experienced protests outside the metropolitan opera in new york city on opening night, where the opera "death of klinghoffer" was to be performed. the 1991 opera, by john adams, dramatizes the killing of a jewish american (leon klinghoffer) during the 1985 hijacking of a cruise ship by palestinian militants. protestors voiced their concerns over the work to an audience who saw through to the end of the performance, which finished with a standing ovation.

448	in saudi arabia, a small but determined number of women are breaking social constraints to build their own thriving businesses, amassing individual wealth. despite conservative societal pressures, women are increasingly playing a part in the country's economic development with $11.9 billion generated mainly in bonds and bank accounts, according to asset managers. these women are facing various obstacles, which include obtaining childcare, drivers, and start-up capital, but with increasing government recognition, new opportunities have become available.

450	a 20-year-old man named viraj mashru faked his kidnapping in an attempt to extort £620,000 worth of gold bullion from his wealthy father, rajendra mashru. he enlisted amit patel's help to convince his father he had been abducted and demanded the $1 million bounty. patel claimed he had brought a co-conspirator, viraj, from africa, and threatened harm if the family did not pay. mashru and patel pleaded guilty to blackmail at southwark crown court and admitted to faking their kidnap attempt. the trial of alleged co-conspirators marcus bennett and leban mohamed is ongoing, and their sentencing will follow after the trial.
451	former president bill clinton's office has a monthly satellite tv account, including premium movie channels like cinemax, costing $184.26 as part of the $1 million allotted business-related expenses for his harlem, new york office. other expenses include a $322.40 annual digital subscription to the new york times and 145 "office choice" and 32 high-definition "entertainment unlimited" channels. all former presidents receive money to cover business expenses after leaving the white house, with each receiving varying amounts based on their time in office.
452	an australian man, harrison williams, shocked onlookers by climbing on top of a dead whale carcass despite sharks surrounding the dead animal in open waters near perth, western australia. williams, an extreme sport enthusiast, was seen by others attempting to help the whale; however, the sharks in the water surrounding the carcass presented a significant risk.

456	poor weather in scotland has caused lobster shortages and a 90% drop in catches due to damaged equipment and piers washed away by storms. as a result, restaurants like langan's and gamba glasgow have taken grilled lobster off their menus, with prices increasing significantly. the scarcity and price rise have led to scottish lobsters costing up to £10 more per kilo. the main supplier of scottish lobsters, the country’s creel fishermen's federation, suffered a 90% reduction in landings on the east coast.
457	jackass star ryan dunn was driving a porsche at up to 140 mph when it crashed and caught fire on a pennsylvania highway, killing him and his passenger, zachary hartwell. dunn's blood alcohol concentration was 0.196%, twice the legal limit, and his death was attributed to "blunt and thermal trauma." dunn was known for his dangerous stunts and was famous from the "jackass" show, which inspired a successful film franchise.

467	nearly a decade after the september 11 attacks, the threat of another major terror strike is still a concern, but the source of the threat has shifted. american citizens and longtime residents of the united states are now becoming radicalized enough by al qaeda's extremist ideology to kill their fellow citizens, according to counterterrorism officials. some are also learning bomb-making skills necessary to become potentially dangerous terrorists, and are training in the mountains of waziristan in pakistan. this group has ties to al qaeda and is led by the pakistani taliban. bryant neal vinas is a prime example, a catholic convert to islam from long island, new york, who became radicalized, traveled to pakistan and joined up with al qaeda. their case sheds light on the potential danger posed by these american homegrown terrorists. counterterrorism officials believe that radical online preaching through interactive online social media sites and new generation charismatic english-speaking preachers has helped spread al qaeda's ideology to the united states much faster than before.

469	this article describes the heartwarming moment when a young orangutan named terusan explored his natural habitat in the indonesian wild for the first time. the borneo orangutan survival foundation released 21 orangutans, including terusan, into the wild, as they had been prepared for life there as part of their rehabilitation process. the reactions of the orangutans, their carers, and onlookers were captured by the cameras, showing their excitement and discomfort, as it can be difficult for orangutans to adjust to their new lives. this was all in the effort to save endangered orangutans, and the borneo orangutan survival foundation continues to do this work by rehabilitating and releasing more of these incredible animals.
470	all passengers and crew aboard us airways flight 1549 survived when the plane crash-landed into the hudson river due to diligent rescue training and coordinated rescue efforts from the coast guard, ferries, and other boats. the passengers were able to exit the plane into rafts or stand on the wings as the plane became more submerged. the quick response may have saved lives and helped passengers avoid hypothermia, which, at the time of the crash, could have led to the loss of arm and leg function within three minutes of exposure to cold water. ferry captains like brittany catanzaro also contributed to the safe rescue of passengers from the water.

474	an syrian software engineer named dlshad othman has developed an app designed to help syrians avoid being hit by missiles in the ongoing conflict. the app, aymta (when in arabic), can track when a missile is fired and calculate where it is likely to land, warning users to seek shelter. aymta is a website that gathers information from seven spotters located in the hills outside damascus. othman, who initially developed the website for syrian users, is now planning on expanding it for other countries.

484	the fast-growing oil spill in the gulf of mexico continues to impact people and commerce in coastal communities. ben stone, living in gulfport, mississippi, has seen the impact on his town firsthand, and as the spill grows closer to the coast, concerns mount about the potential for devastation to the economy and local ecosystems. federal officials have closed part of the northern gulf of mexico to fishing, causing a $1 billion loss to the industry. residents rely on the gulf's wildlife and seafood trade, and as the oil spill deepens, it could have catastrophic long-term ecological and economic consequences, causing widespread effects on people's lives and livelihoods.
485	a conwoman named sidra fatima posed as a potential bride on an asian marriage website for nearly two years in a scam, deceiving seven men into giving her £35,000. fatima conned men by creating a second profile and insisted that they pay for fake wedding expenses and dowry items. her husband, raja haider ali, chaperoned her during meetings, pretending to be her cousin or brother. one victim was threatened by ali when he asked for his money back, saying he had murdered 20 people in pakistan and showing him a picture of an ak-47. fatima and her husband pleaded guilty mid-trial and faced a variety of unrelated fraud charges. fatima ultimately received a 12-month suspended sentence, while her husband received a 2.5-year jail term.

493	a third of people struggle to cope at work due to depression, stress, or burnout, according to a survey. many of those affected experience isolation or loneliness and about half have confided in a colleague, yet the majority (71%) found communicating with their peers beneficial. organizations including royal mail, barclays, and unilever are taking action by implementing policies to enable structured support for workers with depression. the depression alliance and the target depression in the workplace advisory group aim to raise awareness and help businesses better manage employees' mental health challenges.
494	seventy-five additional bodies have been discovered from the wreckage of an air france plane that crashed off the coast of brazil in 2009, more than doubling the number of remains found. only 127 bodies have been found since the accident, and investigators are still working to determine the cause of the crash. air france 447 crashed into the atlantic ocean on june 1, 2009, killing all 228 passengers and crew members on board.

500	brazil has effective universal healthcare coverage with minimal government spending on healthcare, leading to a cultural expectation that everyone should contribute to healthcare and the belief that it is a fundamental human right. despite challenges, brazil's healthcare system appears to have paid off as life expectancy has improved faster than the us since 1960, while challenges remain with government funding, healthcare service access, and management. the us and brazil can learn from each other on healthcare policies that consider accessibility, affordability, and shared responsibility.
501	last year, arsenal were at the top of the premier league, before suffering setbacks in the title race and dropping out of the top champions league places. arsenal fans may be content with their manager's efforts in the long term, but now need more to compete with top clubs. they are currently 13 points behind leaders chelsea, but hope to finish in their top champions league spot. arsenal need to improve their roster to be more dominant both domestically and internationally. signing high-quality players, such as gareth bale, could boost their roster and prove beneficial for both the club and the premier league.
502	babies as young as seven months can recognize fear in someone's eyes, as they unconsciously register facial expression on the whites of their eyes, called sclerae. infants read human expressions by looking at these whites of eyes in just 50 milliseconds, and they react more strongly to fear than to happiness, according to a new study. scientists from the max planck institute for human cognitive and brain sciences discovered that infants react more to fearful expressions than to happy expressions, indicating that they have efficient and reliable social cue detection mechanisms in their brains that likely provide a vital foundation for the development of social interactive skills.
503	former alabama university football star eddie williams was accused of having an affair with his former high school teacher, who wanted to have his baby. williams was kicked out of college earlier this year after being arrested for a series of robberies. wesley, the former high school athletic director, denied the allegations, and a school district investigation found that she is in a relationship with the school's football and basketball coach, bobby britton. williams has now confessed to the affair, which took place during his senior year and resulted in his dismissal from the alabama squad earlier this year.
504	kristine bunch, convicted of killing her son in 1995, was released after an investigation showed that the evidence used to convict her was outdated, weak, and wrongly withheld. although the prosecutors intend to retry her, the case is not closed, and kristine bunch is seeking justice for her wrongful conviction. she now has the chance to prove her innocence and study criminal law to help others who have been wrongfully convicted.
505	the women's tennis journey has lasted for 40 years, beginning with a $1 contract by the original nine pioneers. the total prize money has grown from $309,000 spread across 19 tournaments to an expected $107 million this year. serena williams, a modern queen of the wta, won the u.s. open in 2012, earning $2 million - surpassing total career earnings of billie jean king. in 1973, the women's tennis association (wta) was formed, and their "40 love" campaign marks the 40th anniversary of their success. today, the wta has become a billion-dollar industry, with tennis players such as serena williams and victoria azarenka becoming the first to break the $7 million and $2 million thresholds in a year, respectively. the women's game has reached a global stage with increased prize money and an increasing commercial appeal; as a result, the gap between men's and women's pay is closing in tennis.

513	many obese people suffer from malnutrition despite being overweight, says a leading weight loss surgeon. she claims that a diet of pizza, fries, cakes, and biscuits leaves them consuming a large amount of calories but few nutrients. malnutrition is exacerbated by the presence of calorie-packed foods at hospital foyers and the limited nutritional training junior doctors receive. sally norton suggests treating disease with healthy food and calls for patients to be served more nutritious meals in hospitals.

516	mandy shepherd, aged 27, who suffered from mitochondrial disease, died after collapsing in the bath. despite bullies mocking her condition, mandy carried on and even took the same route home to volunteer at a youth centre. tragedy struck after her fatal cardiac arrest. tests revealed her death was linked to mitochondrial disease, and her family has vowed to campaign for more awareness about the condition and raise funds for the children's mitochondrial disease network. the coroner recorded a verdict of death by natural causes.
517	spanish tennis player rafael nadal has announced that he will miss the u.s. open due to a right wrist injury. this is the result of his previous injury from wimbledon, causing him to pull out of recent masters events in toronto and cincinnati. nadal made a facebook post to express his disappointment and assurance that he will work hard to recover and compete at the highest level once he is back. his absence from the tournament means that roger federer will rise to the position of no. 2 in the seedings, giving him a greater chance of capturing the 18th major title.

525	the public education system in the united states has remained largely unchanged despite improvements in education for poor children. there is a responsibility to do better, extending the school year, ensuring proper health care, and providing wrap-around services. innovation and improvements must be driven by the science of education, as the cost of fixing the system is much lower than the cost incurred to fix other issues, such as the costs associated with global security. join in calling for a dramatic reform of the school system to ensure a better future for all children.
526	routehappy, an air industry data cruncher, released new statistics revealing that flying without internet access is becoming increasingly scarce, as more airlines connect their customers to wi-fi on board. the percentage of international flights with wi-fi access is now 24%, nearly triple what it was 18 months ago, while domestic flights have 66% chance of having wi-fi. nordic airlines are currently leading in connectivity, with icelandair and norwegian offering wi-fi on more than 80% of their flights.
527	a vaccine for deadly meningitis b has been approved by experts, but may not be immediately available on the nhs, requiring families to go private for the jab. the vaccine, called bexsero, is considered safe and effective for infants aged two months and older, and is the first to prevent the most common form of the bacterial meningitis in the uk. the government's advisory committee on vaccination has not yet decided whether the vaccine would be included in the nhs immunisation programme, which could be problematic given the high death rates of affected children and the overwhelming support for swift approval. meningitis b killed over 200 people annually in the uk, leaving many more with life-long complications like amputations, blindness, or deafness, highlighting the urgent need for a vaccine.
528	the medical examiner responsible for the deaths of an elderly couple in their hotel room in north carolina resigned after he failed to alert the authorities that the room could be a danger. dr. brent hall received a medical report on the couple's deaths, but their toxicology reports did not reach the police until after an 11-year-old boy died in the same room two months later. hall resigned without comment on the case, stating that medical examiners had completed their toxicology reports, but hotel guests would have been better protected if this information was passed on to local authorities by the medical examiner.

533	in the 1920s and 1930s, lysol was widely promoted as an effective form of contraception and even as a gentle and safe method of "marriage hygiene." ads from that era quoted "expert european doctors" endorsing lysol, though investigations revealed that the doctors were not real. despite being ineffective and sometimes causing vaginal burns, inflammation, and even death, lysol was marketed as a suitable and over-the-counter birth control method until 1960, when the oral contraceptive pill became widely available.

541	work to remove the hull of a us navy warship grounded on a philippine reef is expected to begin soon, potentially in six days if weather conditions are favorable, according to a philippine coast guard official. the uss guardian, grounded since january 17, is expected to be cut into three parts, and crews are taking extra care to remove residue from oil and fuel from the ship. the superstructure of the vessel has already been removed from the grounding site on túbbahátá reef, an environmentally sensitive unesco world heritage site.
542	in august 2013, former cleveland kidnapping victim gina dejesus and her parents watched officials demolish and crush the four-bedroom house where she was kept captive for a decade. the cleveland authorities aimed to remove and destroy the house in question. google had already removed the property from its street view feature, while the land beneath it had been donated to the cuyahoga land bank. the organization's president, gus frangos, assured to prevent would-be scavengers from selling any saleable remains or 'murderabilia,' such as in anthony sowell's 2011 case. one year after the three women were freed from decade-long captivity, amanda berry, michelle knight, and gina dejesus made their public appearances in support of their newly found freedom.
543	a 2,000-year-old yew tree, known as the ankerwycke, which was the site of the sealing of the magna carta—a pivotal document for british democracy—has been preserved in a hedge in edinburgh's botanic gardens. saplings grown from cuttings of the tree have been added to a conservation project, which aims to protect the genetic material of ancient trees facing various threats like climate change, development, and vandalism.

552	new caledonian crows have displayed a tendency to prefer holding sticks with their beaks on either the left or right side, which researchers believe may help the birds maintain a wider field of vision to see objects more clearly and use tools more dexterously. the birds also appear to be highly intelligent, surpassing the problem-solving abilities of three- and four-year-old children and demonstrating skills and reasoning similar to humans aged seven years old.
553	"contagion," directed by steven soderbergh, is a star-studded thriller detailing the rapid spread of a viral disease across the globe. the film follows important figures in healthcare and the cdc as they attempt to respond to the outbreak, encountering various challenges along the way. though depicting a disastrous event, soderbergh maintains a cool and analytical emotional temperature, resisting an excess of melodrama. critics describe the movie as admirable for avoiding potted melodrama and providing thought-provoking insights into the complexities of morality, privilege, and power during such a catastrophe.

557	the taiwan tower, designed by tokyo-based architect sou fujimoto, is a superstructure located in the taiwanese city of taichung featuring a giant triangular frame for the world's highest roof garden. stretching approximately 1000 ft into the sky, the 1000-foot-high building could become one of the most surreal structures on earth as it stands taller than the eiffel tower. the tower's design resembles a labyrinth of steel beams that create a semi-outdoor space, and it is surrounded by parks for visitors to enjoy. the taiwan tower incorporates numerous green features, such as renewable energy systems, rainwater harvesting facilities, and solar panels, to power and heat the building, setting an example for future generations.
558	airplanes have become a perfect opportunity for airlines to sell products to customers, thanks to their captive and often bored audience. in recent years, airlines have developed more sophisticated methods to sell various products. they offer high-end items, craft beers, local food, and even ticketed events. some airlines even sell vehicles while in the sky. airlines aim to offer unique and sometimes quirky products that passengers can enjoy during their travels. aside from airlines, in-flight retail is also expanding as airport shops and bookstores aim to offer goods and experiences not available on the ground.
559	a new book reveals russia's female prisoners are subject to "concentration camp"-style conditions where as many as 30 inmates share one room, with limited personal space, personal hygiene facilities, and suffering harsh punishments. a group of st. petersburg sociologists collaborated with inmate stories and assessed life behind bars, focusing on gender differences and providing an alternative view of penal colonies.

561	to combat the lack of burial space in israel due to its dense population, architects are building "high burial buildings" for stacked cemeteries, known as "vertical cemeteries." leading rabbis and the israeli ministry of religious services have declared the concept kosher, as each structure has pipes filled with dirt inside its columns, connecting every layer to the ground, providing a connection to earth for jewish burial law. despite initial opposition from some ultra-orthodox jews, the structures are expected to provide the next two decades of burial space, as the idea of vertical cemeteries is growing globally in densely populated areas where land is scarce.
562	in southern afghanistan, an afghan worker on a military base shot and killed three u.s. marines. this deadly attack comes within a 24-hour period of five other rogue attacks, resulting in six american soldiers being killed in afghanistan. the shooting incident took place on friday night in the garmsir district of helmand province, following an earlier incident when three u.s. special forces soldiers were killed by an afghan policeman and comrades earlier in the day. the nato force spokesman said that these incidents do not reflect the overall situation in the country, but measures are in place to prevent and address such attacks.

582	cornealious "mike" anderson, who was freed from prison after avoiding jail for 13 years due to a clerical oversight, has now been arrested and charged with second-degree robbery. the 37-year-old was set free in may 2016 but landed back in jail when he allegedly snatched a woman's purse and dragged her along the ground in st. louis. anderson's lawyer argues that his client had an alibi and is mistakenly identified, saying his client would not risk his life and family for a purse.

585	a racing pigeon named henry set off from france to england but ended up thousands of miles away in the bahamas. the 16-month-old bird, given up as lost by its owner, fred lock, was later found on eleuthera island by kate barley, a student studying fisheries conservation in the bahamas. henry has since become a local celebrity, enjoying the company of his caretaker and being taken on relaxed "holiday" outings on the island. although henry may return to lock when barley returns to england, some locals believe it may be nice for him to live out his days in the sunshine as a permanent holiday.
586	lucy francis maloney, an artist, creates life-like replicas of deceased dogs for grieving pet owners using a combination of household materials and real dog hair. she started creating these models in 1997 as a way to honor a family dog who passed away. since then, maloney has created thousands of replicas for customers in over 16 countries. these miniatures bring immense comfort to pet owners as they provide a 3d representation of their beloved furry friend.
587	in 1985, a tragic event occurred at the heysel stadium during a prestigious football match. the incident resulted in the death of 39 people, and it forever changed the lives of those affected by it. antonio conti, a supporter of juventus, was present with his daughter giusy to watch the match between juventus and liverpool. however, the evening took a tragic turn when a crush occurred in sector z, leaving many fans injured and 39 dead, including 32 from italy and 7 from belgium. conti's daughter giusy was among the victims. the event is often referred to as the "tragedy at heysel" or "stampede at heysel." it was the most devastating stadium disaster up until that time and left an indelible mark on those involved and their families. the tragedy exposed lapses in securing tickets, policing, and stadium safety that had plagued the event. however, these issues were not resolved until the hillsborough disaster in 1989, which left 96 more fans dead.
588	environmental lawyer robert f. kennedy jr. criticized fox news as a negative force in american politics, claiming that conservative media control was damaging to parties trying to work together. he opposed fracking for its health and environmental risks and blamed fox news for dividing the country since the civil war. kennedy attended the deer valley celebrity skifest in utah, where he mingled with celebrities and raised funds for his charity, the waterkeeper alliance.
589	a non-profit organization is urging doctors to prescribe the £3 pill called nalmefene to approximately 600,000 'mild alcoholics' in england. this is part of ongoing efforts to reduce the risk of death from liver disease which has increased over the last decade. heavy drinking is associated with a range of serious health issues, including heart disease and cancer. nalmefene works by reducing the brain's dopamine response, lowering the pleasure involved in drinking without requiring abstinence; this is provisional guidance from the national institute for health and care excellence (nice), which means doctors could start prescribing nalmefene for six months alongside counseling and support. 
590	the us house approved a compromise plan on thursday to fund military operations in iraq and afghanistan into early 2009. the plan includes $165 billion in funding for the wars and meets key domestic priorities for democrats. the bill extends unemployment benefits, expands educational benefits for veterans, and includes funding for disaster assistance. both the war funding and domestic money bills were approved, and the combined measures will now be sent to the senate for approval.
591	a brooklyn man, oscar ramirez, was arrested by port authority police after tsa officers discovered a concealed .22-caliber semi-automatic handgun and parts in his carry-on luggage at new york's john f. kennedy international airport. ramirez was travelling to mexico city when he was detained and could face criminal charges and penalties for his actions. this year, tsa has discovered a record 2,100 guns at airport checkpoints, indicating an increased number of incidents compared to 2013.
592	the passing of az sb 1070 stirred up emotions, causing some immigrants to leave arizona for other states and creating frayed relationships between hispanics and whites. the law was ruled partially unconstitutional by a us district judge, but the division remains. illegal immigrants like the hot dog vendor try to avoid racial profiling as they continue to face uncertainty and fear of police enforcement.
593	qpr boss harry redknapp is considering a loan move for west ham's argentinian forward mauro zarate, who has struggled for playing time this season. redknapp is looking to strengthen qpr's attacking options and prevent relying on charlie austin, as the team hopes to avoid relegation.
594	new research found that levels of vitamin d in pregnant women may not significantly affect their baby's bone health, challenging official advice on the topic. the study, which assessed the bone mineral content (bmc) of children at a median age of 10, found no clear link between a mother's vitamin d levels during pregnancy and her child's bmc. although other researchers believe some groups of women may still benefit from taking supplements due to factors such as limited sunlight exposure and obesity. 
595	at the gold coast schoolies celebration, high school sweethearts chris collins and rachael surprised the crowd with a choreographed dance routine, followed by chris proposal, which rachael happily accepted. the stunning proposal involved chris getting down on one knee with a mic in hand as he pulled out a ring made from his grandmother's diamonds.
596	the controversial keystone xl pipeline proposal has proposed a new route through nebraska and will require six to nine months to review under the standard process by state and federal officials. transcanada will undergo a public comment period, followed by final revisions, before the department performs a full assessment. obama administration has yet to receive a new permit application for the proposed alternate route for the project.
597	a dashboard camera captures the moment a truck swerves to avoid another vehicle in russia, flips over and unloads its cargo of live cows, resulting in more than three million views on youtube. some people suspect it's a hoax, but others believe it's due to the country's notorious bad driving conditions and high crime rates. more and more footage of such incidents are emerging from russia, with instances ranging from jaywalking horses to stranded couples in a flipped quad bike.
598	atletico madrid is fighting to keep their star players this summer, with a strong emotional bond forming between the team and its players. goalkeeper thibaut courtois has expressed his desire to stay as he does not have an emotional link with his parent club chelsea, and diego costa, koke, and filipe luis are among the other players who may stay with the team. atletico will try to keep their core players, as their run in the champions league has brought in the necessary funds to do so.
599	the european commission is offering unemployed young europeans £1,000 in taxpayers' cash to come and work in the uk, aiming to create job opportunities and provide them with a pathway to work. the scheme is likely to be rolled out across the eu during this financial year, with critics raising concerns about the influx of young workers from countries with high unemployment like spain and greece.
600	a golden coach named britannia, built by sydney man jim frecklington with taxpayer funds, has been a subject of a political row over taxpayer money. the coach was meant to be a birthday present for the queen but took almost a decade to be finished and then sat idle in a suburban workshop. after almost being forgotten, it has now arrived in the uk and plans are being made for it to be used in the future.
601	angel di maria's outstanding performance in the 2013-2014 season, where he led his team to victory in the champions league, was even more incredible considering his personal story as a father of a prematurely born daughter. despite facing numerous challenges, di maria excelled in his football career, making over 20 assists and scoring goals in spain. his dedication and determination were key to his success, as he learned to overcome obstacles and grow through his experiences. his versatility as a player and ability to adapt in various positions have also made him a valuable asset on the field.
602	disney, being one of the many companies pushing forward for the use of small unmanned flight systems for commercial purposes, filed three drone-related patents that could potentially replace fireworks and parades at their theme parks. the patents discuss using drones as marionettes, controlling floating pixels, and displaying flexible screens with the help of drones, aiming to create more immersive experiences for visitors. 
603	a turkish airlines plane crashed in a farmer's field in amsterdam, killing nine and injuring more than 60 passengers. dutch investigators are still gathering information and analyzing data to determine the cause of the crash, but a sudden drop in altitude and lack of forward speed upon impact suggest the aircraft did not have enough airspeed necessary for landing. further analysis is being conducted by safety board specialists to investigate the crash site, with preliminary findings potential to be released next week.
604	kisha curtis, 29, denied a pre-trial intervention program for being charged with throwing her emaciated pit bull puppy down a garbage shoot, leading it to severe neglect and near death; prosecutors offered a 18-months prison sentence for the crime in 2011. although the judge rejected the program, kisha maintains her innocence and plans to fight the charges. the dog has since miraculously recovered, is over 50 pounds, and resides with a tinton falls veterinary facility.
605	in 2013, quentin bryce, the queen's representative in australia, became the first governor-general to publicly support australia becoming a republic. she stated that she wishes the country to become a place where a young girl or boy might one day become the nation's first head of state.
606	a suspected al-qaeda bomb maker named ibrahim hassan al-asiri is believed to be at the center of a plot sending bombs from yemen to the u.s. al-asiri, a saudi national, has been living in yemen for the past three years and is one of saudi arabia's most wanted men. the suspect is an explosives and poison expert, and he's suspected in earlier, foiled terror plots like the 'underwear bomb attack' in 2009.
607	scientists aim to finally diagnose the condition of the elephant man, joseph merrick, by analyzing dna from his bones. this research will identify possible gene alterations in merrick's genome sequence through tests next month, with the goal of preserving his skeleton for future generations. merrick's skeleton, preserved at the royal london hospital since his death in 1890, has degraded due to constant bleaching, making testing difficult. researchers must determine whether they can extract sufficient genetic material from abnormal bone as well as normal bone to analyze his case and help provide answers about his uncommon affliction.
608	this article discusses a letter from a supporter of the paedophile information exchange (pie), containing £50 meant for "the defence" of three members who faced prosecution, along with personal initials of harriet harman, then legal officer of the national council for civil liberties (nccl). the letter arrives three years after pie was described to be "marginalised," casting more suspicion on ms. harman and her husband jack dromey's relations to the group. both harman and dromey deny any involvement and point to defeating pie earlier before the current controversy.
609	mardi gras, known for its festive atmosphere, is a major event in new orleans and attracts thousands of spectators every year. the celebration involves several colorful parades, vibrant costumes, and intricate float designs. although a tradition for many residents, the carnival season is also a significant tourist draw, boosting the city's $6 billion tourism economy alongside other popular events, such as the jazz and heritage festival, the essence festival, and sporting activities. while mardi gras is meant to celebrate and enjoy, it can also result in alcohol-related disputes and incidents like the recent altercation that led to a shooting.
610	a mother who suffered 13 miscarriages hopes to adopt a little girl by putting her wedding ring up for sale, and has since raised more than $4,000 in donations. zaundia klingbeil and her husband are trying to raise $8,000 to afford the adoption and cover medical expenses.
611	aimee willett, a mother with inoperable cancer, will get her dream wedding after well-wishers donated thousands of pounds in money, services, and even a venue to make her wish come true. aimee made a bucket list of things she wanted to do when she discovered she had terminal cancer, including marrying her fiancé, michael bond. their dream wedding was thought to be impossible for financial reasons, but after fundraising efforts raised more than £31,000, including a £25,000 anonymous donation, their big day will now take place in february at westenhanger castle in hythe, kent, thanks to the generosity of those who supported the cause.
612	hands-free phone devices, which are widely considered a safe means of calling while driving, may pose a near-equal safety risk as using a hand-held phone, suggests a canadian study. researchers found that drivers using hands-free phones made significantly more errors than those not talking on the phone. despite this, sales of hands-free phone devices have soared in the uk in recent years since it became illegal to use a mobile phone while driving. drivers are permitted to use hands-free kits, sat navs and two-way radios while driving or riding, but could still face a penalty if deemed to be distracted and not in control of their vehicle.
613	american soldiers are provided cultural training before their deployments to help prepare them for conflict situations. understanding local cultures, ethnicities, and religions is crucial to understanding the source of conflict. the united states army is working to align brigades with unified command zones, establishing language and cultural proficiency programs. this effort aims to promote a more symbiotic relationships across regions. additionally, cultural training is being made more available to soldiers to prepare them better for potential threats in the future.
614	manchester united will return to the top eventually, it's not a matter of if, but when, and it could be as soon as next season or the year after. manchester city, chelsea, and other clubs could afford lionel messi if allowed to invest speculatively, but clubs will face punishments and bans from major competitions if found guilty. this leaves manchester united as the only club with the potential to make messi's numbers add up, despite messi's power play and contractual brinkmanship. even without messi, if louis van gaal continues to be a good coach, and if manchester united continues its financial dominance in the transfer window, it will eventually lead to their return to the top.
615	uk health minister believes plain cigarette packaging could have a positive impact on public health by reducing cigarette appeal to teenagers, following growing health campaigner pressure. however, despite an april deadline previously set by mp jane ellison, she revealed that prime minister david cameron is blocking the introduction of the new packaging, with critics claiming he is influenced by election strategist lynton crosby, who has worked with tobacco firms in the past. labour's luciana berger has called on the government to bring forward the regulations it promised on plain packaging.
616	a three-week-old girl named eliza delacruz from long beach, california, has gone missing after a shooting at her family home which left her mother and two others critically wounded. police are searching for a man they believe may have taken the child away and have launched an urgent manhunt, though there are no leads yet. the three shooting victims are now in stable condition at the hospital, and anyone with information is urged to call the lapd.
617	a blind kitten rescued after being thrown away with the trash has become a social media sensation, with a facebook page with over 15,000 likes and numerous youtube videos. quirky the kitten can be seen trying to lick his fur, but accidentally licks the air instead. rescued by frank and vicky giannangelo, he has become a viral hit after the couple took him back to their home in new mexico.
618	a model village once created by great-grandmother pat bullman and her husband oliver, aged 80, was restored to its former glory by volunteers after falling into disrepair following her husband's death. over 50 years, the couple created an attraction with buildings such as a windmill, fire station, railway station, hotel, fish and chip shop, and church. two volunteers, beverley lorking, 73, from ely and tony middleton, in his 60s from cambridge, used their skills as former toolmakers to bring the model village back to life. the village now features a new pub called 'the bull,' a farmshop, new vehicles, painted winding river and paved footpaths.

620	sweden's new prime minister stefan lofven announced the recognition of palestine as a sovereign state. approximately 130 other countries have already done so, with most european union (eu) members refraining from recognizing palestine due to the disputed nature of its borders. the decision drew criticism from jewish groups but was praised by palestinian officials. 
621	a 50-year-old man, adrian muir, has been charged with the murder of his girlfriend, 55-year-old pamela jackson, who went missing more than a week ago. jackson, also known as cris or crissie, was last seen on march 3 at her home in chester-le-street, county durham. over 40 officers are working on the investigation, which has turned from a missing person case to a murder inquiry. muir is set to appear in court later today.
622	julie tremmel, a rhode island tv reporter who unwittingly gained fame for her viral bear attack survival guide, has been fired from her job at nbc affiliate wjar-tv after she performed a handstand on-air during an "america's got talent" audition report. tremmel was attempting to display her unique skills to impress producers watching at home, but the stunt was not well-received by some senior staff members and caused dismay among her fans. tremmel, who is currently fighting her dismissal through the grievance and arbitration process, was previously infamous for her comically unintentionally viral story discussing how to survive a bear attack.

627	the robinson family, who owns a funeral home in south carolina, is expanding their business by adding a starbucks coffee corner for mourners and the public to serve as another support system for families who are grieving. the added facility marks the coffee corner as a first in the area, offering a comfortable and familiar space for patrons.
628	jason statham has been voted britain's 'manliest man' in a national survey, beating the likes of footballer david beckham, gerard butler and ray winstone. statham secured a quarter of the votes and the survey was organized to raise awareness for men's health issues.
629	scientists claim that being in a position of power changes how people speak, making their voices more loud and monotonous. powerful people produce speech in a way that is easily identified, with these vocal cues helping to determine power dynamics. this change in voice is so fundamental that even someone working on their voice like former uk prime minister margaret thatcher can be identified as having been in a position of power. researchers from san diego state university and columbia business school conducted two studies to test this theory. listeners could successfully pick up on these cues, recognising higher-pitched and more monotonous voices associated with higher power.
630	john shearen, a suspected child pornography distributor, was arrested on his 51st birthday after authorities found over 1 million images and videos of child pornography. shearen was active in transferring images and videos to dvds, and child underwear was found at his home in florida. he has been charged with numerous counts, and authorities believe the case against him will continue to grow. shearen was identified as the number one distributor of child pornography worldwide.
631	authorities are looking into the possibility that someone was with 19-year-old jessica chambers in her burning car before it exploded near a rural road in mississippi. no evidence has been found to suggest that chambers was alone before the blaze, but the motive behind the crime remains unknown. district attorney john champion revealed that investigators have spoken with the person who called 911 and cleared them of involvement, as well as chambers' relatives. the case is considered an arson, and investigators suspect the use of an accelerant. chambers died of her severe burns after the incident.
632	on october 24, 2012, bradford baumet killed three women and severely injured his ex-girlfriend at a florida hair salon. he committed suicide later that day. cctv footage shows him calmly walking to the hair salon and shooting the victims before walking away. baumet was already connected to the death of his neighbor, roberto colon, who found dead in his home after colon's car was stolen by baumet. there is no confirmed connection between baumet and colon's death, but it is possible that baumet had been staying at colon's home without permission. baumet had a history of domestic violence, multiple arrests, and mental health issues, which may have contributed to his actions. both victims – his ex-girlfriend, marcia santiago, and the salon owner, eugenia marte – had filed domestic violence injunctions against baumet the previous weeks.
633	architect stéphane malka has created a series of twenty-three homeless shelter pods attached to a railroad station in marseilles, france. these temporary housing structures are designed to provide space for homeless individuals in need. the pods are flexible and light and can withstand extreme weather conditions, making them ideal for emergency housing. the project, titled "architectural kama sutra," aims to transform neglected public space into housing solutions and highlight the housing crisis that continues to face low and middle-income earners in french cities. malka hopes other architects will adopt similar methods to address social problems and take advantage of public space in their city planning projects.
634	a nuclear missile base's armed forces failed a drill in 2013, which simulated a hostile takeover of a missile launch silo, specifically the 'empty quiver' scenario, where a nuclear weapon is lost, stolen or seized. the security team could not regain control efficiently, resulting in the armed forces flunking their safety and security inspection, which had a series of other setbacks over the year. air force review identified the failure was due to insufficient training, beginning with a lack of familiarity among security forces with 'complex scenario' exercises and unspecified shortcomings in 'leadership culture' and standardized simulations. there were corrective measures implemented, such as arranging for recapture exercises at one launch silo and tracking lessons from each exercise.
635	birds called great tits can learn and pass on traditions that have cultural importance, research has found. by observing the practices of others, great tits have developed the skills to alter their behaviours to fit in with their local environment. this process of cultural conformity also allows the birds to adapt to new behaviours and traditions they encounter in different areas. the great tits pecking through foil tops of milk bottles – a practice that began in the 1920s – is one example of this behaviour. these little birds are now the last remaining practitioners of this traditional bird behaviour.
636	duchess of cambridge attended the largest annual reception at buckingham palace wearing a dazzling tiara, believed to have been loaned to her by queen. the tiara was first owned by princess margaret and later princess margaret loaned it to serena stanhope for her wedding to princess margaret's son. this was the first time that kate was seen wearing a tiara in public since her wedding in 2011.
637	raheem sterling has been sent off in england's draw with ecuador, resulting in his absence from england's final warm-up friendly against honduras. the altercation occurred when sterling dived into an aggressive tackle, leading to a brawl with ecuador's antonio valencia. sterling's removal will make it challenging for him to secure a starting position for england's opening world cup game on june 14 against italy.
638	on april 19, 2013, federal agents raided the home of kevin curtis, a man accused of trying to poison president barack obama and mississippi senator roger wicker by sending letters containing the deadly poison ricin. armed with automatic weapons, federal agents entered the property in corinth, mississippi, taking no chances as they searched the home. curtis, a former elvis impersonator, was arrested and charged with trying to poison both the president and senator with ricin. the letters sent to the two politicians contained the same message: "to see a wrong and not expose it, is to become a silent partner to its continuance." law enforcement officials speculated that this incident was unrelated to the boston bombings. the investigation into these letters remained ongoing, and more letters may still be received.
639	members of iraq's yazidi minority are being accused of carrying out revenge attacks on sunni muslim villagers they believe helped isis commit atrocities on their community last year. arabs living in sinjar, iraq's nineveh province say groups of heavily armed yazidis have made four raids on the villages over the past two weeks, leaving 21 people dead and a further 17 missing. yazidis, whose ancient religion is a mix of zoroastrianism, christianity, and islam, experienced severe hardship last year when isis overpowered their community, killing around 500 members and capturing, enslaving, and raping thousands more. 
640	a 25-year-old spanish man was ordered by a judge to look for a job after taking his parents to court for stopping his allowance money. the man, from andalusia, was demanding a monthly allowance of $588 unless he tried to find a job. the judge ruled he must leave his parents' home within 30 days and also placed restrictions on financial assistance. the situation had deteriorated, with the parents claiming their son physically and verbally abused them. many spanish youth remain living with their parents due to limited job opportunities and high unemployment rates.
641	lord ashcroft, a 68-year-old british peer and former deputy chairman of the conservative party, posted a racy image of a sunbathing naked woman on his twitter account. the picture depicted a seagull covering her modesty, sparking a range of responses. he responded to a tweet speculating that his account may have been hacked, stating he was merely feeling "lighthearted" and that no hacking had occurred.
642	president barack obama announced on friday that he has picked ash carter to succeed outgoing defense secretary chuck hagel. carter, a well-decorated national security leader with over 30 years of service, has been confirmed before as deputy defense secretary and is highly respected within the government. both democrats and republicans in congress have generally shown support for the nomination, as carter is expected to be an important national security advisor.
643	a united airlines flight from honolulu to guam had to make an emergency landing on remote midway island due to an electrical odor in the cabin. the plane carried 335 passengers and 13 crew members, spending seven hours on the pacific atoll before being taken to hawaii by a replacement aircraft. the incident is currently under investigation.
644	steven reid, a 33-year-old former blackburn and west brom defender, has signed with burnley on a one-year deal. reid joins burnley as their fifth signing of the summer transfer window and replaces the departed albion. with a significant experience in the premier league, manager sean dyche believes reid's leadership qualities and knowledge of the top-flight games will help the younger players grow.
645	a religious freedom watchdog claims that smaller religious groups in iraq are facing "ongoing severe abuses" and requires response from the united states. this group also urges the u.s. state department to designate iraq as a "country of particular concern" to encourage policy responses, including public condemnations and even sanctions. the situation is particularly concerning for smaller religious groups, which do not have any militia or tribal structures for protection and have fled the country at a higher proportion than their population number.
646	a group of around 68 british councils and quangos attended an international property conference in cannes, france. the conference, known as mipim 2014, involved officials, property moguls, developers, and investment bankers engaged in business and socializing, with hotel rooms and stalls offering wine and canapes. although private sector staff were encouraged to attend, the cost of attending for officials was covered by the taxpayer. critics accused the event of being a "taxpayer-funded jolly" as local councils incurred significant expenses in sending representatives to the event.
647	a spanish politician, angel carromero, was sentenced to four years in prison for reckless driving in a car crash that resulted in the deaths of two cuban dissidents, oswaldo paya and harold cepero. paya, an influential activist who opposed cuba's government, had been killed in the accident, and his wife, ofelia acevedo, did not believe the cuban government's explanation that the accident was an accident. instead, she believed paya had been targeted for his activism, as evidenced by the other survivor, aron modig, having no recollection of the crash.
648	hundreds of jobs were at risk in three bae systems shipyards in the uk as defence chiefs planned to meet unions discussing the future of the facilities. the potential loss of over 1,000 jobs had been speculated. bae systems had been expected to announce the cuts as early as tomorrow. the future of the yards was uncertain owing to fears that the work would decline once two aircraft carriers were completed.
649	a new report reveals that women who suffer miscarriages face insensitive treatment from doctors, nurses, and receptionists, with many being left to wait in halls where they can hear others giving birth. the national institute for health and clinical excellence (nice) is advocating for staff to be retrained to show "dignity and respect" towards patients and developing new guidelines to detect and avoid such situations.

652	a pensioner named ben treuhaft set up a tent on portobello beach in edinburgh after his estranged wife issued an eviction notice. ben is the son of a communist, jessica treuhaft, who was the youngest of the famous mitford sisters. the mitford sisters were known for their social scandals and political affiliations; some were supporters of hitler and others were fascists. treuhaft's mother married a communist which led to her expulsion from their family and the sisters. they have been embroiled in court battles with the local council over their tent, while treuhaft receives support from locals who believe the piano will bring joy to their community.
653	the united kingdom is generating more wind energy than ever before, becoming the third-highest wind power generator in europe, as more than 1,200 wind turbines are constructed with the potential to start generating power within the next 12 months. a planned cut to subsidies, set to come into effect in april, is thought to be the motivation behind this trend. the uk has also overtaken italy and france, generating 8.4 gigawatts of wind energy, with the eu wind energy association reporting this figure. onshore wind turbines continue to be built across britain, up 60% since last year.
654	juventus is pressing ahead with their £2million bid to sign manchester united left-back patrice evra, as the french captain's wife is keen on moving, but new united manager louis van gaal wants the 33-year-old to stay. juventus will offer evra a two-year deal worth £55,000-a-week after tax, while united remain interested in signing juventus midfielder arturo vidal, but are currently miles away from the turin-based club's valuation of £37 million.
