947	the suspended miami dolphins guard richie incognito will reportedly remain on the nfl's suspended list and receive a playoff share, despite being accused of bullying teammate jonathan martin. incognito is in the final year of a contract with a $3.5 million base salary. the dolphins have faced significant distractions due to the scandal but continue to maintain a strong position for a playoff berth.
948	jaime lerner, former mayor of curitiba, brazil, shares that any city in the world can be transformed, with less than three years' work on the quality of life. he emphasizes the importance of urban mobility, sustainability, and social diversity and co-existence. he believes that the city is a solution to our problems and supports policies that push cars out of city centers.
949	the journalist who first reported the shooting death of argentinian prosecutor alberto nisman has disappeared. damian pachter received threats beforehand but did not elaborate. nisman was found dead last sunday before he was due to testify before congress about his explosive allegations that president cristina kirchner shielded iranian officials wanted in the south american country's biggest terrorist attack. the prosecutor leading the investigation claimed nisman's death was caused by a gunshot at close range, but evidence may not confirm whether any other individuals were involved.
950	warren weinstein, a 72-year-old man from maryland, was kidnapped by al-qaeda in pakistan in 2011. a newly released video of weinstein by al-qaeda shows him asking president obama for help and expressing his concerns about being forgotten by the us government. weinstein's family, however, has continued to fight for his release, revealing their heartbreak in the video as their once vibrant father had lost his former self. al-qaeda demanded that the us stop airstrikes in afghanistan, pakistan, somalia and yemen, and release prisoners from guantanamo bay and end drone strikes in exchange for weinstein's release. 
951	police arrested 21-year-old kevin michael hagan after he was caught nearby during another break-in. hagan admitted to burglarizing six other homes, including nancy pelosi's in napa, california. no one was home at the time of the break-in, and the police found smashed glass and a watch stolen from pelosi's residence upon arresting him. the incident occurred while pelosi was away preparing for the presidential election in washington.
952	a romanian pimp named marcel vasile, 36, has been sentenced to 15 years in prison for his involvement in selling a woman to sex traffickers. he was identified as a 'menacing' pimp who forced his victim into prostitution, controlling her activity and raping her. vasile was brought to justice after being on the run for nearly five years. he was found guilty of rape, trafficking, and controlling prostitution and faced trial at manchester crown court. the case's main investigators praised vasile's capture and called him a calculating and menacing character who showed no remorse for his crimes.
953	a study found that portugal has the highest percentage of female millionaires, with 23% of the country's millionaires being women. the report highlights a lack of gender equality in terms of individual wealth, with countries like saudi arabia and japan ranking at the bottom. the top ten most equal countries for multimillionaires are diverse and may not align with predicted countries. asia appears to be leading the way in gender equality, and wealth should be distributed more evenly across genders in these emerging markets.
954	korean air senior vice-president cho hyun-ah has been charged following her 'nut rage' incident on an incheon-bound flight last december, where she demanded the removal of a crew member for serving her macadamia nuts in a bag instead of on a dish. cho could face up to 15 years in prison if found guilty of the four charges she faces, which include threatening the plane's safety, using violence against flight crew, hindering a government probe, and forcing the flight's purser off the plane.
955	thousands of firefighters in california work to contain a wildfire that spread to 1,300 acres in just two days. local officials urge residents to leave their homes as the fire continues to grow in both size and intensity due to an extreme dry year. with over 670 firefighters on the ground, the fire is currently 20% contained and the cause is under investigation. the drought and rising temperatures contribute to the intense and active rate of fires occurring this year in california.
956	a new report highlights poor maths ability amongst student maths teachers, with nearly half failing to pass a year 9 naplan test. griffith university lecturer dr stephen norton found that many students had a maths ability equivalent to that of a 12-year-old, and struggled with key concepts typically mastered in primary school. the results have led to calls for an investigation into how mathematics is taught at school and university level.
957	three times as many children have tried electronic cigarettes as have smoked tobacco, according to recent figures. this development has resulted in concern that e-cigs are acting as a 'nicotine gateway' for children, increasing their risk of transitioning to more harmful cigarettes. a study of 1,601 pupils aged 10 and 11 in wales found that six per cent had tried e-cigs, as opposed to just two per cent who had smoked tobacco. further, those who had tried the devices were seven times more likely to admit they might take up smoking within the next two years. the findings highlight that e-cigarettes may act as a gateway for children into smoking despite there being no evidence they are as harmful as traditional cigarettes. 
958	in a 2014 world cup match between brazil and colombia, brazilian player fernandinho aggressively marked and fouled colombian star james rodriguez multiple times throughout the game without drawing a yellow card. the similarities between fernandinho's tactics against rodriguez and italy's man-marking of diego maradona at the 1982 world cup sparked comparisons and drew attention to potential bias in the match's officiating.
959	an eco-conscious father was arrested and held in jail overnight for plugging his electric car into a charging point at a school. kevin kamooneh, a former university professor, was charged with misdemeanour theft after plugging into a school charging station for several weeks while his son attended tennis lessons nearby. kamooneh, who claims he was not aware he wasn't allowed to use the charging station, was arrested at home on november 13 and held briefly before being released on a $150 bail.
960	katy holmes, a 33-year-old woman, was caught having sex with a stranger on the bonnet of a car in a residential street in blackpool. the couple had only met minutes earlier and initially claimed that the act was consensual. however, an upset witness called the police, leading to holmes' arrest and subsequent sentencing. she received an eight-week prison term suspended for 12 months, and was also given 12 months of supervision.
961	in harry redknapp's new book, which is out exclusively in serial format in sportsmail, he recounts the tale of former football rivals roy keane and patrick vieira, with their infamous clashes during their playing careers and how they impacted each other even after retiring.
962	an oklahoma teen and his friends have been charged with murdering the teen's father and younger brother, amid allegations of a staged home invasion, which revealed a homicide plot involving smothering the victim. all five have pleaded not guilty.
963	a lucky boxer named stella has been saved after firefighters rescued her from a burning building in santa monica, california. stella was found behind a mattress in her home, unconscious, suffering from smoke inhalation. the brave firefighters used an oxygen mask to save her and after 15 minutes, she regained color to her mouth and began moving. her owners were away during the fire, and she was taken to an animal hospital for treatment. the fire remains under investigation, and nobody was injured.
964	the all blacks, a new zealand rugby team, arrive in wales with a winning record against wales. the team's head coach plans to pick the best players for the game because they are a strong team, and wales finished fourth at the world cup and are improving their team since then. the size and strength of welsh players like jamie roberts, george north, and luke charteris also worry hansen. the all blacks have been training hard to improve, and their captain, richie mccaw, is one of the superstars for rugby in wales.
965	the sky at night, sir patrick moore's famous astronomy show, may be removed from television screens by december as discussions continue on its future. the programme could be pulled as early as december and features coverage of general astronomical and space-related topics. the decision has caused widespread anger among viewers as it could mark the end of the longest-running programme with its same presenter on television.
966	on friday night, a 22-year-old, armed with a fake pistol, started driving his black bmw around the beachfront community of isla vista, firing gunshots and killing seven people. the shootings happened in a usually busy college setting around 9:00 p.m., and multiple people thought the loud pops were fireworks. the shootings took place near the uc santa barbara campus and the local community college.
967	one of shell oil's drilling ships, the noble discoverer, slipped its mooring and drifted towards an aleutian island in alaska. there were no reports of injuries, pollution, or damage. the incident has raised concerns about a potential grounding near dutch harbor, but no evidence was found of the ship running aground. if shell finds oil and begins drilling, it could create thousands of jobs, but opponents warn of possible pollution and the impact on local inuit eskimo communities and the environment. shell has been forced to postpone drilling due to unanticipated ice, raising concerns about its timeline and capacity to drill before the expiration of their u.s. permits.
968	artwork depicting manchester united's famous no. 7s from the past and present have been created by various artists. the collection includes george best, bryan robson, eric cantona, david beckham, cristiano ronaldo, and angel di maria, who is the latest to continue the tradition. the artwork celebrates their impact on the club and the excitement surrounding the no. 7 jersey.
969	in a bizarre courtroom confrontation, dave lee travis demanded one of his alleged victims, camilla long, to move seats, claiming she was making him "uncomfortable." travis was sentenced to a suspended sentence for one count of sexual assault. the cost of the court proceedings was estimated to be over £1 million.
970	flight lieutenant tony rogers, a british world war ii veteran, who fought for poland, survived being imprisoned in the soviet gulag, and later served as a raf pilot and was awarded several medals including the air crew europe star, the defence medal, and the virtuti militari, has passed away aged 91. rogers led an extraordinary life, escaping imprisonment in a daring escape from siberia and later taking on the challenging roles of a spitfire fighter pilot and a bomber pilot.
971	a north carolina boy found a 5.16-carat "honey brown diamond" while visiting an arkansas park with his family. in this park, visitors can search for diamonds in a 37.5-acre field, which used to be a diamond mining site until it was opened to the public as a state park. the crater of diamonds state park has a 'finders-keepers' policy, allowing visitors to take diamonds they find home with them.
972	andrea sneiderman, the widow of russell sneiderman who was murdered outside a preschool in atlanta, georgia, was charged with conspiracy to murder her husband. the gunman, hemy neuman, was convicted four months prior, and andrea is accused of conspiring with him to murder her husband to be together, eliminate neuman's debt problems, and benefit from the couple's assets and insurance policies. she was charged with malice murder, criminal attempt to commit murder, racketeering, perjury, and insurance fraud.
973	a new study found men who frequently consume a lot of ground beef and other red meat have a higher risk of developing aggressive prostate cancer if it's grilled or well-done. this risk can be reduced if the meat is consumed medium-rare or rarer. scientists believe this is due to carcinogens that form when meat is cooked at high temperatures. the study's findings support the notion that dietary factors may be harmful but also point to the need for further research regarding environmental risk factors in prostate cancer.
974	a small utah town's city councilwoman has proposed to arm every citizen and teacher, encouraging every household to have a firearm, and provide gun training to school teachers. the suggestion aims at ensuring the readiness of residents to face potential criminal activity and mass shootings. the proposal has received support from a majority of council members but is opposed by school administrators who claim more guns would make schools less safe. the policy proposal is scheduled to be debated next month. 
975	the widespread closure of public toilets could be putting lives at risk, warns health experts. campaigners say being desperate to go to the bathroom could increase the risk of heart attacks and strokes, and that many people are becoming 'prisoners in their own homes'. four in ten public toilets have closed in the past decade; health experts say this is leading to an increased risk of heart attacks and strokes for vulnerable citizens.
976	during the collapse of a half-finished mall in tongaat, near durban, south africa, it is reported that at least two people have died and 29 are injured after the roof partially collapsed in the area under construction. police search the rubble using cranes, dogs, and torches, and rescue teams work into the night to continue the search for any additional survivors.
977	an nhs trust has admitted responsibility for the death of a young mother who killed herself in a hospital room while suffering from severe post-natal depression. diana mager, 33, committed suicide in august 2012 while being treated at green parks house psychiatric unit in orpington, kent. she had suffered severe post-natal depression since giving birth to her daughter sofia in november 2011 and was self-harming. prior to her death, she had made several suicide attempts. the oxleas nhs foundation trust initially claimed that her death ‘could not have been predicted or prevented.’ they later acknowledged that the tragedy could have been avoided.
978	amnesty international calls on nigeria to arrest sudanese president omar al-bashir if he attends an african union summit there, as nigeria is party to the treaty that created the international criminal court. al-bashir is wanted by the icc on charges of war crimes and crimes against humanity, related to five years of campaigns of violence in the darfur region of sudan. 
979	the shakespeare birthplace trust caused controversy when they made changes to shakespeare's wife's childhood home without obtaining proper planning permission. the grade i-listed thatched barn, used as a pea shed before being converted into a kiosk and cafe, was not known to have planning restrictions, and the trust did not apply for permission to change the use of the space. stratford district council requires the trust to apply for retrospective planning permission to rectify the breach, which could lead to a transformation of the building back to how it was before the renovations.
980	tokyo has a vibrant nightlife with numerous hidden bars providing unique experiences. it has a strong clubbing scene, including ultra-stylish rooftop bars like the new york bar, unique spaces like henry's on seven, and traditional experiences like kita aoyama salon. popular locales include the roppongi and golden gai areas. some recommendations include intimate bars like la jetee, modern clubs like le baron de paris and womb superclub.

982	one in five penile enlargement surgeries worldwide take place in germany, with an estimated 20% of the procedures occurring there in 2013. germany is reportedly the leading location for men seeking penile enhancements due to its high volume of operations, with the german centre for urology and phalloplasty performing over 6,000 operations annually. surgery can result in extra three to six centimeters in length and a two to three centimeter increase in girth, with patients able to choose enhancements to the glans penis. the operations do not cause visible scars, with a "low-risk" procedure costing approximately 9,600 euros.
983	ocado, the innovative food delivery company, has been in talks with global retailers to expand abroad and license its technology, looking to transform the industry. by signing a 25-year distribution contract with morrisons, ocado will provide systems that will become the backbone for the online debut of the uk's fourth-largest grocer. this move aims to catch up with tesco and asda, who have sold groceries over the internet for years. ocado, still not profitable, has created an automated warehouse filled with robots and conveyor belts and owns the software powering it.
984	after 15 months in orbit, the u.s air force's highly secretive, unmanned x-37b space plane returned to earth successfully on saturday, landing at the vandenberg air force base in california. military officials released a short video of the smooth landing, which captured various parts of the spacecraft's descent, including its final descent in infrared light.
985	kreshnik berisha, a former football player at makkabi frankfurt - germany's largest jewish sports club - was arrested after returning to frankfurt in december 2014, following six months in syria. the first isis-suspected member to stand trial in the country, he is expected to receive a prison sentence of three to four-and-a-half years. makkabi frankfurt, known for its jewish identity and tolerant values, was shocked by berisha's radicalization and has opened its doors to everyone in the past decade, with president alon meyer stressing his commitment to the club's core values.
986	scientists have discovered huge reserves of the oldest water on earth, trapped deep within the planet's crust, and estimate that there could be around 2.5 million cubic miles of this water buried beneath the ground. the water is up to 2.7 billion years old and has the potential to support new forms of life.
987	former royal bank of scotland boss fred goodwin lost patience and suffered losses when neighbors took matters into their own hands by chopping down sections of his massive hedge, causing it to grow shorter and block sunlight, despite the fact that they still do not agree on its height. goodwin, nicknamed "fred the shred," has been in a prolonged legal dispute with his neighbors since 2013 over the 25-foot leylandii hedge blocking light and views from his house. residents were unhappy with his slow response to their request for him to trim the hedge, leading to many frustrated years of arguments and a possible loss in property value. the high hedges (scotland) act, which empowers councils to make decisions and enforce agreements between neighbors with hedges that hinder light, is expected to enter into force on april 1.
988	on tuesday night, a 6.9-magnitude earthquake affected the pacific ocean near the solomon islands, following a string of earthquakes the previous day and a quake in the philippines. no tsunamis were expected. the solomon islands sit within the ring of fire, which experiences frequent earthquakes and volcanic eruptions. the u.s. geological survey received no initial reports of damage.
989	a study published in january 2008 suggests that a mercury-based preservative called thimerosal did not cause autism in children. although some advocacy groups still have doubts, the research shows autism rates continued to rise in california, even after thimerosal was removed from vaccines. the main culprits doctors point to for autism are genetics and environmental factors, but the reasons for these factors remain unclear.
990	sarah palin did not visit troops in iraq, as her aide confirmed foreign travel details. initially, her itinerary included us military installations in germany and kuwait, but it was clarified that iraq was merely a refueling stop and was not visited. the revelations are among a series of barbs between the two presidential campaigns, with mccain and palin criticized for their qualifications and perceived lies.
991	in a historic referendum, scotland has decided to remain a part of the united kingdom, rejecting the possibility of independence with 55% of the votes. scottish first minister alex salmond resigned from his posts shortly after the verdict as leader of the pro-independence scottish national party. the outcome of the referendum has been met with relief by many across the uk, who are hopeful that political discussions will continue surrounding reform and the sharing of power between countries in the union.

993	chirag jagtiani has launched an inconspicuous bracelet called spotnsave that connects to a smartphone via bluetooth, alerting friends and family if the wearer feels threatened. the bracelet allows users to send an sos text message to chosen emergency contacts by pressing a button twice, discreetly providing the location data of the wearer. a free android app and a version for ios is coming soon, while the bracelet retails at $45 (£27) including shipping. 
994	hsbc, europe's largest bank, will lay off 14,000 employees worldwide to save $2 to $3 billion by 2016. this is in addition to the 42,000 job cuts in the past two years as the bank tries to reorganize operations for greater profitability and efficiency in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis. the bank's ceo, stuart gulliver, promised to focus on costs in 2013, resulting in the expected layoffs.
995	barnes & noble has announced their competitor to amazon's kindle e-reader, the nook, which comes with a 6-inch 16-level grayscale display and shares similar features to kindle; however, it offers wi-fi connectivity, a virtual keyboard, multi-font options, an 11.2-ounce weight, and a 10-day battery life. the nook allows users to borrow and lend books through their library service. nook is available for pre-order starting at $260 and will be released in november.
996	kabul's police chief and chief of criminal investigations have submitted their resignations to the afghan interior ministry due to the country's safety concerns but have not yet been approved by the ministry. they were ordered to complete their investigation into the suicide attacks that occurred on friday, at one of the city's most high-profile locations, killing at least 17 people and resulting in numerous injuries. once the investigation is complete, the interior minister will make a decision on the resignations, as claimed by taliban.
997	the us military prison at guantanamo bay, cuba, is unlikely to close by the obama administration's deadline of january 2010 due to legal complications, according to two senior administration officials. the delay may provide fodder for republicans, who argue that shutting the prison would make the united states less safe. the white house is optimistic about closing the detention facility for terrorism suspects soon and is working on finding third-party countries to accept remaining detainees.
998	millie brown, a 26-year-old artist, has made a living out of pushing boundaries by regurgitating paint to create abstract, colorful canvases. she mixes milk containing vivid dyes and then regurgitates the liquid onto canvas or white clothing while recording the process on camera. famous fans of millie's work, including lady gaga, have showcased her unique vomit art. through innovative performances and art installations, millie challenges people's preconceptions and expresses human emotions in her work. her first-ever art exhibition, titled "muted chronology," features her abstract, vomit art at the strand gallery in london.
999	a recent study by the austin institute for the study of family and culture found that there is a strong correlation between religious affiliation and personal happiness. the study surveyed 15,738 americans between ages 18 and 60, and those who attend religious services weekly were more likely to report being "very happy" compared to those who never attend. the connection between religion and happiness stems from the social support within religious communities, which may help individuals to better cope with difficult situations.
1000	a handmade white dress worn in the iconic 1970s tennis poster "tennis girl" was recently auctioned, selling for £15,500. made by fiona butler's friend carol knotts, the dress was the subject of a lot that included the tennis racquet from the image, two copies of the poster and an image license owned by photographer martin elliott, who unfortunately passed away in 2010. fiona butler and martin elliott were then-university students at the university of birmingham, and butler's dress featured in the "tennis girl" image taken on the birmingham tennis courts in 1976. the dress broke its £2,000 estimate upon selling at the auction held in stourbridge, west midlands.

1002	google's ad preferences page is part of their advertising network, gathering user information through history of visits to sites. this creates a detailed consumer profile, which could be accurate, yet mistakes have been made with information like age and gender. privacy activists are worried as they believe consumers are under the most significant privacy assault today. users can opt-out or manually edit their details. google assures that it only stores information on popular subjects, but with the ever-expanding world of internet usage, privacy remains a significant concern.

1007	karen perrin, a senior assistant at the bill and melinda gates foundation in washington, dc, spent eight hours trapped inside a restroom at work. she tried different methods to escape by attempting to move the latch, using a metal rod to hack at the wall, and sticking her arm through a small opening to open the door from the other side. after her husband called her multiple times to check on her, she finally managed to escape and contacted her family, who were on the verge of searching for her. ms. perrin suffered contusions to her hands from her attempts to escape, but she does not plan to pursue legal action.

1010	in the united kingdom, during a cold snap in january 2013, the public was encouraged to build snowmen to slow down the thaw and potentially prevent flooding. experts noted that compacted snow and ice due to the melting of snowmen will melt more slowly than the loose snow, creating a balanced thaw that would help protect homes. the environment agency added that the most effective method for protecting against potential flooding is to check if one's residence is in a flood risk area and sign up for free flood warnings from their website.

1013	a 10-year-old boy scout, aj underwood, accidentally hanged himself while practicing knot tying, using a rope he had been given as part of his merit badge. the family was on their way to a birthday party when his mother found him, who had been in good spirits and making good grades, hanging from his bunk bed. despite efforts to revive him, the boy could not be saved, later being rushed to st. vincent's blount hospital where he was pronounced dead. investigators believe the tragic incident was a freak accident and there was no indication that the boy intended to do harm.
1014	football is a significant part of brazilian culture, bringing joy and hope to the people despite their nation's struggles with poverty and inequality. while brazil has won the fifa world cup several times, it has never won an olympic gold medal in men's or women's fútbol. brazil is currently under immense pressure to win the 2014 world cup and the 2016 olympics, as the nation feels these championships are important symbols that showcase the passion and talent of its people.

1016	in 2006, sacha baron cohen portrayed the character borat, a mock kazakh tv journalist, in a comedy film which led to a significant increase in tourism and international attention for the country. former kazakh foreign minister yerzhan kazykhanov publicly thanked cohen, stating that borat had attracted a tenfold increase in visa applications and helped promote kazakhstan to the world. the film was initially met with outrage in kazakhstan, but the positive impact of the tourism boost has led the nation to come to terms with the portrayal and even capitalize on it in various ways.

1018	in bangladesh, 37 people were killed and over 500 injured in violent street fighting between police and islamic hardliners demanding the death penalty for blasphemy. this unrest led to clashes, riots, burning of shops, and roadblocks in the capital of dhaka and its suburbs. tensions escalated and police used tear gas, rubber bullets, and water cannons to disperse the thousands of demonstrators, resulting in multiple deaths and injuries. bangladesh's government refused demands for a blasphemy law and the newly formed islamist group hefajat-e-islam threatened to launch a campaign to oust the government if their demands were not met.

1022	on friday, a huge crowd gathered in london, uk, for a mass "moonwalk", dancing to michael jackson songs and paying tribute to his legacy. two young fans organized the event, which attracted many people, including life-long jackson fan milo yiannopoulos, who started the spontaneous flash mob to remind people of jackson's greatness and his music. the event was well-received, and more tributes are expected to take place around the world.
1023	comedian bill cosby's social media stunt asking fans to create memes using his photos backfired on him as fans instead focused on the rape allegations against him. this led to cosby's original tweet being deleted and a scornful response from barbara bowman, a victim of cosby's twisted sexual abuse. the #cosbymeme trend resulted in a flood of memes with many people feeling that comedy and public expression did not justify the pain of cosby's victims.
1024	a pennsylvania mother, donna m. krupp, has been arrested and charged with arson and reckless endangerment after allegedly setting fire to a police detective's house in response to her son's arrest. krupp, 52, was caught on camera using a grill lighter to set fire to christmas decorations at the detective's home on december 30, ultimately causing extensive damage to the house and its contents. detective ernie morris' family cat was killed, and his daughters, an artist and musician, lost their portfolio and violin, respectively, in the blaze. krupp had been resentful towards the detective since june, when her son was arrested on an outstanding traffic violation for evading police. krupp remains in custody on a $1 million bail.
1025	a damning report by the independent police complaints commission (ipcc) revealed that police failed to investigate rape cases, including those involving retired security guard and serial killer jean says. detectives from scotland yard’s sapphire unit, which investigates rape and sexual assault, coerced women into dropping rape allegations, pressuring them into describing the attacks as consensual sex in order to reduce the number of unsolved cases. victims were also closely questioned by a detective constable before talking to a specialist officer. the report found that the sapphire unit had performed inappropriately, prioritizing targets over victim protection and focusing on deterring and detecting crime. the ipcc’s report examined the practices of the southwark squad between july 2008 and september 2009, revealing the squad was "underperforming and overstretched" during that period.
1026	- french judges have ordered google to remove details of former formula 1 chief max mosley's sadomasochistic private life from its search engine - the ruling came after the news of the world published videos and photos of mosley participating in an s&m orgy in 2008 - max mosley argued that sexual activity is a private matter and that the request is aimed at protecting privacy - google has two months to introduce a filter for prevent the material from appearing in search results - the decision raises questions about the responsibility of companies like google to police the internet
1027	the miss world competition has evolved significantly in fashion and beauty since its inception in 1951. in the early years, contestants had to show off their figures in swimwear rounds, with the first winner crowned wearing a bikini. over the years, trends have varied from big eyes and winged eyeliner to the glitter-heavy gowns that the competition is now famous for. the event has seen some famous names pass through, such as aishwarya rai and cindy breakspeare, who later became an accomplished jazz musician married to bob marley. the competition takes place annually, with contestants arriving from all over the world to compete for the title of miss world.
1028	a court in zimbabwe sentenced former u.s. representative melvin reynolds to a $100 fine or five days in prison for violating the country's immigration laws. reynolds' lawyer expected him to pay the fine and be released. he then faces immediate deportation, as he entered the country on a 14-day visa that was only renewed once and has now expired. reynolds was first elected to represent illinois' 2nd congressional district in 1992 and later resigned after being convicted on charges related to his relationship with a 16-year-old campaign worker.
1029	a controversial u.s. website, matchingdonors, allows people who need kidneys to directly appeal for a donor online. it launches in the uk, where the nhs only operates an anonymous scheme and matchingdonors can connect prospective donors with those in need of a kidney. one uk recipient, saira khan, has signed up, stating she needs a kidney and would love to return to her job as a teacher. the human tissue authority (hta) has concerns about the website and plans to review its implications and legal parameters on september 10.
1030	former spanish tennis player carlos moya, who reached the top of the world tennis rankings, is considering retiring after a 15-year career due to a foot injury. the 34-year-old has not played a match since may and hopes to play in a farewell tournament in seville before embarking on life outside of tennis. moya is the first spanish player to reach the top of the tennis world rankings but has now dropped to 519th in the world, winning 20 titles, reaching the semi-finals of the 1998 u.s. open and winning the davis cup with spain in 2004.
1031	a seven-year-old girl from wales has become the first child in the world to be diagnosed with two different types of leukaemia. lauryn robinson suffers from acute lymphoblastic leukaemia, which affects hundreds of children every year, as well as non-hodgkin lymphoma. she has a rare condition called dual-hit leukaemia and requires a bone marrow donor to come forward urgently. medical experts are taking her treatment one step at a time, as it's new ground for them. her parents are hopeful that by spreading awareness, more people will sign up for bone marrow donor registries in hopes of finding a suitable match.
1032	washington police have informed the mother of slain congressional intern chandra levy that an arrest is imminent in her daughter's 2001 death. law enforcement officials are expected to announce the arrest soon, but have not yet mentioned the name of the suspect. levy was killed in the park where two other assaults also occurred around the same time as her disappearance.
1033	a french ad agency created eurostar posters aiming to promote french travel to london for the 2012 olympics. the posters portray english pub sports and traditional greek statues inverting the athletic form to depict british subjects as beer-swilling slobs with a penchant for pub games. the advertisements intend to poke fun at rival british and french olympic aspirations while promoting eurostar's high-speed train service to london.
1034	fox is investing millions in its upcoming reality series "utopia," a social experiment where 15 participants create their own mini societies on a secluded piece of land. the contestants have $10,000 and use creative resources to build structures, develop their own economy, and create their ideal civilization. it will be broadcast on tuesday and some fridays and aired online 24/7. the series has faced internal struggles, financial challenges, and staffing changes as fox adapts to new programming and executive team members.
1035	kate, the duchess of cambridge, appears to be breastfeeding her newborn son, displaying her desire to give him the best possible start in life. she was seen leaving kensington palace last week in a £50 maternity dress designed for breastfeeding mums. since her return home, she has been seen wearing a similar, highly desired blossom dress by seraphine, a british maternity wear specialist, designed to make it easier and more comfortable for mothers to breastfeed. breastfeeding expert cecile renaud claims that kate has purchased a couple of breastfeeding styles from her company.
1036	a newly opened bar in a berlin hotel encourages guests to pair their favorite perfume with cocktails, resulting in a unique drinking experience. mixologist and perfume expert henning heissen designed the menu, which includes cocktails crafted to match scents like georgia armani and yves saint laurent. vegan variants are also available, allowing all guests to join in the sensory experiment.
1037	facing some of the lowest favorability and approval ratings in recent history, us president barack obama and democrats are preparing for election day. according to poll findings, only 40% of americans approve obama's job performance, while just 39% have a favorable view of the democratic party. obama's approval has been blamed for impacting democratic candidates, which may result in republicans taking control of congress.
1038	comedian george carlin, known for his observational skills and talent for language, has passed away as a result of heart failure. he was an influence on jerry seinfeld and other comedians, having "an amazing breadth of subject matter" and a unique ability to turn his attention to mundane matters, such as couch pillows or politics, and make them seem absurd. despite his profanity, scatology, and irreverence, carlin was awarded the mark twain prize for american humor in november and had a lasting legacy in comedy.
1039	bayern munich remains unstoppable and uncatchable in the bundesliga after a 5-0 victory over eintracht frankfurt, extending their lead to 13 points. despite an injury setback for new signing kim kallstrom, arsenal managed a 2-0 victory against crystal palace and now lead the standings two points ahead of manchester city. meanwhile, juventus takes a nine-point lead in serie a with a 3-1 victory against inter milan.

1041	larry ellison, co-founder of oracle and currently worth $51.3 billion, is stepping down as ceo while continuing as chairman and chief technology officer to focus on product engineering, technology development, and strategy, promoting safra catz and mark hurd as co-ceos. jeff henley becomes oracle's vice chairman.

1043	the royal bank of scotland (rbs) was fined £390 million for its role in the libor rate-rigging scandal. financial regulators released damning emails from rbs traders discussing manipulating interest rates, with one trader saying, "i'm like a whore's drawers." the manipulations, which also included boasting of significant profits, occurred between january 2006 and november 2010. rbs was the first bank to settle in the case and received fines from various regulators, with six employees facing disciplinary action. the bank must now face criminal sanctions in the us.
1044	keri-anne payne, a double world champion, narrowly missed out on an olympic medal in the serpentine. despite facing a competitive race, payne gave her best and finished fourth in a grueling ten-kilometre open water event. although disappointed with her result, payne's teammates, fiancé, and friends stayed supportive throughout the competition. although the british swimming team's overall olympics performance was disappointing compared to previous years, payne's determination and spirit remained strong, and she proved to be a formidable athlete.
1045	carlo tavecchio, a candidate involved in a racism controversy, was elected as the new president of the italian football federation. tavecchio, 71, won the election after three rounds of voting in rome. despite withdrawals from several clubs, tavecchio received 63.33% of the votes. he has promised to prove his doubters wrong and work on reforms within the football system.
1046	coronation street star bill roache pleaded not guilty to historic sexual offences involving five girls during a hearing at preston crown court in lancashire. the 81-year-old soap star denied the charges and his trial is scheduled for january 2014. roache, who played ken barlow, vowed to deny the allegations when he was initially charged.
1047	new jersey governor chris christie is facing intense scrutiny from both republican and democratic politicians following a controversy involving the closure of a bridge, which had political motives behind it. the conservative base of the republican party is generally not warm toward christie due to disagreements on a variety of issues. however, so far most republican conservatives are not actively attacking him over the bridge scandal, though a few are skeptical about the extent to which the story is being explained. the issue may hurt christie's image but he remains a top contender for the republican 2016 presidential nomination.
1048	a ship hull discovered at the former world trade center site was traced back to colonial-era philadelphia, revealing a hudson river sloop that might have been deliberately or accidentally sunk and later buried by trash. scientists used “dendroprovenancing” to determine the ship's origins using tree ring analysis.
1049	mindy mccready, a country singer, tragically passed away after her untimely death. a second secret autopsy revealed that drugs may have played a part in her suicide; she was found deceased in arkansas after checking out of a mental health substance abuse program. her funeral was open to the public in florida, where family and friends gathered to mourn her life. mccready's life was filled with struggles and allegations; she wanted to be healed but was too emotional to understand. the mother of two was survived by her two sons, and a second memorial service was held for her in nashville.
1050	a new study suggests that touching merchandise in stores can lead to a sense of ownership, overpaying, and buying more. this highlights the importance of practicing self-control during shopping trips, especially during economic downturns. furthermore, even online browsing and window shopping can impact our spending habits, emphasizing the need for discipline to improve our budget management.
1051	american robby gordon faces disqualification from the dakar rally due to his hummer's engine not conforming to regulations. stewards recommended his removal from the race, but the ultimate decision rests with the french automobile sport federation (ffsa). gordon lost 15 minutes after suffering damage to his car, and his overall position is currently behind fellow competitor stephane peterhansel. despite the setback, both motorbike riders cyril despres and marc coma are 16 seconds apart in the motorcycle section.
1052	asteroid 2012 da14, moving at 17,450 miles per hour, will give earth its closest shave with an asteroid its size in known history, passing by on february 15. while it will give earth's surface a very close look, the asteroid is too small to be seen with the naked eye; only telescopes can.
1053	a constantly bickering couple, akilah and kris, reconnected after high school and eventually got married. however, their differing communication styles and various problems led them to consider divorce. after facing their breaking point and realizing they wanted a better, happier marriage, akilah and kris agreed to discuss their issues without arguing. they decided to set aside time to think through an issue before hashing out a solution, as well as try to connect with each other emotionally during disagreements. as a result, despite their ongoing problems, akilah and kris now communicate more effectively and are more emotionally connected.

1057	the manta resort on pemba island in tanzania has added a unique and innovative underwater bedroom, designed by swedish company genberg underwater hotels. the three-story, 250-meter-offshore structure includes a bathroom, lounge area at sea level, and bedroom underwater, providing stunning views of fish and squid at night. popular with divers due to the coral reef, the resort charges $1,500 per night for a two-person stay or $900 for a single night stay.

1062	a bionic hand, which sends sensory information back and forth, is about to be attached directly to an amputee's nervous system, providing real-time sensory feedback. the team hopes this will lead to a new generation of artificial limbs that can more closely mimic real body parts and provide increased dexterity, enhancing comfort and user acceptance. in the future, this technology could also help patients with paralyzed backs.

1068	in 2012, uk deputy prime minister nick clegg revealed that a first-born daughter of the duke and duchess of cambridge would become queen, effectively overturning the current 300-year-old law granting male heirs priority in the royal line of succession. clegg stated that the changes were already in practice, in line with commonwealth leaders' agreement in october 2011, aimed at avoiding a constitutional crisis if the future queen were a girl born to a brother's rule.
1069	the us navy has announced that the aircraft carrier uss ronald reagan will replace the uss george washington at yokosuka naval base near tokyo. the timeline for the move has not yet been determined, with the washington heading to virginia for refueling and overhaul. the decision prioritizes the most capable ships being stationed forward, allowing for the most rapid response times for maritime and joint forces. the reagan has previously served in japan after a 2011 tsunami, and in 2008 the washington took over from uss kitty hawk as the first us nuclear-powered carrier based in japan.
1070	in january 2013, police in the uk were looking for a criminal who resembled the popular children's character burglar bill. the thief wore similar attire to the fictional character, including a distinctive dark blue and white striped jersey and a black woolly hat and gloves. the thief and an accomplice stole two cameras and xbox controllers from a waitrose store in southend, essex, and they were caught on cctv. the book series, written by janet and allan ahlberg, was published by penguin from 1977 to 1999 and follows burglar bill and his adventures.
1071	formally conjoined twins emmett and owen ezell celebrated their first birthday with the doctors and nurses who helped give them life at a party in dallas, texas. the twins, who were born sharing a kidney and intestine, are now separated and growing up. they are developing their own distinct personalities but enjoy spending time together, wearing matching outfits and sharing moments, as they celebrate their individuality and resilience.

1075	a gene linked to grey matter in our brains and intelligence has been discovered. scientists found a variant of the gene was connected to less brain matter in the cerebral cortex, which affects memory, attention, perception, etc. the study in king's college london is the first to show a genetic link between intelligence and grey matter. the gene variant affects neuron communication. the research may help understand certain intellectual impairment forms and could be used to better diagnose and treat psychiatric disorders such as schizophrenia and autism.

1081	police in milwaukee, wisconsin evacuated part of a suburb to search for evidence related to a gun massacre at a sikh temple on sunday. the focus of the investigation is a home in cudahy, which is believed to be associated with the unidentified suspect who killed six people and injured dozens more before being killed by police. the fbi arrived in the area later with armoured trucks and a bomb disposal unit. the motive for the attack remains unknown, but officials are treating it as an act of "domestic terrorism" and analyzing the suspect's tattoos.
1082	tiny eight-legged mites related to spiders are known to live on every human face and have long been found in people's hair follicles, according to a new study. the mites, named demodex, live in people's hair follicles, consuming the oils secreted by our skin. 100% of people in a study had demodex mites on their faces and dna from these mites has been found in more than one-fifth of all humans. scientists still don't know how the mites spread between humans, but they propose that they may be passed down through breastfeeding.
1083	michael gove, the uk's education secretary, had a calm conversation with armed police officers in downing street, after his ministerial car was locked out due to the security lockdown following prime minister's questions. this incident is not comparable to the plebgate scandal, which led to andrew mitchell's resignation. mitchell, however, famously demanded the gates to be opened for his bicycle ride and allegedly used foul language with officers during his visit.
1084	on wednesday, five to six men with knives and cleavers attacked a college dormitory in hainan province, china, wounding nine students, including one seriously, according to state media. this is the most recent in a series of knife attacks in the country. the attack is different from other recent incidents as the victims were college students. recently, a man was sentenced to death and another killed himself after knife attacks on kindergarten students and teachers.
1085	star trek fans jossie and sonnie gustavsson hold a unique klingon wedding ceremony at the uk's first-ever star trek convention in 15 years. the pair, who work as caregivers for the elderly, exchanged vows in brown face-paint and rubber masks, and had a mock battle using a sword, representing the struggle of male and female klingon hearts against each other. the event included giant flames, traditional klingon drums replacing the more familiar wedding march, and was attended by other star trek fans.

1088	a terrifying skydiving accident occurred between two light aircraft in wisconsin, fortunately, all 11 participants survived due to their expertise and quick thinking. the collision was captured on video when one of the planes sandwiched the other and set it on fire. the skydivers successfully jumped out of the planes with their parachutes and landed safely on the ground. the crash highlights the importance of having expert pilots and skydivers while engaging in these thrilling yet potentially dangerous activities.
1089	a police investigation has been launched into the deaths of several patients treated by surgeon sudip sarker after concerns had been raised regarding his performance, which led to the royal college of surgeons referring him for investigation. sarker had a double the death rate of other surgeons while working as a consultant general surgeon at worcester royal hospital and the alexandra hospital, redditch. the patients treated by sarker suffered from complications following surgery and one of the investigations uncovered that one in five of his patients had to be readmitted following his procedures.
1090	the best diy teeth-whitening treatment is considered blanx white shock toothpaste with led. it contains actilux, which claims to react with light to help whiten teeth naturally, and led light that can make the formula more effective. there is also fluoride and xylitol in the product, making it beneficial for oral hygiene. tooth fairy white max booster and pearl drops beauty sleep are also decent options, with the latter being 8/10 for effectiveness. however, many of these products contain alcohol and other questionable ingredients, and many have the potential to damage tooth enamel. it is advised to consult with a dentist for professional treatment instead of relying on diy solutions.
1091	a new campaign, led by the uk's national crime agency (nca), is aimed at informing people about the dangers of not protecting themselves from cyber attacks by not installing security software on new devices, such as laptops and mobiles. the initiative seeks to improve users’ cyber common sense and reduce security breaches from opening malicious emails or using infected usb sticks. this campaign is an extension of the uk government's national cyber security programme, which has received £860m ($1.24bn) over five years to make the uk one of the most secure places in the world to go online.
1092	alvin e. roth of harvard university and lloyd shapley of ucla have been awarded the nobel prize in economics for their work on market design and matching theory. their work focuses on finding the most efficient way to match parties in a given transaction, such as organ donors and recipients or students and schools.

1097	former south african president nelson mandela is still in critical condition in hospital, showing sustained improvement, according to president jacob zuma who visited him at the hospital. mandela was initially hospitalized on june 8 due to an infection. mandela, the anti-apartheid leader, is supported by south africans and the international community on his 95th birthday, which was celebrated as international nelson mandela day, as well as on june 18, the day declared by the un as nelson mandela day. mandela's former wife, winnie madikizela-mandela, celebrated mandela's 95th birthday and dubbed it 'a gift to the nation'.

1099	new york city port authority police officer jesse turano, with help from his partner, saved a 37-year-old man from jumping off the george washington bridge on tuesday, the 12th person turano has saved in just five years. turano, a nine-year veteran with the police department, had prevented 12 suicides since starting work at the bridge in 2010, saving people of various ages and backgrounds. he started his shift finding a suicidal man, whom he and his partner worked to save.
1100	in 1958, jane pickett, a 93-year-old grandmother, finally received her high school diploma she left without in 1939 when she married on her graduation day. her daughter sharon mills organized the event and presented the diploma on her birthday. pickett's story follows audrey crabtree, a 99-year-old who returned to her high school after eight decades to get her diploma.
1101	a family driving through southern utah, including father and sons taylor, denham, and tanner, were hit by lightning that struck their car's antenna. the shocking event was captured on camera, causing excitement and disbelief from the family as they dealt with blown tires, scorching heat, and an unresponsive car. the family was later towed to their destination, and while no one was injured, the experience caused the loss of phone and electronics batteries, which then recharged as a result of the lightning strike. 
1102	in october 2012, a killer fungus, ash dieback, was spreading across the uk, posing a threat to both the landscape and the pockets of homeowners, farmers, and landowners. the cost of cutting down an infected tree and removing it safely is estimated to be between £600 and £1,000, which homeowners may have to incur without compensation from the government. the horticultural trades association warned that the absence of compensation could hinder efforts to control the disease as there is no incentive to report infected trees on your land.
1103	britain's first motorway pub will be opening, serving alcohol from 8 am, and has drawn controversy from road safety and alcohol awareness campaigners. the pub chain jd wetherspoon has been granted a license in response to the relaxing of laws that previously banned the sale of alcohol at motorway service stations. the branch of wetherspoon is planned for the main building at beaconsfield service station on the m40 near junction 2 at beaconsfield, buckinghamshire. the pub chain has stated that bar staff will trust customers and know whether or not they should be drinking.

1110	a third victim has contracted a rare flesh-eating bacterial infection after a georgia student lost a leg, a foot, and both hands, and a new mother of twins was left fighting for her life. bobby vaughn lost two pounds of flesh from his groin and back after injuring himself on a tree in georgia. aimee copeland and lana kuykendall contracted the infection after they received injuries in separate incidents. two victims, aimee copeland and lana kuykendall, had to undergo seven surgeries each to remove dead and infected tissue from their legs. despite the recent surge in cases of the flesh-eating bacteria, doctors claim that the cases are unrelated as they involve different patients who received different types of injuries. all patients are currently receiving treatment at high-quality medical facilities in their respective geographic locations to ensure they fight this rare but deadly condition.
1111	a police helicopter was deployed to a 15-year-old girl's birthday party when it became overrun by more than 250 youths. the gathering, held at bernard manning's embassy club in manchester, resulted in the incident being classed as a major disturbance. police cars and a tactical aid unit were called to the scene and the party was eventually closed down, leaving the girl distraught. police confirmed no arrests were made and no crimes were reported.
1112	an indonesian girl was reunited with her family 10 years after she was swept away by the 2004 boxing day tsunami. four-year-old raudhatul jannah and her seven-year-old brother were separated from their parents during the catastrophe and assumed dead. raudhatul's mother, jamaliah, and her husband survived and searched for their children before stopping the effort after a month, thinking their offspring had perished in the tsunami. raudhatul's mother and family were eventually reunited with her following a chance encounter with the girl that bore a striking resemblance to raudhatul. the girl was discovered in the village of blangpidie, and upon seeing her, jamaliah and her husband were overwhelmed with emotion and finally believed that her daughter had been found. raudhatul's reunion with her family marked a new beginning after a decade of uncertainty and a tragedy that forever altered their lives.
1113	pearl drops pure white whitening kit, a new teeth-whitening product, claims to have made the teeth of 100 women 5 or more shades whiter within 10 days, with a cost of just £25, without leaving their bathrooms. the product consists of two serums and a toothpaste and involves paint-on brightener and activator serums and then rinsing, brushing teeth with a special toothpaste, and a waiting period. the product’s effectiveness is disputed, with some dentists warning against its long-term effects, especially enamel damage due to its acidic nature.

1119	a british team working beneath antarctica's midnight sun have faced frustrating malfunctions in their attempts to drill down to lake ellsworth, a lake buried beneath two miles of ice that they hope to find unique microbial life forms encased in. the 12 scientists from the british antarctic survey have worked to collect samples from the lake, as well as other water and sediment, in hopes of understanding how life may have formed or adapted to extreme conditions. with their equipment failing, they now face a race against time to complete their mission before it gets too cold for their equipment to function.

1135	the department for international development is funding a £60,000 nine-month training program for gambian rats in africa, enabling them to sniff out landmines. the giant rodents, which are light enough to walk over the mines without setting them off, have been nicknamed "hero rats." once trained, each rat can search daily an area 14 times larger than that covered by a human mine clearer at a fraction of the cost. nearly 2,500 mines and 14,000 pieces of unexploded ordnance, small arms, and ammunition in mozambique have been detected using the rats' keen sense of smell and intelligence. the animals, which have an exceptional sense of smell and can live up to eight years, have effectively helped to save lives and contribute to the economy.
1136	a daily portion of rice can help with dieting and improve overall health, a new study suggests. researchers found that adults who ate rice had more consistent diets following recommended guidelines, with higher amounts of beneficial nutrients and lower amounts of saturated fat and added sugars. the study recommends incorporating both enriched white rice and whole-grain brown rice as part of a healthy diet.

1158	former us vice president al gore warned in 2007 that the polar ice caps could be completely gone in summer within 7 years; instead, a surge of 43-63% in arctic ice extent was recorded in 2012. the rise in ice extent has persisted, and satellite images reveal an area the size of alaska covered by ice. arctic ice loss is mostly due to natural variability, as well as human-caused global warming. although the future of arctic ice is uncertain, the ipcc predicts it will likely fall below one million square kilometers by 2050. some scientists warn that the rapid retreat of arctic ice is a significant indicator of global warming, while others argue that natural factors may reverse the trend in the next decade.
