1764	a triplex condo at the top of a manhattan skyscraper is on sale for a staggering $100 million, featuring 14 bedrooms, 13 full bathrooms, a fireplace, and a luxury infinity-edge pool. the penthouse is part of the 88-storey building designed by norman foster, situated across from the united nations building and offering unparalleled views of the river and the chrysler building. the building is priced from $2.8 million for one-bedroom units and $3.6 million for two-bedroom units. owners hope to attract the wealthiest citizens and diplomats from around the world to this luxury development.
1765	a homeless man named billy ray harris, who returned a lost engagement ring to its owner, was reunited with his family after his act of kindness went viral. he was interviewed about how he found the ring and decided to return it to sarah darling, which led to his family discovering his whereabouts through media coverage. reunited, mr. harris met his three sisters and brother. the family now plans to have another reunion this summer in texas and a web page called giveforward.com has raised more than $ 180,000 for harris, allowing him to buy a house and a part-time job.
1766	bonnaroo, a music and arts festival in its 10th year, draws more than 80,000 people to manchester, tennessee. the event features a mix of popular indie rock, hip-hop, jazz, and bluegrass alongside classic rock artists. bonnaroo has been an economic driver for the small southern town, transforming it into a unique destination.
1767	a former eastenders actress admitted to her friend that she made three crucial mistakes after causing an elderly murder victim, jean dobson, to lose her life, using a hammer and a glass jug. karen williamson, aged 45, allegedly killed dobson, an 86-year-old widow in a robbery and has denied the murder charges during her trial at the old boys.
1768	scientists have discovered that a distinctive fresh, earthy aroma from an impending rain storm can be attributed to the presence of tiny particles that form clouds when raindrops hit surfaces such as soil and leaves. high-speed cameras captured these interactions, indicating that when raindrops impact an uneven surface, they can trap air bubbles, which then rise out of the water and burst from the top, propelling tiny aerosol particles into the air that carry miniscule amounts of oils and dust from the soils surface. this aroma spreads far and wide, explaining why it is possible to smell rain approaching long before the storm arrives, particularly after dry spells when more oil and dust particles accumulate.
1769	a historic 200-year-old horse chestnut tree in helmshore, lancashire, is facing the possibility of being chopped down by property developers taylor wimpey to make way for 74 homes. residents are united in their efforts to save the iconic tree, which has been a fixture of the village for centuries, with more than 1,000 people signing up to a facebook group calling for it to be protected. despite the tree's historical importance, taylor wimpey recently received planning permission from the planning inspectorate to develop the site. locals remain determined to work with the developers and local authorities to find a solution that safeguards the tree. 
1770	the uk's top judge, lord neuberger, has stated that british courts should be less inclined to follow human rights rulings by european judges in strasbourg, as he believes the uk has "much to learn" from them. british judges can occasionally prioritize over strasbourg's decisions due to their common law approach to precedent and the relatively recent uk involvement with the court.
1771	cristiano ronaldo has been enjoying his time away from football after a remarkable year with real madrid and portugal's world cup campaign. at the end of 2014, ronaldo put his feet up following a triumphant club world cup in morocco and a trip back to his hometown madeira, where he saw a new statue of himself unveiled. this two-week winter break gave him the opportunity to celebrate christmas, relax, and spend time with his family. he will return to action against valencia on january 4th and there will also be a madrid derby against atletico in the copa del rey last 16 on january 7th. if he performs well, ronaldo has a chance of winning the ballon d'or award for the second time in a row.
1772	uk police forces have invested over £646,000 in tablet computers to help them fight crime, spending an average of £20,000 each. hertfordshire constabulary spent the most, £57,598, followed by the city of london police, £102,573, and durham constabulary, £48,826. the devices have proven to be useful for accessing information and paperwork on the move, and although some expense has raised concerns from campaigners, police forces argue that they help officers carry out their daily duties more efficiently.
1773	tragically, 11-year-old anaika st. louis, a victim of the haiti earthquake, passed away three days after being trapped under the rubble. despite the efforts of neighbors and family members, rescue teams could not be found following the 7.0-magnitude earthquake. volunteers supported anaika during the ordeal, providing her with supplies and companionship. the girl's uncle shared that despite her leg being crushed and internal bleeding, anaika was willing to have it amputated to survive. her family called her "the little lawyer" as she aspired to study law and was a beautiful, kind-hearted girl. anaika now rests in a cemetery in liancourt, haiti.
1774	fulham defender fernando amorebieta is in negotiations to transfer to granada, but his high salary could be a concern for the spanish club. amorebieta desires to move to the spanish team, but his wages may be an issue as granada currently is 15th in la liga. additionally, fulham striker bryan ruiz is wanted by werder bremen in a £3m transfer deal.
1775	veteran dj and former radio 1 dj, chris denning, has admitted 29 counts of indecent assault and three counts of gross indecency. the offenses, committed between 1967 and 1984, involved assaulting 19 boys aged between nine and 16. another 12 allegations will be contested. these will be the subject of a later trial.
1776	a lightning strike killed a woman and injured seven others at rocky mountain national park in colorado, resulting in two being taken to a hospital by ambulance and five others transporting themselves. park officials were notified of the strike at 1:20 pm on friday, and the woman died later that afternoon. the incident occurred along the ute crossing trail, a location off trail ridge road. rocky mountain national park offers numerous hiking trails and is located northwest of boulder in the rockies.
1777	a photograph captured by wildlife photographer jim lawrence of a grizzly bear posing next to a camera in british columbia, canada has recently gone viral. new footage shows the bear was fascinated by the camera, studying its buttons and screens, then pulling its paw on the strap, causing the camera to pivot, and swiftly scurrying away. jim, who set up his camera hoping to capture a range of wildlife, shares tips for other photographers in the area: carry bear spray, keep a safe distance, get a picture then move along.
1778	in 2017, phillipe croizon, a frenchman without arms and legs, successfully swam 12 miles of shark- and jellyfish-infested waters between oceania and asia, reaching the coastal village of pasar skow in indonesia in seven hours and 35 minutes. this marked the first stage of his mission to symbolically link the world's continents via swimming, which he hopes to complete by swimming across the final stretch from alaska to russia's far eastern coast by august.
1779	the pakistani government is attempting to tackle its high non-tax payment and budget deficit problem. the current tax system consists of 37 government agencies, 70 unique taxes, and only 800,000 taxpayers among a population of 180 million. the country's national data base and registration authority aims to create a multi-biometric database with a view to identifying potential taxpayers, tracking tax evaders, and implementing benefits and anti-fraud measures throughout pakistan's population. this will hopefully lead to increased revenue by identifying and confronting those who overconsume despite having significant income while being eligible for taxes, and offering an amnesty for those who have evaded taxes until this point.
1780	former towie star amy childs became a brand ambassador for alexis smith lingerie in 2013. she found it difficult to find pretty bras for her 32dd size, but said she has now found a solution by modeling their new spring/summer collection, which includes a limited edition set for £50. the line offers lingerie for both uk sizes 32 and 34, and is known for its comfortable fit, stylish design, and practicality for smaller-chested women.
1781	google's matias duarte revealed plans for new mobile phones that will recognize faces and hands, increasing object recognition and incorporating a more tangible experience. this transformation, enabled through advanced interface software, could reshape mobile technology and provide users with a more immersive virtual reality experience. google's android software accounted for around 70% of the smartphone and tablet market in 2012, ahead of competitors like mozilla's firefox software backed by 13 wireless service providers.
1782	migrants, including women and children, were packed into a rusty hull of an ageing merchant vessel like cattle. 796 migrants, with no place to sit or sleep, endured a harsh ten-day voyage. nearly 800 migrants were found on board a second so-called ghost ship. traffickers abandoned them, causing them to run out of food, drink and fuel after 5 days. they were then rescued and will now be taken to immigration centres.
1783	simon walsh, a former aide to uk prime minister boris johnson, is on trial accused of possessing and viewing sadomasochistic pornography that could cause serious injury. he is charged with five counts of possessing extreme pornography and one count of possessing an indecent picture of a child. walsh, who has pleaded not guilty, denies any wrongdoing and says he could not recall opening the image that allegedly shows an underage boy.
1784	a designer named christopher shellis, running house of borgeize in birmingham's famous jewelry quarter, has created a clutch bag priced at £105,000, which is embellished with 345 diamonds, features 18ct gold clasps, and measures 7in x 5in and weighs 542g. the bag comes with a 1,000-year guarantee and is based on the buckingham palace gates, making it perfect for a royal princess. this bag takes over 100 hours to make, and already, shellis has designed a pair of stilettos worth a whopping £200,000 with 1,290 diamonds.
1785	this article discusses the findings of a report by the sutton trust education charity on the cunning and underhand tactics being used by wealthy parents to get their children into top state schools. they are using their financial resources to: 1. purchase homes close to over-subscribed schools, 2. use fake addresses, 3. resort to legal measures like using a relative's address, and 4. start going to church to get their child into a faith school. this practice of "parent power" is more prevalent among professional parents and is significantly more widespread than among parents in general. the authors urge for reforms, such as random allocation of school places through ballots and free transport for poorer students to give them access to a choice of schools.
1786	geordie shore cast member marnie simpson has teamed up with online retailer lasula.co.uk to offer her fans a fashion-forward, affordable clothing line without controversy. the 22-year-old aims to prove that she can be serious and fashionable, as well as enjoy nights out and dress for any occasion. with prices starting at £18, the 45 piece collection is available online and includes jumpsuits, jackets, and co-ords.
1787	in summary, data from the european space agency's planck space telescope has been released, providing the sharpest and most detailed picture ever of the early universe. this information can now be used to learn more about the age and evolution of the universe. researchers found that the universe is 100 million years older than they previously thought and contains more dark matter than previously thought. the combination of these findings may aid in better understanding dark energy and the universe's expansion.
1788	a paramedic of 30 years, mark lakinski, dropped off a sick patient at an ambulance station instead of a hospital because he was due to finish his shift. the patient later died, and lakinski admitted to failing to transport the patient directly to the hospital and instead leaving him at an ambulance station. the health care professionals council found lakinski's actions constituted misconduct and took away his registration.
1789	a virginia teenager, trey simms, faces child pornography charges for sending an explicit video of his genitalia to his 15-year-old girlfriend. simms' attorney argues that the authorities want to force him into a state of arousal using a drug injection for further evidence. simms already faced such pictures taken for evidence, and now the authorities want more evidence to take even further, which simms' lawyer will fight against.
1790	thirteen people were killed in violent clashes between egyptian police and islamist protestors after the muslim brotherhood renewed calls for support of the country's former president. heavy security forces, violence, and protests involving rocks, tear gas, and molotov cocktails took place throughout egypt - with cairo, giza, ismailia, and alexandria being some of the worst-affected areas. 
1791	todd horsfield, a 10-year-old boy, accidentally hanged himself with his dressing gown rope on the same day he was named star pupil at school. an inquest heard that todd got caught in a makeshift swing which he used while playing computer games, despite his family stating he had no problems or issues and enjoyed school. the cause of death was determined as an accident.
1792	a team of four gardeners in cornwall dangle from ropes 250ft above craggy rocks to tend the stone walls of st michael's mount, while abseiling down the 50m high castle walls. they undertake 'extreme weeding' three times a year to maintain the walls, ensuring the vegetation is kept at bay while allowing plants such as aloes and aeoniums to thrive.
1793	a physicist suggests that in the future, it may be possible to run an optical fiber to any point on earth or in space, opening up new opportunities in communication like broadband and long-range laser communications. a way to make air behave like an optical fiber allows high-quality, long-distance light transmission without degradation. the method of light transmission involves using a 'waveguide' in the air, which guides light beams over long distances without losing power. this could potentially be used for laser communication, detecting pollution in the atmosphere, and making high-resolution topographic maps.
1794	a teenage employee at a goodwill store in florida was arrested for giving discounts to customers due to their financial situation but was later released after the organization determined that it was not for personal gain and the actions were intended for the benefit of others. goodwill fired the employee, but the charges against them were dropped, and the termination remained in effect.
1795	benjamin knight, a 28-year-old man from eaton rapids, michigan, is facing charges of distributing disturbing child pornography. battle creek police discovered extremely graphic images of babies and bestiality on knight's phone and home computers. he was arrested and held on $250,000 bond. investigators believe the child porn was not made locally, and that knight is not in the images.
1796	sam allardyce, manager of west ham united, does not regret cupping his ear in response to fans jeering the team after a win over hull. the gesture was made to divert attention away from the players and protect them from negative fan opinions. west ham is currently eighth in the premier league, vastly improved from last season. under allardyce's leadership, there is a sense of optimism and progression among both the players and fans.
1797	president obama gives his first speech from the oval office, addressing the worst environmental disaster in america's history. he pledges to fight the oil spill with everything they've got, make bp pay for the damage, and help the gulf coast recover. the speech was intended to comfort the nation, but the public wants the president to take action instead of continuing with words.
1798	paul mountain, a 38-year-old amphetamine user, was arrested for burglary after having sex with a teddy bear at the property he broke into. the police took a dna sample from inside the teddy bear, and it matched with mountain. he was remanded on bail for his sentencing.
1799	google, an internet giant, is dealing with privacy concerns by being more cautious about data collection and the potential backlash. the company has scrapped a facial-recognition software project due to privacy concerns. however, google continues to work on more privacy-focused projects.
1800	in 2013, steven c. democker, an ex-husband, was found guilty of first-degree murder for the brutal bludgeoning death of his former wife virginia carol kennedy after being accused of escaping alimony payments and her $750,000 life insurance policy. democker, a former high-flying stockbroker, used a golf club as the murder weapon and was found guilty of six other charges. the trial began in july, with the court hearing details of his motivation and the financial struggles he faced. the non-murder charges against him were based on allegations of anonymous emailing, claiming drug dealer involvement, and creating a false story about a voice in the vent at the camp verde jail. democker is set for sentencing on november 13 and could face life in prison with a chance of release after 25 years, with additional years for other convictions.
1801	the hoh indian reservation, located in washington state, faces a threat as rising water levels from climate change and possible flooding impact their homeland. with most of the reservation situated in the floodplain, the hoh tribe is working to move to higher ground and purchase new land for the expansion. additionally, they are waiting for congress to pass a measure that would provide 37 acres of national park land in a trust for the tribe to fund their new housing and preserve the community's future. the hoh tribe fears both climate change and their proximity to a major fault line and potential tsunami may put them in danger.
1802	galatasaray has sacked former italy world cup coach cesare prandelli due to a string of poor results, resulting in their exit from european competition. the team finished bottom of their champions league group, preventing them from qualifying for the europa league. meanwhile, the club is in talks to recruit their former defender and current assistant coach hamza hamzaoglu. prandelli had a short stint with the club and previously resigned as italy manager after the team failed to progress past the group stage in the 2014 world cup.
1803	on the first anniversary of farrah fawcett's death, her son redmond o'neal visited her grave for the first time to pay tribute. the o'neal family, including redmond, his father ryan, and sister tatum, spent time together in a private gathering of friends and family at the farrah fawcett foundation headquarters in beverly hills, california. the foundation aims to raise funds for cancer research and clinical trials in honor of fawcett, who died from anal cancer. redmond discussed his ongoing recovery and hopes to serve as an inspiration for others battling addiction and cancer. 
1804	terry brown claims he was attacked and forced out of his home by a vigilante mob after spending a year on bail, falsely accused of rape. brown's partner tracey choularton suffered a miscarriage due to the constant harassment and threats from the vigilante mob. lisa-jayne samuels, who falsely accused mr. brown, was jailed for 20 months after she admitted perverting the course of justice. mr. brown now lives on canvey island with his partner and struggles from the emotional and physical trauma caused by the false allegations.
1805	uk families will not have to switch energy tariffs in the near future to cut their bills. instead, the government has announced plans for energy firms to automatically place customers on their best deals. the change will come into effect in summer 2014 after a period of forced compliance by energy suppliers.
1806	a transgender former prisoner of lovelock correctional center in nevada has claimed to have had a sexual encounter with o.j. simpson as a sexual fling in prison. the self-identified former transsexual prostitute, jazmena jameson, has disclosed she might have infected o.j. simpson with hiv and has now revealed she herself is hiv positive. she described her relationship with simpson in detail, stating that they were sexually intimate and that simpson ejaculated on his stomach during one of their encounters, where she performed oral sex on him.
1807	on saturday, the u.s. capitol was evacuated after a small aircraft entered restricted airspace; authorities were unable to contact the pilot. two f-16 fighter jets escorted the plane to the airport in mount airy, north carolina, where the pilot was met by law enforcement. the pilot said his map confusion led to his entry into restricted airspace, with no security threats reported. the incident prompted authorities to investigate the plane's entry into restricted airspace without authorization.
1808	striking photographs showcase the haunting beauty of abandoned places worldwide, including the large coal camp of lynch, kentucky; the former naval base of subic bay in the philippines; the deserted village of simacem in north sumatra, indonesia; and the abandoned town of epecuen in argentina. a wide range of structures can be found in varying conditions, like rusted equipment at a coal power plant in kentucky and wrecked golf-ball-shaped antennas at a former listening station in berlin. these abandoned locations continue to captivate with their unique appearances, despite being in decline or destroyed due to various causes such as natural disasters, the closure of facilities, or social factors.
1809	the u.s. house of representatives will vote on thursday to hold attorney general, eric holder, in contempt of congress for withholding documents related to the failed "fast and furious" weapons crackdown. speaker john boehner stated, "we're going to proceed," as the house republicans have given the justice department "ample opportunity to reply."
1810	a heartwarming documentary follows the real-life adventures of beloved british actors prunella scales and timothy west as they embark on a canal trip around britain, celebrating 50 years of marriage. the couple, both passionate canal nuts, navigate the waterways and meet colorful characters along their journey. their personal story unfolds as they face challenges with pru's forgetfulness, which turns out to be a mild form of alzheimer's. amid the laughs and tears, the love and resilience of these veteran performers showcase what it truly means to live life to the fullest, together.
1811	hundreds of young dutch men and women participated in a massive tomato fight in amsterdam, with over 1,000 tickets sold for the one-hour event. the tomato battle was inspired by the annual la tomatina festival in spain and aimed to support european tomato growers and farmers affected by russian sanctions on european produce. proceeds of the event were aimed to go to these farmers. the event drew an immense response from participants, who were able to smear tomato pulp on each other and create a temporary tomato "puddle" in the middle of dam square.
1812	pamela anderson, former baywatch star, has become part owner of a sports car racing team, competing in the inaugural fia gt series. anderson has joined race alliance, teaming up with occasional driver markus fux and aiming to make the team's name recognizable in motorsport.
1813	in october, sudanese soldiers allegedly raped more than 200 women and girls over a 36-hour period in the darfur town of tabit, sparking a human rights report that cited at least 130 interviews with locals. despite having a united nations and african union peacekeeping presence in darfur, the sudanese government continues to prevent an investigation into the alleged mass rape, with sudanese foreign ministry spokesman yusuf kurdufani stating it was a closed issue. human rights watch reports that violence in the region persists and millions have been killed or wounded.
1814	the last native speaker of the cromarty fisherfolk dialect, a unique dialect spoken in a remote fishing village in northern scotland, has passed away. the loss of the dialect marks the first time a unique linguistic dialect has been lost in scotland, as it is the first in the nation's history to become extinct. the scots dialect is also the only one that did not include the "wh" pronunciation, with "what" turning into "at" and "where" becoming "ere." this death serves as a reminder of the decline in the scots language worldwide, where local dialects are suffering due to a global trend of increasing communication and interdependence among communities.
1815	the woman quarantined in a dallas apartment alongside the first ebola patient in the united states, who is thomas eric duncan, wants for her nightmare to end since they cannot wait to be over with everything. the quarantined five, including the 13-year-old son and two nephews, are being placed in a difficult situation after the woman's partner, who is duncan, was diagnosed with the ebola virus, and they have been placed in a dallas apartment quarantine since his diagnosis. the ebola virus is transmitted through infected bodily fluids, and healthcare authorities should prioritize the quarantined patients' mental health and provide them with adequate support for their emotional wellbeing. duncan's partner and many others are under strict quarantine in their apartment, which is causing financial, emotional, and logistical challenges. 
1816	former manchester city footballer mario balotelli, aged 23, has admitted via his twitter account that he is the father of his baby daughter pia. the admission comes after a bitter public battle with his ex-girlfriend raffaella fico. balotelli has used the statement to underline his english language skills and to make a tribute to his favourite rock band, guns n' roses.
1817	arsenal's alexis sanchez received calls for player of the year after his performance against hull city, but he is not the best player in the premier league. instead, manchester united's wayne rooney is the most deserving candidate due to his ability to handle a new and crucial position in the team, handle the captaincy, and help blend youngsters into the first team. despite the injuries of other players, rooney has contributed greatly to manchester united's success, capturing a 100% record with england and leading the team back into the top four.
1818	this ai article describes a personal packing routine for travel, including organizing items into three separate phases, packing hand luggage, and the essential items they bring on each trip.
1819	the supreme court, in a 7-2 ruling, upheld kentucky's use of lethal injection as an execution method for prisoners, stating that the method is properly and humanely applied. the ruling dismissed concerns that the process can be painful and unconstitutional, as it is currently used in 35 states, although some have criticized the lack of clear guidelines provided by the decision. some critics say the decision will affect the death penalty process in other states. 
1820	a former kentucky official, raymond curtis smith, has murdered his younger ex-lover, robin smith, along with her father and brother in their home. robin was critically injured when raymond shot her, and each victim had been shot once. raymond was later found dead at his father's graveside.
1821	the consumer product safety commission is suing the makers of buckyballs, a high-powered magnet "desk toy" that has caused severe illnesses, for refusing to stop selling it by the agency's request. buckyballs can cause internal damage, and numerous surgeries have been necessary. since 2009, there have been at least a dozen ingestions of the magnets, leading to the agency's filing the lawsuit. a spokesman for buckyballs said they will "fight this vigorously."
1822	a jetblue flight carrying 142 passengers made an emergency landing at kennedy airport after colliding with a bird a short time after leaving westchester county airport bound for palm beach, florida. passengers were given the option of a flight back to westchester county or continuing to jfk. the faa plans to investigate the incident.
1823	the jamala wildlife lodge is an exclusive accommodation experience nestled in australia's political capital, canberra, at the national zoo and aquarium. the 18 luxurious rooms, including giraffe treehouses and jungle bungalows, offer guests up-close encounters with various african animals. with activities such as feeding giraffes, enjoying dining experiences with lemurs, and sharing baths with bears, the lodge aims to educate visitors about the importance of preservation while making guests feel like they're part of an african safari.
1824	taylor lianne chandler has revealed a relationship with olympian michael phelps, who she claims approached her on tinder before they began dating and had intimate experiences. the relationship ended when phelps entered rehab in september. while she and phelps discussed her past, she has not disclosed the reasons for their breakup.
1825	after a fracas at the end of a championship match between middlesbrough and blackburn rovers, with a middlesbrough fan accused of making a racist gesture towards rudy gestede of blackburn, police are now appealing for information to identify the individual. gestede later scored an equalising goal, prompting a reaction from the crowd which may have prompted the gesture. the football association (fa) has already opened an investigation in relation to the incident.
1826	sergeant sean murphy, a massachusetts state police trooper, will face a closed hearing to determine his professional future, after releasing photos of the hunt and capture of one of the boston bombing suspects without authorization, receiving tens of thousands of supporters who believe he did the right thing in defending the victims.
1827	the world's top-ranked women's tennis players, caroline wozniacki and vera zvonareva, have crashed out of the australian open warm-up event in sydney during their opening matches. wozniacki won just six games, while zvonareva was defeated 7-5, 7-5. both players' australian open preparations are now in danger following the unexpected results. kim clijsters, ranked third, is set to replace vera zvonareva as world number two if she progresses further in the tournament.
1828	justice secretary chris grayling plans to ban officers from giving police cautions, known as "slaps on the wrist," to repeat offenders in an effort to reduce the number of criminals receiving lenient punishments. nearly 5,000 thugs, shoplifters, and vandals have received multiple police cautions for similar offenses within two years, raising concerns over widespread use of these cautions. the ministry of justice will review all out of court disposals, making the caution system consistent, straightforward, and with which victims and the wider public can have confidence.
1829	formula one driver fernando alonso will leave ferrari at the end of the season after the team's outgoing president, luca di montezemolo, confirmed he has decided to cut short alonso's contract. alonso revealed he was disappointed by ferrari's inability to produce a winning car and has lost faith in the team's future. his future is thought to be between returning to mclaren or moving to mercedes, as his current contract with ferrari ends in 2016, although he will likely make way for sebastian vettel.
1830	in an interview, minnesota republican rep. michele bachmann stated that hillary clinton will not be america's next president, believing many u.s. voters aren't ready to have a female president. bachmann argues that there was a sense of "guilt" in having an african-american president, as it related to civil rights, while there isn't the same desire for a female president.
1831	tim reddish, a former paralympian, is seeing a clearer future thanks to an implant called a retinal chip. after being diagnosed with a degenerative eye condition, the british swimmer went blind 17 years ago. with the fitting of a bionic eye, tim can now see his haul of 50 medals in detail, as the chip uses 1,500 pixels to produce a pixelated image that mimics photoreceptor rod and cone cells in the eye destroyed due to his condition. the technology costs up to £100,000 per patient, and while it has restored some sight to people who were completely blind, there are still more milestones to reach.
1832	gary rogers, a father of two, recently celebrated his first christmas since 1994 after suffering memory loss due to a brain injury while on holiday in turkey. doctors warned that the brain damage caused by a lack of oxygen to his brain would likely lead to wiping out 17 years of memories. his family was crushed as he didn't recognize his daughters. however, thanks to hard work and support, gary is now able to remember important events and his family is working to regain their normal life, cherishing each christmas together.
1833	a well-known animal rights activist, sandy lertzman, was found dead in her ohio garage alongside 31 dogs she rescued. police found a suicide note, suggesting that lertzman may have killed the dogs out of concern for their future if she was no longer able to care for them. lertzman was an executive director at the animal rights foundation, married, and had a 20-year-old son named matthew.
1834	freed isis hostage daniel rye ottesen is calling for help with overwhelming debts after paying a heavy ransom to be released. ottesen, who was held for a year and a half, appealed to his facebook followers to help him repay debts of around 1 million danish crowns (£86,300), which he has been unable to clear due to his difficult circumstances.
1835	a gigantic sunspot, named ar 1476, has appeared in the past few days and could mean that earth is about to be hit by powerful solar storms. known as a "monster," the sunspot is many times bigger than earth and can be seen with home telescopes. experts warn that these must be fitted with sun filters to prevent permanent eye damage. sunspots are caused by the sun's magnetic field becoming twisted and can produce coronal mass ejections, containing billions of tons of gases bursting with x-rays and ultraviolet radiation. these powerful ejections, which can cause electricity grid disruptions, are expected to increase during the next two years.
1836	amanda knox, an american wrongfully convicted of the 2007 murder of british student meredith kercher in italy, denied any involvement and vowed to fight back against her accusers. she said she would take a lie detector test and fight for her innocence.
1837	the wife of a young bp engineer, sebastian john, killed during the algerian terrorist siege said he was "the most amazing person." john had been working on a project related to algeria a week before the siege, which has claimed the lives of six uk nationals. john was an engineer and son, father, brother, and husband, who impacted the lives of everyone he worked with.
1838	with the global economic crisis in 2008 showing our dependence on one another, the current and future economy is now truly global. while there are complexities and uncharted waters, there is hope for a united community working together for the benefit of all. there will be no winners or losers in this partnership for stability and progress. understanding the importance of global unity for financial stability, the challenge lies in embracing rationality, balanced insights and creativity to achieve a healthy, prosperous future.
1839	pope francis participates in the 'passion of the lord' service in the vatican, during which official preacher fr. raniero cantalamessa condemns large executive salaries, comparing them to judas' betrayal of jesus with 30 pieces of silver. he argues money is behind societal evils and that the financial crisis is partly linked to greed. pope francis later leads a candlelight 'way of the cross' procession and says mass on good friday, and will give his traditional easter message to the world's 1.2 billion roman catholics on sunday.
1840	marine veteran andrew tahmooressi, 25, found himself jailed in mexico after mistakenly crossing the border with three guns in his truck. he said he missed an exit and unknowingly ended up in tijuana after starting his journey to visit friends in san ysidro. mexican authorities found the weapons, and tahmooressi is being held in tijuana's la mesa penitentiary without bail. republican rep. duncan hunter has written a letter seeking secretary of state john kerry's help in securing his release. tahmooressi could face 6 to 21 years in a mexican prison but could also have the case dropped if the mexican attorney general's office in mexico city requests dismissal.
1841	a 29-year-old schizophrenic, craig cantwell, locked a care worker in a medication room, threatening to kill her. he assaulted her in the bathroom before she broke two vertebrae while leaping from a window to escape him. despite her injuries, the worker managed to call for help, and two milkmen assisted her. after a four-day trial, cantwell was found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm, affray, and committing an offense with intent to commit a sexual offense. he claimed self-defense but was ultimately convicted for his actions.
1842	in february 2012, suni faith anderson, a 36-year-old personal trainer, was sentenced to 15 years in prison for having a two-year sexual affair with a 14-year-old client. anderson fainted in court after receiving her sentence and was revived by court staff. the victim's mother criticized anderson and described her as a "pedophile." the case was highlighted by anderson having a relationship with a minor, despite her husband's plea for leniency.
1843	fans of the popular show downton abbey can now get married at the same victorian courtroom that featured in the show's trial of lord grantham's valet, mr. john bates. the surrey county council has obtained a wedding license, and fans can exchange their vows in this iconic location. costs for a day's use of the courtroom and one of the grand chambers for the reception range from £3,000 to £3,250.
1844	conservative mp nadine dorries called for english mps to have more power over english matters, as well as an english parliament to address tax and welfare issues. this sentiment gained support, with former cabinet minister john redwood urging an english parliament for tax and welfare, to mirror the devolution of powers to the scottish parliament that would follow a 'no' vote. their proposals come as conservative mps question the potential granting of new tax and welfare powers to the scottish parliament after an independence vote.
1845	a woman debating angry white men on a television show argued that they should be entitled to the jobs they believe they had been discriminated against for because they felt they were the rightful recipients. the woman questioned the phrasing of "my job" in the context of those men's stories, stating that they should realize that any effort to make the workplace more equal is not a loss. she highlighted that the men were coming from a perspective of entitlement and that equality in the workplace has been harmful to only a minority of men. men and women can be allies in fighting societal norms and becoming more equal in the workplace.
1846	a new york company, the library of fragrance, is launching a new perfume line with signature scents of play-doh and pizza in the uk, selling for £15 for a 30ml bottle catering for budget as well as boutique tastes. the perfumes have gained a cult following and developed into a full-time business for his family which hand-manufactures all the scents. 
1847	the new york police department (nypd) launched an internal investigation after officers were found posting pictures of themselves in uniforms on dating websites, violating department rules. they were caught posing next to patrol cars and motorcycles, and some were removed while others continued to use dating sites like match.com and okcupid to find love. the nypd stated that members of the police department are prohibited from posting photographs of themselves in uniform without prior authorization and that such rules are part of the new york city social media policy for officer safety.
1848	ringo starr, former beatles drummer, is selling his 200-acre estate near cranleigh, surrey, which he bought in 1999 for £2 million and has since extensively remodeled. the grade-ii listed jacobean mansion offers starr's luxury lifestyle and comes with lakes, formal gardens and a riding school. the property is expected to fetch as much as ten times its original price, and the sale will mark the beatles' nearly five-decade-long association with surrey.
1849	the un panel on climate change has warned that the continued use of fossil fuels will cause severe, pervasive and irreversible impacts on the world. they suggest cutting carbon dioxide emissions by up to 70% by 2050. they also suggest phasing out the use of fossil fuels in electricity production by 2100, unless technologies for storing carbon dioxide are used. the panel stresses the need for a combination of adaptation and mitigation to tackle the issue of climate change.
1850	a high school sophomore in orlando who plays for dr. phillips high school, anthony burruto, was cut from his baseball team after the coach told him he couldn't cover bunts, despite not being part of the tryout. the 80-mph fastball-throwing athlete, born without legs, has been playing baseball since he was 8, with some obstacles to overcome. he aspires to play for the team again, although he won't if the coach stays on as he feels it was off-base to be cut due to bunts.
1851	twitter saw a significant increase in the number of governments requesting content removal in the second half of last year, including a 477-request spike from turkey between july and december, making it the country with the most requests. overall content removal requests increased 40% globally. twitter's annual transparency report shows such requests to "shine a light on government requests for customers’ information."
1852	the fbi believes it has identified the thieves behind the 1990 art heist at boston's isabella stewart gardner museum, where art pieces, including rembrandt's "the storm on the sea of galilee" and vermeer's "the concert," were stolen. fbi special agent richard deslauriers stated that the thieves were part of a criminal organization based in new england but did not name any suspects. authorities discovered that the stolen masterpieces were taken to connecticut and philadelphia regions after the theft, and were displayed in philadelphia approximately a decade ago before being sold again. the fbi hopes the $5 million reward will encourage someone to come forward with information that leads to the masterpieces' return.
1853	dr. john king, a dedicated family doctor, and the 'perfect gp', took his own life after becoming severely depressed over his son needing a kidney transplant. dr. king, who was 51, was anxious about his son michael's renal failure diagnosis, having suicidal thoughts just ten days before it was supposed to happen. the inquest heard how his wife, a gp herself, had been cuddling with dr. king the night before he died, and that he had said "who wouldn't?" when asked if he loved her. dr. king was well-known among his patients for his old school approach of taking time with them to discuss their condition, rather than 'bat them away with pills', as described by his wife, pamela king. dr. king was put on sick leave from biddulph medical centre after admitting to developing suicidal thoughts, suffering sleep problems and being stressed before taking his life on september 11, 2012.
1854	portuguese winger nani has returned to sporting lisbon on a season-long loan after seven years at manchester united. the 27-year-old moves back to his native country in a £16million move that sees marcos rojo go the other way. sir alex ferguson signed nani from sporting in 2007 for a fee of £20million. however, nani fell out of favour at old trafford, making only 13 appearances last season and scoring one goal. rio ferdinand, nemanja vidic, and patrice evra are among the high-profile players to leave old trafford this summer.
1855	the obama administration is enhancing airport security at selected european and middle eastern airports due to concerns about the development of more sophisticated bombs that can evade screening by terrorists. homeland security secretary jeh johnson has directed the transportation security administration to implement enhanced security measures, not impacting travelers. the changes may cause additional inspections of shoes and electronics and include more scanners and screenings at boarding gates. the steps will not apply to u.s. domestic flights.
1856	before a junior rugby league test match, tensions rose between the junior kangaroos and junior kiwis during the pre-match haka. though no tackles were made, players were close to physical confrontation. match officials stepped in to separate the teams at auckland's mt smart stadium, with new zealand beating australia 15-14.
1857	two catholic bishops yesterday criticized the bbc drama, wolf hall, which focuses on british history, as inaccurate and "perverse," according to a report. the drama portrays thomas more, one of the most cherished saints of english catholicism, as a sinister scheming villain. this depiction conflicts with the actual character of thomas more, with some arguing that wolf hall is not objective and depicts a biased view of its subject matter.
1858	two british airways stewardesses are suspected of stripping off and engaging in erotic activities in each other's company while wearing the airline's uniforms, leading british airways to launch an investigation to identify the women and confirm their affiliation with the company. the video has been widely circulated among the airline's employees and has since gone viral online.
1859	a new study from the university of buffalo found that watching reruns of tv shows can have a beneficial impact, increasing self-control and self-restraint. psychologists believe people have limited impulse control, but by rewatching their favorite tv shows, they create a sense of belonging, which improves self-control and restores a feeling of self-restraint.
1860	the story describes a relaxing vacation at the constance moofushi resort in the maldives, where the all-inclusive package offers fine cuisine, premium drinks, and a wide selection of activities like yoga, kayaking, and dining in chic restaurants. instead of being bored or spending money on mini-bars, guests can indulge in luxurious experiences that make it hard to leave the stunning resort island.
1861	seventeen students from western georgia were transported to area hospitals after their school bus crashed with a pickup truck. the incident occurred on state highway 120, and while the pickup truck's driver suffered serious injuries, no students experienced major injuries.
1862	a crowd of 300 angry protestors blocked three buses carrying 140 undocumented migrant children and their parents in murrieta, california, on tuesday, after the migrants arrived to be processed at a nearby facility. the protesters expressed their anger by waving flags and chanting, while some suggested that the children should be sent to the white house instead of being processed in california. the buses made a u-turn and headed to a customs and border facility in san diego, within sight of mexico. this incident took place amidst debates between local authorities and the federal government over where to process the refugees.
1863	the iphone revolutionized the mobile industry upon its launch in 2007, introducing features like a touchscreen keyboard, an app store, and access to the internet anytime, anywhere. since then, it has made a significant impact on our daily lives: helping doctors diagnose patients, connecting parents to their kids, and aiding construction workers. the iphone has also led the way in supply-chain activism and innovation, impacting not only apple but also google, microsoft and other tech giants. five years later, it is clear that the iphone has forever changed the mobile industry.
1864	if sarah sellers' warnings had been taken seriously a decade ago by the pharmaceutical companies and fda, 12 people might be alive today as a result of a rare form of meningitis connected to contaminated steroid injections. the new england compounding center, located in massachusetts, has been under investigation for making and distributing the contaminated medication to 75 medical facilities in 23 states. the company, which has now surrendered its license to operate, is responsible for the deaths of 12 people, with three more reported in michigan and one each in maryland and virginia. nearly 13,000 patients may have been affected by the contaminated methylprednisolone acetate steroid, which is used to treat pain and inflammation.
1865	the fukushima nuclear disaster radiation levels in fish in the pacific waters remain relatively high, with researchers warning of continued contamination from the site. however, the vast majority of fish caught off japan do not show dangerous radiation levels according to japanese government reports. close to the plant, the reactor byproducts cesium-134 and cesium-137 have detected levels that imply that radiation is still being released into the food chain. the main sources are likely settling in sediment on the sea floor or from groundwater seeping into the ocean from the plant, although both are happening, and researchers are unable to determine which is the more likely source.
1866	australian federal police officers are being deployed to the mh17 crash site in ukraine as part of a dutch-led humanitarian mission. currently, 170 australian federal police officers are in ukraine, with more on the way to join the 11 currently at the crash site. the officers, who will be unarmed, will search for unrecovered bodies and remains and conduct a forensic examination of the crash site, which aims to last for two to three weeks, with the focus on obtaining information for any future investigation.
1867	the search for missing 14-year-old autistic boy, avonte oquendo, is focused on a large railroad yard, as the investigation expands on all transportation systems and areas in the new york area.
1868	three men's health magazine editors, david morton, jamie millar, and mark sansom, each transformed their bodies in just 10 weeks, shedding significant amounts of weight and improving their physical fitness. these men juggled work, family commitments, and daily exercise regimens to achieve extraordinary results. each editor learned from personal trainers and professionals, following a 10-week training plan and committing to a lifestyle change to accomplish their goals. their remarkable transformations are featured in the june issue of the magazine.
1869	netflix, a popular american media giant known for streaming blockbuster movies and tv series over the internet, is set to launch in the uk. this move involves offering tens of thousands of films, including exclusive early access to new films, to uk users. while netflix has experienced controversy and price hikes in the us, they plan to offer video streaming to pcs, tvs, and consoles in the uk instead of focusing on dvd rentals. netflix is also focusing on making a unique service with exclusive deals with major film studios such as paramount pictures, mgm, lions gate entertainment, sony pictures, walt disney motion pictures group, and anchor bay entertainment. customers can expect to see new films released in cinemas being offered by netflix the same way they currently appear on popular services like amazon-owned lovefilm in the uk.
1870	an 80-year-old charity worker suffered neglect at a hospital, despite raising over £100,000 for the institution. ron hands called an ambulance after having a stroke-like swelling in his face, and was taken to the bournemouth general hospital. however, despite raising thousands for the hospital, hands found himself sitting in a wheelchair for most of the night as the emergency services were occupied treating drunk patients. hands, who has not received any special treatment, demanded that elderly patients are treated with more consideration.
1871	75-year-old retired female officer, nancy stowe, recently showed resilience and courage when her 22-year-old grandson was robbed and beaten by two men at a gas station in glastonia, north carolina. stowe sprang into action and successfully scared off the attackers using her old police officer skills, even though she did not have a weapon. both she and her grandson received minor injuries but are recovering well. police are hoping to identify the robbers using footage from the gas station.
1872	the victorian government faces scrutiny for appointing dr. sonia sharp, a senior state education official, who was linked to the shocking child abuse scandal in northern england from 1997 to 2013. this led to at least 1,400 girls being exploited by gangs of men, with many children falling victim due to the racism and fear suppressed by the authorities. dr. sharp's role in rotherham between 2005 and 2006 raises questions about the recruitment policies and ongoing arrangements in the education department under the liberal government. while some defend dr. sharp's role, others demand an explanation and resignations.
1873	stephen lawrence's parents, doreen and neville, maintain their commitment to seeking justice for their murdered son on the 20th anniversary of his tragic death. the investigation into the brutal 1993 racist murder of the 18-year-old architect remains ongoing, as three of the original five suspects have yet to be brought to justice. the murder prompted significant changes in policing practices, leading to greater sensitivity toward race issues and improved accountability.
1874	in summary, this article highlights five lesser-known destinations that offer unique experiences and treasures, despite facing travel warnings and being synonymous with difficult conditions. these include band-e-amir lakes in afghanistan, ciudad perdida trek in colombia, mount damavand in iran, kashmir in india, and mount nyiragongo in the democratic republic of congo.
1875	a possible summary: justin mcgees, 33, and a friend, who died of suspected krokodil use, may be the first victims of the flesh-eating drug in america. krokodil, which is made from codeine and gasoline, eats the body from the inside out and is responsible for thousands of deaths in russia. doctors have found evidence of krokodil in mcgees, including missing, reptilian-like skin. with eight cases reported in the u.s., krokodil, also known as "poor man's meth," continues to spread and cause horrific effects on users, sometimes even requiring amputation.
1876	a new blog reveals photographs of women working in a hijab factory, which is feared to be run by the terror group isis. the images show women dressed in all-black tailoring and stitching hijabs, while children play around them. the factory is believed to be located in the nineveh province, iraq, which has been subject to isis attacks.
1877	private cameron laing, 20, who was expecting a baby boy, tragically died after being crushed against a vehicle during a military exercise on dartmoor. he served with 7 theatre logistic regiment royal logistic corps and had a devastated family who mourn the impact he had on people's lives.
1878	in 2014, samuel l. jackson got confused with laurence fishburne during an interview on ktla's morning show. this interview, aired on 10th february, was an awkward and tense exchange between the two actors. jackson eventually mentioned the mix-up, clarified fishburne's name, and questioned rubin's understanding of the difference between actors.
1879	a tomahawk missile was successfully tested, causing a hole all the way through a moving ship, improving the us navy's ability to launch long-range weapons at moving targets. the current lack of long-range anti-surface missiles makes it difficult to extend the navy's fleet capabilities. tomahawk block iv has the ability to adjust its flight path based on new information given to the missile, enabling it to hit moving targets. testing demonstrated its effectiveness, potentially opening the door to further long-range missile improvements for the navy.
1880	northern ireland's first minister peter robinson apologized to muslim leaders after making controversial remarks on islam. robinson publicly backed a fundamentalist preacher who criticized islam, but he later said that he would not trust muslims to give him religious advice based on sharia law, and insisted he could trust them to conduct small daily tasks. muslim leaders accepted robinson's apology, and the first minister apologized to anyone who might have been offended or upset by his comments.
1881	cristiano ronaldo and lionel messi are once again two of the leading contenders for the fifa ballon d'or award in 2015, which recognizes the world's best soccer player. both players have been named as final three candidates for the prestigious award due to their impressive performances last year. the winners will be announced at a ceremony in zurich on january 12.
1882	a massive, 18-meter yellow inflatable duck created by dutch artist florentijn hofman burst and deflated on new year's day in taiwan's keelung port, leaving locals shocked and disappointed. the duck was part of a multi-city tour across taiwan and had previously faced incidents such as a 2013 deflation in hong kong and a 2009 stabbing in belgium. the cause of the burst remains unknown, with theories ranging from an eagle scratching it with its talons to an unseasonal heatwave affecting its internal pressure.
1883	david bez, a graphic designer, has become known as the salad man. he has worked on creating a positive image for salads and aims to make them a more prominent part of people's diets. in an attempt to become more healthy he began making his own meals for work, eventually setting a challenge to create a salad every lunchtime over 365 days. this attracted attention and inspired him to write a blog, which was turned into a book called salad love.
1884	two young daredevils, max cave and luke harty, were shot with airgun pellets while attempting to scale a rooftop in horsham, sussex. the men were known for scaling buildings without safety equipment and had previously posted a video of themselves climbing a 100-foot crane without any safety gear. a month prior to the incident, local firefighters had condemned their stunts as 'irresponsible and reckless.' the 47-year-old man who fired airgun pellets at the climbers from a nearby window has been arrested and accused of grievous bodily harm.
1885	margaret rowe, a 65-year-old lawyer, claims she lost her £184,000 a year job at fidelity worldwide investment due to objecting to a male boss circulating a nude portrait of his wife to staff at the company. rowe believes this led to her being dismissed, as a result of her "knowing her place" and adoption of a professional and assertive approach. fidelity argues rowe was aggressive and constantly looking for issues, but rowe denies these claims and claims unfair dismissal and sex discrimination. 
1886	crystal palace manager neil warnock admitted he will be very busy with transferring players in before the deadline, after wilfried zaha's return on a season-long loan deal from manchester united. warnock has the opportunity to complete as many as four more deals in the next few days as the transfer deadline approaches.
1887	a new york city taxi driver, koffi komlani, was charged in connection to a january accident where he struck and killed a 9-year-old boy and injured the boy's father. komlani initially received a ticket for failure to yield to a pedestrian but now faces a charge of failing to exercise due care. if convicted, komlani could face up to 15 days in jail, a $750 fine, and the loss of his driver's license. the tragic accident prompted new york city mayor bill de blasio to implement the vision zero program to reduce traffic deaths and prompted a new law named after cooper, which suspends taxi drivers' tlc licenses automatically if they cause harm to pedestrians due to failure to yield.
1888	ups has identified two pilots killed in a plane crash near dubai international airport when the boeing 747-400 aircraft en route to cologne, germany, crashed shortly after takeoff. capt. doug lampe and first officer matthew bell were employed by ups since 1995 and 2006, respectively. the cause of the crash is currently unknown, and the national transportation safety board has dispatched an aviation investigation team to assist in the investigation.
1889	a manhattan apartment block development plans to separate affordable housing tenants from wealthy condo owners with separate doors in an "upscale" development of 55 low-income homes. the 33-story tower is set to include 530 units near the hudson. the affordable units will be located on only the second to sixth floors, with prices ranging from $845 for a studio to $1,099 for two-bedrooms. 
1890	six people were killed and six were injured in a small plane crash at cork airport in southern ireland on thursday, local officials reported. survivors were transported to a nearby hospital, and four of the injured are in serious but not critical condition, with the others described as "comfortable." the crash caused a fire and scattered debris over a large area. flight nm7100, an inbound manx2 airlines flight, was due to land at the cork airport at 9:45 a.m., and was leased from flightline bcn in spain. irish and british experts will lead the accident investigation.
1891	two inmates at a controversial ohio jail have committed suicide in one week, raising concerns about the institution's history of inmate suicides. jeffrey skeele, 27, died at ohio state university's medical center, eight days after being discovered with a bed sheet tied around his neck. spencer mclaughlin, 46, died at the medical center two days after being found with a sheet around his neck. the ohio jail, known for suicide attempts, has a history of staff failure to check inmates, leading to staff members losing their jobs and inmate deaths.
1892	in 2012, an estimated 7 million people died globally due to air pollution, with indoor pollution from cook stoves largely responsible for over half of the deaths. air pollution is now the single largest environmental health risk. most deaths were due to heart disease, stroke, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (copd), and lung cancer. women in developing countries are more exposed to household air pollution than men. outdoor air pollution claimed 3.7 million lives, with cardiovascular diseases being the leading cause of death. 
1893	a dragonhead character named raymond "shrimp boy" chow, who is the leader of a powerful asian gang, has been linked to a chinese official and convicted felon, california state sen. leland yee, under allegations of accepting favor and campaign donations in exchange for legislative help. federal investigations suggest that the two men, along with others, conspired to orchestrate an illicit arms deal, highlighting the presence of organized crime in san francisco's chinatown area.
1894	in february 1997, a container ship called the tokio express was hit by a freak wave, causing it to lose 62 containers overboard, including about 5 million pieces of lego. 17 years later, lego is still washing up on the beaches of cornwall in the uk. the lost containers mostly contained sea-themed lego items such as cutlasses, octopuses, scuba tanks, and flippers. despite the lego's vast journey across the ocean, its true end destination is still unknown. 
1895	police in both austin and dallas are investigating a series of overdoses on synthetic marijuana, also known as k2. the 2011 texas department of state health services made marijuana-like substances found in synthetic marijuana illegal. last week, in a 23-hour period, austin police and ems responded to or received information about 15 possible k2 overdoses, with victims becoming unconscious or responsive and some being violent. in austin, drug arrests were made but no one has been arrested specifically for k2. in dallas, at least 40 overdoses have occurred in the last 48 hours, with narcotics detectives following leads and interviewing overdose victims.
1896	john legend will perform at "cnn heroes: an all-star tribute," featuring hip-hop artist common and canadian r&b singer melanie fiona. the show will also have performances by john legend, aaron eckhart, and bon jovi, and will air on thanksgiving night on cnn.

1898	a kenya bus explosion that killed one and injured dozens was allegedly caused by a 35-year-old tanzanian man with links to a militant group, authorities suspect due to his nervousness and resistance against police checks. the suspect died in the bombing; it remains unclear if he had accomplices. the explosion occurred in nairobi's central business district, with the majority of the injured being ugandans returning home for the holidays. the kenyan and uganda authorities are investigating the incident together, adding extra security for the busy travel period.
1899	a 13-year-old girl who was groomed and raped by an asian sex gang wrote a letter to herself at age 14, expressing the pain and torment she felt from the men who abused her. the girl, named amy, was targeted by the gang beginning at age 13 and at one point was held captive in a bedroom where five men queued outside to have their turn raping her. although amy reported the abuse, no charges have been filed against any of the perpetrators to date. the crimes against amy and other young, vulnerable white girls were known by local authorities, but police and council officials failed to take adequate action and cover up any potential racial aspects related to the abuse. south yorkshire police have yet to prosecute one gang related to such offenses and there have been calls for a public inquiry into the exploitation of vulnerable girls by asian gangs ever since these revelations.
1900	a 'happily married' couple, jared powers and winona valdez of sacramento, california, are suing the owners of a website, cheaterville.com, for exposing their personal information after they found allegations about their relationship on the site. the website, which claims to expose cheaters and has the tagline "don't be the last to know," featured anonymous posts and photographs of alleged cheating by powers and the couple's marriage, with one claiming he was having an affair on craigslist. they are seeking damages for severe distress, loss of reputation and economic losses caused by the postings.
1901	a 79-year-old woman in birmingham, great barr, was told she must exchange her black sacks for a wheelie bin outside her home. the council used google street view to decide which homes could have the new bins, prompting criticism from local councillors and opposition. resident dorothy bradbury expressed concern that her ten steps and steep slope made it impossible to use the new bins as she could injure herself trying, while the council has defended the google street view method as "helpful" in deciding suitable properties for the bins.
1902	bob baker, a 52-year-old lorry driver from essex, was told he was too fat to renew his hgv (heavy goods vehicle) license. this motivated him to start exercising and eating healthier. he lost five stone in nine months and went on to compete in several triathlons, including the clipper venture yacht race, and he plans to climb mount kilimanjaro and trek to the north pole.
1903	social media platforms, such as facebook, showcase that people are no longer shying away from sharing their political stance online. however, people are blocking and hiding friends due to their political disagreements, with concerns over hateful tone and potential physical threats emerging. a number of people have reported blocking, hiding, or muting friends and acquaintances as they don't want an echo chamber of people with identical beliefs. etiquette bloggers and social researchers emphasize being aware of one's audience.
1904	majid hussain, an iraqi immigrant who wrongly claimed £35,000 in benefits over 13 years, has said he did it in accordance with islamic law by not considering the money to be his own.
1905	a new gastrointestinal illness outbreak on a cruise ship, likely caused by the norovirus, has infected 66 passengers and 17 crew members. the ship has implemented sanitation procedures in collaboration with the centers for disease control and prevention to control the spread of the disease, as norovirus can spread easily among the confined quarters of ships. the cause is believed to be the norovirus, but the ship's operator, princess cruises, has not yet confirmed it. this is just one of many recent public health concerns involving norovirus.
1906	friends of 17-year-old claire davis, critically wounded in a colorado high school shooting, are questioning why bad things happen to good people. davis remains in critical condition after being shot in the head; first responders quickly transported her to a nearby hospital. despite her challenging circumstances, doctors and hospital staff are providing her with excellent care. the pierson family, whose son carl allegedly shot her, also offered prayers for davis, stating that they cannot understand their son's actions. davis' classmates described her as a "very sweet girl" who loves horses and has earned the title of "our hero." many social media users have shared thoughts and prayers under the #prayforclaire hashtag.
1907	the prime minister's chief of staff, peta credlin, and her husband, brian loughnane, have faced criticism within the liberal party for their roles as both spouses in influential positions. the party's federal treasurer, phil higginson, expressed his shock in the situation, stating it would never occur in the corporate world and urging immediate action be taken between the two parties. higginson went on to highlight concerns over financial reporting standards and the effect on communication within the liberal party.
1908	the uk government is being pressured to increase high-speed internet access across the country, as 6.4 million people have never been online. official services are increasingly only provided digitally, and almost all 16-to-24-year-olds use the internet compared with just a third of over-75s. lord neville-rolfe, baroness, said ‘broadband and mobile coverage have become essential utilities like water or power’. the government insists that progress is being made in rolling out superfast broadband but some claim that more needs to be done to ensure citizens and businesses can operate online successfully.
1909	peanut corporation of america, known for producing peanut butter and paste, shipped tainted products after testing positive for salmonella. the company's own testing program found multiple instances of salmonella in 2007 and 2008. according to investigations, proper cleaning practices were not used and violations were found in the plant, which led to at least eight deaths. the us food and drug administration (fda) has imposed fines and is working on recalling affected products. consumers are advised to avoid recalled products and check the fda website for updates.
1910	new jersey state assemblyman john wisniewski believes laws were broken when governor chris christie's aides ordered lane closures at the nation's busiest bridge, as he feels public resources and police forces were used for personal political purposes. assemblyman michael carroll said that governor chris christie's administration may face legal trouble amid the bridge scandal revelations.
1911	us defense secretary chuck hagel and china's defense minister chang wanquan discussed a territorial dispute about islands in the east china sea. hagel warned china not to unilaterally establish an air defense zone over the islands and stated the us's obligation to protect japan under the terms of the us-japan bilateral alliance. the two countries also agreed to establish new formal procedures to enable their armies to better communicate. the disputed islands are claimed by both japan and china, with each country laying claim to the islands since the 1970s.
1912	a humpback whale carcass washed up at a public pool in newport beach, sydney, australia after dying on its journey north to warmer waters. the whale was 32 feet in length and caused concern over whether it would be reclaimed by the next high tide or require removal for carcass disposal.
1913	all 38 australians who died when malaysian airlines flight mh17 was shot down in eastern ukraine have been formally identified, the federal government says. operation bring them home will conclude in the coming weeks when the final remains of the victims, who have now been identified by dutch authorities, are reunited with their families. the crash site of the downed malaysia airlines flight mh17, in a field near the village of grabove, in the donetsk region of eastern ukraine.
1914	in 2012, london mayor boris johnson vetoed christian campaigners' advertisements on london buses promoting their message on homosexuality because they suggested gay people could be cured. the christian ads were due to run for two weeks before johnson, as the chair of tfl, intervened to halt the "offensive" campaign, as he said it had no place in a tolerant city.
1915	a video shows an nypd officer beating 20-year-old donovan lawson with a baton at the myrtle avenue stop in brooklyn. this assault, which possibly involves excessive force, occurs after lawson attempts to enter the subway without paying the fare, and is recorded by onlookers. lawson was pepper sprayed before the baton attack, resulting in a gash to his head, and he was later hospitalized. lawson was later charged for multiple offenses.
1916	frotox is a new procedure that offers an alternative to botox treatments for treating wrinkles. iovera, nicknamed frotox, uses liquid nitrogen to freeze away wrinkles by targeting specific nerves in the forehead, without using botulinum. it has been developed by a california-based medical technology company called myoscience, which has recently introduced the treatment in the uk. while the procedure offers results immediately, its long-term benefits, safety, and effectiveness are still being studied, making it potentially less predictable and repeatable compared to botox.
1917	in 2013, composer andrew lloyd-webber warned of the apollo theatre's 'shocking' condition and called for its tear down. ten years later, plaster fell from the ceiling, injuring 80 members of the audience during a performance, leading to investigations into possible factors and concerns of safety checks.
1918	british actor ricky sekhon, 29, who portrays former al-qaeda leader osama bin laden in the movie zero dark thirty, discusses the difficulty of preparing for the role. he only found out he would be portraying bin laden once he was successful in the audition process. as a result of the role, sekhon signed a non-disclosure agreement with the filmmakers, although he shared the information with his family and girlfriend. the film is hotly predicted to win several awards.
1919	kfc's campaign for taylor swift in the triple j hottest 100 countdown may have caused her disqualification due to a possible violation of the countdown's strict policy by offering an incentive for fans to vote. the fast food chain offered a $19.89 voucher, with its support receiving mixed reactions from fans, some displeased, and others pleased that swift may not make it onto the countdown. 
1920	twenty military statues were unveiled in trafalgar square in london to raise awareness and understanding of the sacrifices made by britain's serving and wounded personnel. cast in clear acrylic and designed by sculptor stuart murdoch, each statue represents the individual and depicts a soldier wounded in battle in iraq, afghanistan, kosovo, or bosnia. the statues will embark on separate tours of the uk, visiting local communities, military establishments, schools, and museums. help for heroes, which sponsored the initiative, hopes to raise £1 million for the charity through public donations.
1921	phillip lemonheigh disguised his wife's car in a fake ambulance using flashing blue lights and 'emergency response' stickers, driving it for three months across the uk. he was caught speeding and running traffic signals, but claimed to be a volunteer ambulance driver at the time. lemonheigh was arrested and will be sentenced for dangerous driving but is already facing an interim disqualification ahead of his march 20 court hearing.
1922	south sudan has ranked as the most fragile nation in the world due to its fractious leadership, mass killings, and ethnic violence, leading the nonprofit fund for peace to label south sudan as the 10th most fragile nation. the united states has also worsened over the past year, joining nations such as france, the united kingdom, and china in being listed as "quite coincidentally" on the most-improved nations list alongside countries with tense relations with the united states. the united states has struggled with political issues, such as the lack of bipartisanship in congress, contributing to its worsening status in the past year.
1923	a new conspiracy claiming the british military was involved in the deaths of princess diana, her boyfriend, and their driver is being debunked by british police. the recent accusation, sent to both the military and london police, alleged involvement by members of the british royal air service commando unit. this claim has resurfaced as the 16th anniversary of the tragedy approaches, but experts do not anticipate any significant new developments in the investigation. 
1924	celebrities such as myleene klass and julie walters have volunteered to wear festive knitwear, promoting save the children's christmas jumper day fundraiser, which aims to raise money for vulnerable and poverty-stricken children around the world. last year's event saw over 275,000 people take part, and brands like john lewis are teaming up with the charity to boost participation and increase donations.
1925	fake disney frozen merchandise, such as snap bracelets, have been found to be unsafe due to being made of sections of cut steel measuring tape covered in cheap, thin plastic. the bracelets could possibly cause injury due to the sharp metal edge. the council has issued a warning and urges parents to avoid such cheap merchandise.
