2935	a jury has ordered robin thicke and pharrell williams to pay $7.4 million in damages and profits for allegedly copying marvin gaye's song "got to give it up" for their hit "blurred lines." this case highlights the issue of music copyright, with similarities between songs often leading to legal disputes. recently, tom petty and jeff lynne were given songwriting credits for sam smith's song "stay with me," after petty's team noticed its similarity to petty's 1989 hit "i won't back down." the music industry has seen multiple cases of alleged copying, with songs such as van halen's "hot for teacher" and george harrison's "my sweet lord" both attracting lawsuits over similarities to other compositions. infringement cases often challenge the plaintiff's proof of substantial similarity between songs, and whether the defendant had access to the original material. understanding the complexities of music copyright is essential for musicians, with legal disputes frequently impacting their careers and financial stability.
2936	england's under 21 head coach gareth southgate is looking forward to a significant anniversary in his career, with october 20, 2009, a significant date in his life, marking his sacking from middlesbrough. however, faced with adversity, southgate learned from the experience, growing in areas such as management and leadership, subsequently allowing him to find his way back to the football world. today, after a tumultuous career, southgate is thriving, leading england's under 21 team and having a direct impact on their success.
2937	a flight from venezuela carrying 30 suitcases containing 1.3 tons of pure cocaine arrived in paris, with the suitcases not registered to any of the passengers. french authorities discovered the cocaine when they opened the suitcases, with a street value of about 200 million euros. the investigation involved cooperation with other countries such as spain, britain, and the netherlands. venezuela's public ministry detained three members of the national guard regarding the incident, and the ministry will investigate additional criminal activities.
2938	this article discusses xherdan shaqiri, a skilled winger who has faced stiff competition for playing time at bayern munich. despite his impressive progress, shaqiri has expressed his desire to leave and potentially play in the premier league. in a highly anticipated match during the fifa world cup against argentina, shaqiri could potentially showcase his skills against the incredibly talented lionel messi. the argentine team's defensive issues and overall balance may cause concern for coaches and media, as they aim to secure a victory while maintaining balance in the game.
2939	in a match between wales and england, wales won 1-0 with a goal by young player liam angel. england aimed to find a way back, but poor weather conditions made it difficult for them, and they ultimately couldn't catch up. wales' goalscorer, angel, celebrated at the final whistle. wales now plays northern ireland and scotland to end the tournament.
2940	paul gascoigne, a troubled former footballer, balances precariously on a ledge while cleaning windows at his top-floor flat. during this incident, onlookers complimented his focus and physical fitness after a series of alcohol-related incidents. gascoigne, who has struggled with alcohol addiction, has been undergoing rehabilitation near his home in bournemouth.

2942	a six-story townhouse in manhattan, new york, designed by financier mark zittman and his wife noelle, is being offered on the market for $48 million, making it the most expensive townhouse listing in the area. the stunning property features six bedrooms, seven bathrooms, a suburban-style three-car garage, and a rooftop lap pool, complete with a gym and powder room. the luxurious estate also includes amenities like a wood-burning fireplace, a courtyard terrace, a playroom, a media room with bar, and a billiards table.
2943	toni mchugh, the mistress of convicted wife-killer gerard baden-clay, revealed in an interview that she dreamt of a future with him and his three daughters before his wife allison was killed by him. the mistress hopes to write a book about the case, cope with emotional and financial damage, and apologize to allison's children.
2944	olympic and commonwealth gold medalist greg rutherford adds european long jump champion title to his list of achievements. he recently revealed his girlfriend susie verrill is expecting their first child and broke records as british record holder after jumping 8.51 meters in san diego. rutherford also secured his place at the top of the long jump podium in zurich with an impressive leap of 8.29 meters, beating nearest rival louis tsatoumas of greece by 14 centimeters.
2945	scientists have discovered a new signalling pathway for adenosine, a molecule known to activate brown fat cells. by experimenting on mice, they found that if adenosine binds to the adenosine receptor a2a in brown fat cells, fat burning is stimulated. the study in mice suggests that adenosine could potentially help in the treatment of obesity by converting white fat cells into brown ones or by activating the brown ones already present in the body. while the research is promising, clinical application is still far off.
2946	wigan athletic's loss to sheffield wednesday at the dw stadium was overshadowed by the news that returning striker grant holt is likely to face up to a year on the sidelines with a suspected cruciate knee ligament injury. the 10-man latics were beaten 1-0 by the owls, ending 2014 on a disappointing note and starting the new year in the sky bet championship's bottom three. the team's problems in front of goal persisted, with holt expected to have aided their offense before an injury setback.
2947	top tax experts undermined a recent proposal by shadow chancellor ed balls to raise income tax for those earning over £150,000 to 50p due to concerns over low returns and only making a "marginal contribution" to reducing the budget deficit. 31 business leaders have now opposed these plans, warning that it would deter business and destroy jobs.
2948	the deane family in utah faced relentless harassment from teenagers, who threw toilet paper at their house for four months. instead of pressing charges, they chose to ask the culprits to donate the rolls. the campaign went viral on social media, resulting in over 1,000 rolls being donated to the kamas food bank.
2949	cleethorpes pier, located in lincolnshire, is a 335ft (102m) working pleasure pier with a nightclub, theatre, bar, and restaurant. originally opened in 1873, it has undergone multiple redevelopments and ownership changes over the years. however, current owner bryn irlsey is selling it to invest elsewhere, and swindells auctioneers will hold the auction on february 2.
2950	thusha kamaleswaran, a 7-year-old girl who was paralyzed by a stray bullet in a gang war, has never given up hope. doctors once said she would be permanently paralyzed and confined to a wheelchair. now, thusha is astonishing doctors by defying their diagnosis and standing again. after her recovery, thusha appeared on itv's daybreak, where she said she was looking forward to playing with her friends and traveling the world. her progress has inspired her family while her courage and hard work make her story even more remarkable.
2951	a seattle woman, julia stafford, was attacked and dragged 20 feet by a grizzly bear while working for a canadian mining company in alaska. she survived with minor injuries, including a broken bone in her hand and cuts on her right hand. the attack occurred on a day when a hiker in denali national park and preserve was also killed by a grizzly bear, marking the first fatal bear mauling in the park's history.
2952	financial journalist david cay johnston had to retract his first-ever column for reuters on a tax story about rupert murdoch's news corp. his mistake was the company received a $4.8 billion tax refund for the past four years, which was 100% false. the error was highlighted by robert s. mcintyre, who pointed out the mistake in reporting outflows instead of tax inflows since 2007. johnston has won a pulitzer prize for financial reporting and teaches at syracuse university college of law.
2953	after quarterback peyton manning's neck surgery prevented him from playing in the 2011 season, the indianapolis colts faced several challenges and struggled, especially in a game that led to a nationally televised, 62-7 loss. despite having a team full of "pro bowl" players, the colts lacked the one irreplaceable element in their team, which ultimately contributed to their weak performance this season. without manning, the decision to proceed with the team's future would include paying a large sum of money and weighing a decision between keeping manning or moving forward with quarterback andrew luck.
2954	motorists are breaking down in cold weather due to a possible contamination problem with diesel fuel, as reported by the aa. the organization is investigating if a rogue batch of contaminated fuel is to blame or whether the problems are limited to specific filling stations. calls about affected vehicles began in the north east, with vehicles feeling 'sluggish' and losing power shortly after a fill-up. the aa suggests that drivers keep records of receipts to receive reimbursement or compensation for any repair work needed. 
2955	circus performer igor zaripov, also known as 'mouth of steel', holds three world records for his impressive feats with his powerful jaws. he has pulled a 12,360kg double-decker bus, pulled a car 100 feet in just 15.7 seconds, and held a suspension position for two minutes and 32 seconds. zaripov believes speaking only in russian on the day of his stunts makes his jaws stronger and more powerful, and he has developed his own fitness program, cza fitness, to help others achieve their goals with his unique coaching method. zaripov is a member of cirque du soleil and comes from a long line of circus performers, who trace their roots back to 1893.
2956	former haitian dictator jean-claude "baby doc" duvalier, accused of plundering the country and committing human rights violations, was charged on tuesday, but it's not clear what the charges are. he was kept away from journalists upon arrival and only interacted with a few close friends. human rights groups have called for justice for his crimes, and several individuals are fighting for justice against him.
2957	a senior british diplomat's house was raided by counter-terrorism police, with his son james arrested under counter-terrorism legislation. james was later released on bail after police discovered he had not been involved with the alleged tip-off. his father, nicholas sutcliffe, is a first secretary to the foreign office and was posted to brazil in the 1990s before returning to whitehall in 2001. the raid by police was believed to be in response to a tip-off about potential chemical weapons stored at the family home. the patel family was also affected by the police operation, with kuntal patel, believed to be the daughter of an east london magistrate, also being arrested; however, she was released on bail.

2959	new research from the university of edinburgh suggests that taking short breaks, resting, and closing your eyes for 10 minutes can significantly improve memory in adults. this finding adds to previous research that has shown rest and wakeful rest can have a positive effect on both long-term and short-term memory consolidation in people of all ages.
2960	the iphone 5s' fingerprint sensor is a new security feature used to unlock the phone. experts suggest there's still a need for concern over user privacy, as fingerprints in a database could potentially be accessed by the government or hackers. however, apple has stated the prints are encrypted and will not be saved on icloud or the company's servers. 
2961	west yorkshire police are investigating claims that on-duty police officers attended weekly "breakfast clubs" at the apartment of paedophile jimmy savile, who hosted the events and had off-duty police officers in attendance over a 20-year period. while there may be no suggestion that guests knew of savile's catalogue of sexual offences, further enquiries are being made to better understand the nature of the relationship between jimmy savile and the officers. 
2962	the kenyan government and the international criminal court have agreed to establish a tribunal to prosecute those responsible for the violent post-election crisis in 2007-2008, with a deadline of july 2010. if the tribunal isn't set up, the government will refer the case to the court's prosecutor. further investigations by the kenyan government will provide the icc with a report on the case to carry out preliminary examinations. the violence nearly tore apart the african country with nearly 1,500 deaths and hundreds of thousands displaced following a disputed election.
2963	the blackpool airport has closed permanently, marking an end to its 105-year history. the final passenger flight departed for the isle of man, leaving 118 people jobless, as the airport prepares to officially shut down. the lancashire airport faced financial struggles in recent years, suffering around £2m in yearly losses. blackpool airport has a rich history, serving as an important transportation link for over a century, welcoming royalty, celebrities, and hosting air shows for the public.

2975	edgar froese, the founder of german electronic rock band tangerine dream, passed away at the age of 70 due to the effects of a pulmonary embolism in vienna. born on d-day, froese was the only constant member of tangerine dream, which released over 100 albums and soundtracks during their career. they also contributed music for hollywood hits like risky business and grand theft auto v. froese's unique sound, influenced by pink floyd, played a significant role in shaping trance and electronica genres.
2976	in response to a hypothetical situation where friends need help covering up a violent crime, four unsuspecting people were asked to hide staged evidence and claim innocence when questioned by fake police. all four complied without hesitation and some ultimately went to great lengths to protect their loved ones. the experiment reveals that even though most people follow the law, when it comes to protecting those they care about, there are many willing to break the rules.

2978	the original texts of popular children's stories like cinderella and snow white are darker than previously believed, according to a translation from the original german folk tales by jacob and wilhelm grimm. in the first edition, published in 1812, cinderella's stepsisters cut off parts of their feet with a knife to fit into the glass slipper, and snow white's mother orders the huntsman to 'stab her to death'. the changes made were 'immense', as many tales were heavily edited or deleted for later editions, with up to 50 tales edited out.
2979	a time bomb went off in a hotel room at the traders hotel in rangoon, injuring a female american tourist and her family members. the 22-storey, five-star hotel is popular with foreign tourists and business people. security officials have arrested three men in connection to the bombing, which is currently under investigation to determine the motive behind these attacks.
2980	futoshi toba, a father of two and the mayor of rikuzentakata in japan's iwate prefecture, has lost his wife due to last year's tsunami. as the father to 13-year-old taiga and 11-year-old kanato, toba drives his children to school each day, passing the spot where his old house – in which his wife had perished – before reaching their safe schools. as a single parent and the mayor, toba's daily routine includes answering questions and requests from residents while managing the rebuilding process of a town that was once devastated by the tsunami. despite being overwhelmed by time, toba sees the opportunity to be both a father and an advocate for rikuzentakata, encouraging others to stay through the rebuilding process in the city that will prioritize the needs of residents during the next eight years of reconstruction.
2981	the uk's obesity epidemic has led to concerns about space on airplanes, with economy seats becoming increasingly cramped. airfarewatchdog.com founder george hobica proposes designating specific rows of 'wide' economy seats for passengers who require additional space due to their size. this solution offers up to 50% more seat recline and extra legroom for passengers, while costing the same as extra legroom options often offered by airlines. while recent surveys have shown mixed results on the feasibility of a 'fat tax' for obese passengers, the issue of accommodating obesity on airplanes is gaining attention from the public, businesses, and airlines.
2982	icelandic women's rights activist hildur lilliendahl viggósdóttir was banned from facebook for 30 days after posting a threatening message she received on her facebook page. viggósdóttir, who has an album called 'men who hate women,' had reposted the threatening message sent to her, but was given the ban because facebook prohibits users from screen shots and reposting other users' facebook statuses without written permission from the author. an outcry followed from iceland, and a petition against facebook's policy has garnered close to 1,500 signatures. facebook defended its action, stating they aim to prevent bullying on their platform and require victims to report abusive content.

2984	the first color image of rosetta's comet, 67p, has revealed its true nature. it shows the comet's surface as a slightly different shade of grey from previous pictures and does not have surface ice. the color image was created using the osiris camera on the rosetta spacecraft.
2985	madeleine shaw, health and wellness expert and best friend of millie mackintosh, suggests adding a daily green juice to your diet to improve health and feel better. though many glossy a-listers undergo juice cleanses, shaw argues that having a small daily juice alongside one's regular diet can provide numerous health benefits. these juices are made of freshly squeezed fruits and vegetables, full of nutrients, and can help you feel better, sleep better, and look more youthful. however, store-bought juices should be avoided due to their loss of nutrients and preservatives, opting rather for freshly made green juice.

2989	a new study found that the ideal body weight and size for women is 10 stone or less by wearing a size 14 or above. 94% of those surveyed believed that these weights and sizes are undesirable and unattractive. the celebrities with the most desirable bodies were davina mccall, the duchess of cambridge, and holly willoughby. for men, researchers found that a waist measurement of 36 inches was the tipping point for starting a diet, and they perceived larger body sizes as more acceptable. however, people should focus on reaching a healthy bmi and weight instead of striving for an airbrushed model figure.
2990	a homeless shelter in california, maryhouse, provides resources and support for women and their infants, with a 29% increase in served children last year. as republican-controlled house plans to cut spending on the women, infants and children (wic) program by 10%, wic advocates and some democrats oppose the cuts. president obama has proposed an increase in wic funding for the 2012 budget, but a spending plan for that year must be in effect by march 4 to avoid a government shutdown.
2991	to celebrate the 200th anniversary of napoleon bonaparte's arrival on elba, italy's third largest island, a series of elaborate reenactments were held. hundreds of napoleon enthusiasts dressed in period costumes travel to the island each year to reenact the french emperor's arrival; this year's event was special as it marked his bicentennial on elba. residents of the island fondly remember napoleon's legacy, as he is credited with improving their lives. upcoming bicentennial events include exhibiting a large field tent that napoleon used during his military campaigns, a yacht race named after him, and visits to various historical sites associated with him. elba is a popular vacation island for romans, known for former residences and monuments connected to napoleon.
2992	saif al-islam, son of libya's former leader muammar gaddafi, has had the ends of his thumb and forefinger amputated as he prepares to face trial on corruption and war crimes charges. human rights groups express concerns over his treatment, which has included being held in solitary confinement without legal counsel. the libyan government aims to uphold international standards for trials.
2993	actress shana dowdeswell died after downing several shots in a new york bar, and her mother blames the bar for serving her alcohol despite being visibly drunk. dowdeswell, who was 23, was found with a blood alcohol content of 0.39, five times the legal limit for driving. she passed away five days after her overdose. the bar claimed they only served her four shots of whiskey and she had been drinking water. dowdeswell's mother wants to launch a campaign against overdrinking and wants to see police enforcing rules on serving alcohol to intoxicated patrons.
2994	at the ringling bros. and barnum & bailey circus in atlanta, a visually impaired three-year-old boy named eli hummer, along with other children from a center for the visually impaired, joined in the "blind-touch tour" of the circus, where they experienced and interacted with it in an up-close way, touching and trying various props and activities, thus providing sensory experiences for them. the children were given a unique opportunity to experience and appreciate this spectacle thanks to the ringling brothers, and to learn about what a circus is, visually impaired children got front-row seats and the chance to interact with performers and try out props around the circus ring.
2995	the nfl has resumed business after being ruled against twice in court this week, allowing coaches to give out playbooks, work on football during off-season training, and access to weight rooms. the labor impasse between the nfl and its players has lasted for over two months, and a ruling from the appeals court may grant a stay and prevent irreparable harm to the nfl's business. the nfl has 2-months to appeal the ruling, where they need to argue that they will be irreparably harmed if the request for a stay isn't granted. the best-case scenario for fans would be for the legal rulings' and prospect for more litigation and acrimony to prompt both sides to return to the bargaining table and make real concessions.

2998	john kitzhaber, oregon's governor, announced that his fiancée, cylvia hayes, will not have any role in his administration for the remainder of his fourth term due to concerns about her consulting work. hayes will maintain her consulting business but will not work for organizations related to the state of oregon. kitzhaber faced questions about hayes' taxes, including reports that she received $118,000 for a fellowship with a green energy group and that the income may not have been reported on her taxes. the governor stated that he and hayes file separate tax returns and he will not discuss her tax situation.

3000	apple's iphone 6 has been announced as the fastest on the market, according to independent researchers who tested the performance of new iphone 6, iphone 6 plus, samsung gala. s5, sony experia z2, lg g3, and iphone 5c phones. apple's new phones were tested for processing speed and were found to be the fastest when geekbench 3 software, designed to replicate typical phone usage, was used. however, experts anticipate that apple's place as the fastest will not last long, with sony experia z3 and samsung galaxy note 4 expected to give apple's new handsets a run for their money.
